After over a decade of waiting, we finally welcome Perdomo Double Aged 12-Year Vintage. It’s a three part release that’s sure to knock your impatient socks off. Nick has outdone himself this time around, shelling out three separate blends that each lay claim to 12-year-old, exquisitely fermented tobacco leaves. Dressed in Connecticut, Sun Grown, and Maduro wrappers, Double Aged 12-Year Vintage has a selection for every cigar lover out there. All of the tobaccos in each blend – wrapper, binder, and filler – go through an extensive “double aging” process. They are bale-aged for ten years before moving on to barrel-aging in charred, white oak bourbon barrels for the next two years, resulting in a refined product that’s brimming with flavor. This process ensures that the crop from 2001 has impeccable color, texture, aroma, and flavor. The Maduro variation explodes with notes of dark chocolate and coffee. Naturally sweet with rich and robust complexity, a long, cool finish awaits you with every Double Aged 12-Year Vintage Maduro. This gem begs to be lit as soon as you gaze upon it and take note of the super oily Nicaraguan maduro wrapper leaf. Plumped up with pristine Nicaraguan long-fillers, this medium to full-bodied hit-maker deserves a spot in your rotation.

prod_name: Perdomo Double Aged 12 Year Vintage Sun Grown
desc: Dating back to 2001, these blends have age on their side.In 2001, Britney Spears was #1 on the billboard charts, Enron filed for bankruptcy, and the nasty combination of Curt Schilling and Randy Johnson led the Arizona Diamondbacks to the World Series. Just when I thought 2001 was a thing of the past, Perdomo Double Aged 12-Year Vintage came across my desk. Nick has outdone himself this time around, shelling out three separate blends that each lay claim to 12-year-old, exquisitely fermented tobacco leaves. Dressed in Connecticut, Sun Grown, and Maduro wrappers, Double Aged 12-Year Vintage has a selection for every cigar lover out there. All of the tobaccos in each blend – wrapper, binder, and filler – go through an extensive “double aging” process. They are bale-aged for ten long years before moving on to barrel-aging in charred, white oak bourbon barrels for the next two years, resulting in a refined product that’s brimming with flavor. This process ensures that the crop from 2001 has impeccable color, texture, aroma, and flavor. The Sun Grown variation demands your attention from the get-go with bold flavors of oak and almond. This smooth stunner has a delightful sweet spice and a long, relaxing finish. Equipped with a Nicaraguan Sun Grown wrapper leaf and perfectly cut Nicaraguan long-fillers, Double Aged 12-Year Vintage Sun Grown proves to be a medium-bodied masterpiece. But you better hurry – these limited quantities won’t last for very long.

Top-shelf from the top-dogPerdomo Estate Seleccion Vintage is a trilogy of perfectly aged, top-shelf blends from a living cigar legends: Nick Perdomo. Each of the three entries in this series features limited edition tobaccos that have been resting in Perdomo’s factory for years, delivering a flavor unlike any cigar you’ve had before. Let’s get over the hump right now: Estate Seleccion Vintage isn’t cheap, but it’s worth every single penny. The Estate Seleccion Vintage Connecticut is a beautiful blond blend that we can all get behind. A seamless Ecuadorian Connecticut wrapper guards Nicaraguan long-fillers, and while the cigar might be mellow in body, it’s full in flavor. Some cigars claim to be creamy, but ESV Connecticut is the real deal. That cream is joined by cedar and sweet caramel for a cigar that competes with any other Connecticut on the market. If you love a cigar with your coffee, or a great smooth blend, you owe it to yourself to try ESV Connecticut. ​

An unbeatable maduroThere’s a common myth in the cigar world: that you want the freshest cigars possible. While some premiums are ready as soon as they hit the shelves, most sticks benefit a ton from taking a long rest in a properly maintained humidor. Want me to put my money where my mouth is? Grab one of these Estate Seleccion Vintage offerings from Nick Perdomo, and you’ll see just how good properly aged tobaccos can be. It’s hard to pick a favorite out of these three blends, but if you’re a fan of rich, bold blends, than Estate Seleccion Vintage Maduro is going to be your choice. The wrapper reminds me of dark chocolate, and it carries right through to the flavor. The Nicaraguan long-fillers bring the spice, and all together this cigar is a perfect marriage of cedar, coffee, and earthiness that you’ll only find in the best maduros. Jump on this one, friends, before they all disappear.​

prod_name: Perdomo Estate Seleccion Vintage Sun Grown
desc: Sun Grown for extra flavorThe Perdomo Estate Vintage Seleccion line of cigars has a ton going for it. It’s made by Nick Perdomo, one of the most famous men working in the industry today. It comes from Perdomo’s esteemed Nicaraguan factory. And each blend features perfectly aged cigars that have been kept in ideal condition to achieve an amazing flavor. Offered in three different varieties, we’re going to examine the Sun Grown offering today. Those who enjoy Perdomo’s other offerings will know that Nick knows how to use sun grown wrappers better than almost anyone else, and ESV Sun Grown is no exception. Medium-bodied and complex, you’ll find oak, pepper, and coffee in an awesome balance that stays interesting every puff. Grab a box while you can, or try a 5-pack of each blend to figure out your favorite. ​

Factory fresh at your door.The Tabacalera Perdomo tours have become the stuff of folklore, and the highlight of these fun-filled excursions is the famous and exclusive Perdomo Factory Tour Blends. After much cajoling and outright begging, these special cigars are being released to the public…so dig in.  Perdomo Factory Tour Blend Connecticut comes dressed in an Ecuadoran Connecticut wrapper nestling a Nicaraguan binder from the Jalapa Valley and Nicaraguan long-fillers from Esteli. This mellow to medium-bodied blend plays host to a ton of flavors including cream, cedar, nuts, citrus, and spice with a subtle mix of sweetness and pepper on the finish. The time is now to fill up on these blends and experience the flavors of the Perdomo factory from the comfort of your home.

A factory fresh exclusive blend.If you’ve been lucky enough to experience a Tabacalera Perdomo tour, then you know all about the treats we have in store for you. To the uninitiated, the highlight of the tour for cigar nuts is sampling the exclusive Perdomo Factory Tour Blends, unavailable to the public…until now. Perdomo Factory Tour Blend Maduro utilizes a long-filler blend from Condega and Esteli, Nicaragua tucked under a Nicaraguan Maduro wrapper from Jalapa. With cascading flavors of chocolate, coffee, nuts, spice, pepper, and earth, this medium to full-bodied blend will dazzle your palate. Add some of these to your cart and experience the flavors of the Tabacalera Perdomo Factory today.​​

prod_name: Perdomo Factory Tour Blend Sun Grown
desc: Full-bodied and factory fresh.Tabacalera Perdomo’s tours include a sampling of exclusive blends only available to those present. Nick Perdomo has heard the calls, the emails, the outright pleading for these blends to be released to the public and he finally relented. Introducing the Perdomo Factory Tour Blends, now the flavors of the factory are now available to you in the comfort of your home.Perdomo Factory Tour Blend Sun Grown comes adorned with a Nicaraguan Sun Grown wrapper from Jalapa over long-fillers from Condega and Esteli, Nicaragua. This stout full-bodied blend delivers flavors including pepper, baking spices, nuts, wood, earth, and leather with a pleasant and smooth finish. For a taste of Tabacalera Perdomo’s finest, add some of these gems to your cart now.​​

I’ll take my Perdomo cigar....Fresco style.Hold the elaborate packaging and expensive marketing ploys, and pile on some handmade goodness from Perdomo. The Perdomo Fresco is a handsome no-nonsense handmade from Nicaragua teeming with top-notch tobaccos. Fresco comes chock full of aged Nicaraguan long-fillers from the fertile valley of Esteli secured by a Jalapa binder, and nestled beneath hand-selected natural or maduro wrappers. A smooth and well-balanced blend, Fresco cigars deliver renowned Perdomo quality at everyday prices. Thanks to a silky smooth Connecticut wrapper, the natural delivers a mild to medium-bodied experience boasting smooth and creamy nuances backed by an undeniable note of cedar. While the Maduro, equipped with an oily and dark Connecticut broadleaf, exudes a medium to full-bodied burn highlighted by deep notes of espresso, spice, and leather. The addition of the Sun Grown wrapper really completes the brand. With it comes an ample amount of spice and pepper, and finishes with a sweet earthiness.
Wrapper: Connecticut Broadleaf, Ecuador Connecticut, Habano Maduro, Sun Grown

desc: One-of-a-kind puros from Perdomo cigars.Perdomo’s Fresh-Rolled Cuban Wheels are legendary. These Nicaraguan puros are jammed-packed with luscious, well-aged tobaccos that produce a medium-body with a robust and heavy, rich-sweet taste. Notes of earth, spice and cedar coat the palate with a profile that’ll suit any cigar enthusiast. These beauties are then packaged in massive wheels of 40, proving we can have both quantity and quality. Best of all, you get Perdomo quality cigars for rock-bottom prices — this deal spells bang for the buck.

Bourbon + cigars = bliss.Some things just go together naturally, Kim Kardashian and rappers, Oprah and diets, and bourbon and cigars. Nick Perdomo, one of the hardest working men in the cigar biz, seamlessly melds 2 of American’s favorite pastimes, the enjoyment of the good brown elixir and a premium handmade cigar, in his new Perdomo Habano Bourbon Barrel-Aged line.Perdomo Bourbon Barrel-Aged Connecticut uses an Ecuadoran Connecticut wrapper that was aged for at least six years prior to being aged in a bourbon barrel for an additional 6 months. The blend is completed with a mix of aged long-fillers from Condega, Jalapa, and Esteli Nicaragua delivering a mellow to medium-bodied profile. Expect a rich, creamy blend with the subtle influence of the bourbon barrel on the finish.  ​

The next step in cigars.Sometimes due to diligence or luck you stumble upon a perfect pairing and ask yourself why no one had thought of this sooner…like the first time someone added Nutella to a peanut butter and jelly sandwich. A similar experiment has resulted in the new line of cigars from Perdomo, 3 delicious blends that were aged in bourbon barrels. Perdomo Habano Bourbon Barrel-Aged Maduro is dressed in a maduro wrapper that was aged at least 6 years before it was aged for an additional 14 months in bourbon barrels. Completing the blend are aged premium long-fillers from Condega, Jalapa, and Esteli Nicaragua. This cigar boasts a medium to full-bodied profile with hints of cocoa and coffee with flavors from the bourbon barrel settling in behind the scenes. Add these to your cart and experience the next evolution in premium cigars. ​

prod_name: Perdomo Habano Bourbon Barrel-Aged Sun Grown
desc: A small step for cigars, a giant leap for your palate.Sometimes innovation is nothing more than trickery or gimmicks, and other times a new product or idea is truly innovative and evolutionary…case in point, the new cigar line from Nick Perdomo. Perdomo Habano Bourbon Barrel-Aged cigars is a step forward and successfully blends 2 of America’s great loves, bourbon and cigars.Perdomo Habano Bourbon Barrel-Aged Sungrown features a wrapper that has been double aged, first for at least 6 years before being put to sleep for an additional 10 months in bourbon barrels. The blend is finished off with a mix of long-fillers from Jalapa, Condega, and Esteli, Nicaragua resulting in a full-bodied blend with flavors of spice and earth with background nuances from the bourbon barrel. Try these for yourself and take an adventure into the next frontier in the cigar industry.​

Beautiful, right down to the price.The Perdomo Lot 23 cigar brand ref​ers to a field of special tobaccos cultivated in the year 2000. That was when Nick Perdomo planted an experimental crop on a virgin field which he called Lot 23. This field produced a very small crop of tobaccos, and these tobaccos, 6 years later, were carefully blended together to create a unique Nicaraguan handmade.So there you have it. Lot 23 cigars are filled and bound solely by tobaccos grown on one, small field. The wrapper is a caramel-brown Connecticut-seed leaf from the 5th and 6th priming that serves up ample creaminess. The fillers, a rich blend of dark Nicaraguan tobaccos bound by a robust Nicaraguan binder. The result: a super-smooth, medium-bodied cigar with enjoyable hints of espresso and nuts.Perdomo Lot 23 recently received a 90-point rating, which commented: "An oily robusto with a great draw. It has a very leathery core complemented by cedar, coffee, and orange peel notes. Rich and tasty."Note: Perdomo Lot 23 has received a packaging update. We currently have a mix of old & new packaging, so you may receive either. Rest assured, the cigars are the same, only the packaging has changed.

​Perdomo's true Connecticut cigar.Take the same vintage, Cuban-seed long-fillers from Nicaragua as the standard Lot 23 cigars and blend them inside a true Connecticut shade wrapper. The result is Perdomo Lot 23 Connecticut. This silky-smooth wrapper complements the bold and rich, Nicaraguan tobaccos perfectly, creating a lovely, mellow to medium-bodied experience. A rich core of tobacco, earth, and coffee bean is paired with delightfully smooth and crisp element from the wrapper, creating a wonderful any time cigar built for daily enjoyment.​Note: Perdomo Lot 23 has received a packaging update. We currently have a mix of old & new packaging, so you may receive either. Rest assured, the cigars are the same, only the packaging has changed.

​A darker variety of Perdomo's sales juggernaut.Just like the traditional Perdomo Lot 23 cigars, this maduro version utilizes all of its tobaccos from one, small tobacco field in Nicaragua. The only difference is the wrapper. Instead of a Connecticut-seed leaf, Perdomo selected a beautiful Broadleaf Maduro, one glistening with oils and toothy in texture. The result is a rich, almost chocolatey flavor that's smooth and gradual, complementing the creamy, peanuty nuances from the long-fillers inside quite nicely. Of course, the p​rice is the same, keeping Lot 23 cigars among the finest, every day super-premiums on the market.Note: Perdomo Lot 23 has received a packaging update. We currently have a mix of old & new packaging, so you may receive either. Rest assured, the cigars are the same, only the packaging has changed.

All the things you love about Perdomo....miniaturized.Good things come in small packages, right? And nowhere is this truer than right here, with Perdomo Minis. When you need a quick stick but you still crave premium quality, these tasty cigarillos are the bee's knees. Utilizing top-notch wrappers and fillers, expect big-time flavor in a tidy, convenient package. And if you're one of the many fans of the full-sized Perdomo line, the Minis should be on your short list (yes…pun intended). Available in three varieties:Connecticut – Mellow to medium-bodied. Ecuador Connecticut wrapper over a creamy, toasty core of Nicaraguan fillers.Maduro – Dark, rich maduro wrapper. Medium to full-bodied with fully developed flavors of coffee, cocoa, sweet cedar, and earth.Sun Grown – Medium to full-bodied. Rich and spicy, with a premium Sun Grown wrapper and all-Nicaraguan fillers.

Bargain of the year?Nick Perdomo makes tip-top cigars and this is no exception. It’s a long story, but this started off as a mistake - not because it was a second - but because an order mix-up years ago caused us to receive a bunch of unbanded cigars in-the-round rather than banded and box-pressed. A fine smoke, not one inch a second nor subpar. It turned into such a monster CI deal that I have them made just like this on an ongoing basis. You’re gonna love it - a delicious premium torpedo with high quality tobaccos and the Perdomo stamp of approval! A nice spicy-sweet, robust flavor, your choice of either a delicate Cameroon or a jet black Nicaraguan maduro - double-fermented, oily and super-flavorful.Note: due to heavy demand, from time to time backorders may occur. But, have no fear, these are always on order!

Nick’s Sticks with Perdomo’s style.Looking for a solid Perdomo handmade without the Perdomo price? Nick’s Sticks cigars are your answer. This budget friendly brand has all the Perdomo fixins - quality materials, expert craftsmanship, and bold flavors – but is priced quite attractively, to say the least.Nick’s Sticks cigars are available in three tasty varieties. The Connecticut is mellow to medium in body, thanks to a silky Ecuadorian-grown natural wrapper chuck full of Cuban-seed long-fillers from Nicaragua’s fertile soils. The blend is rich to the core and deep in bold flavors, yet mellow and creamy throughout. Espresso, earth, and a touch of unsweetened cocoa....delivered in smooth, velvety fashion.

Nick’s Sticks with Perdomo’s style.Looking for a solid Perdomo handmade without the Perdomo price? Nick’s Sticks cigars are your answer. This budget friendly brand has all the Perdomo fixins - quality materials, expert craftsmanship, and bold flavors – but is priced quite attractively, to say the least.Nick’s Sticks cigars are available in three tasty varieties. The Maduro is medium in body, but tip-toes the edge of full-bodied as you approach the nub. A thick and oily Broadleaf maduro wrapper comes chock full of Cuban-seed long-fillers from Nicaragua’s fertile soils. The blend is rich and chewy, offering deep notes of coffee bean and earth with a lovely peppery-sweetness that lingers long on the finish. Smooth yet eventful, Nick’s Sticks Maduro is a tasty treat.

Nick’s Sticks with Perdomo’s style.Looking for a solid Perdomo handmade without the Perdomo price? Nick’s Sticks cigars are your answer. This budget friendly brand has all the Perdomo fixins - quality materials, expert craftsmanship, and bold flavors – but is priced quite attractively, to say the least.Nick’s Sticks cigars are available in three tasty varieties. The Sun Grown is medium to full in body, thanks to a thick and leathery Habano-seed wrapper chock full of Cuban-seed long-fillers from Nicaragua’s fertile soils. The cigar is rich and hearty, offering sweet notes of pepper and earth throughout the burn. Bold yet balanced, this is a fantastic everyday handmade guaranteed to satisfy.

Perdomo's mellow work of art.Don't worry folks....the top-selling gentle-bodied masterpiece known as Champagne has not changed. It's just been repackaged to join Tabacalera Perdomo's 10 Year Anniversary of the Reserve family.Nick Perdomo is one of the best in the business when it comes to generating rich, hearty flavors backed by a truckload of strength. That's why the Champagne cigar is so special...it delivers the rich layers of complex flav​ors but offers a subtle, mellow-bodied profile. A supremely flavorful handmade built for anytime enjoyment that can satisfy every palate on the planet. Comprised of a fine, Cuban-seed Nicaraguan blend of extensively aged tobaccos, the Champagne is hugged by a stunning, triple-fermented Connecticut shade wrapper. The cigar is superior on all fronts, pumping out various nuances including rich tobacco flavors, hints of coffee, creamy undertones, and a subtle sweetness, almost like honey. No doubt, Champagne cigars are a must try....over and over again.
Shapes: Churchill, Corona Extra, Figurado, Gordo, Petite Corona, Robusto, Toro, Torpedo

desc: Take the top-selling Perdomo Champagne cigar, add a maduro-wrapped variety into the mix, and the results are spectacular. More than spectacular.The Perdomo Champagne Noir cigar utilizes a triple-fermented, Cuban-seed Nicaraguan maduro wrapper that's been aged for nearly 2 years - much of that time spent in Bourbon barrels. Inside is a rich and well-aged blend of Nicaraguan long-fillers. The result is a full-flavored, but very well-balanced profile that's layered with notes of coffee, cocoa, sweet cedar, and earth. Medium to full-bodied and h​ighly enjoyable. Perdomo Reserve Champagne Noir received a well-deserved 91-rating noting: "Brownish-red in complexion this robusot offers plenty of roasted meat and rich woody flavors underscored by an earthy component with a slight anise finish."
Shapes: Churchill, Figurado, Gordo, Petite Corona, Robusto, Toro, Torpedo

desc: ​Nick Perdomo spikes the Champagne. It seems impossible to improve a masterpiece (G​odfather 3 anyone....anyone?), but by George, Nick Perdomo done done it. This instant classic features the same intoxicating, all-Nicaraguan long-filler and binder combo as the original Champagne, but with an added twist – the Connecticut wrapper is deftly swapped in favor of a flavorful, forceful Nicaraguan Sungrown wrapper leaf for a bodacious boost of added flavor. Expect a richer, spicier, medium to full-bodied experience, equipped with Perdomo’s renowned commitment to quality and consistency. Bring home the delectable Champagne Sun Grown and celebrate the fine art of transformation.
Shapes: Churchill, Corona Extra, Figurado, Gordo, Robusto, Toro, Torpedo

desc: Deep, rich, and well-aged. Just how we like it.Perdomo is a trusted brand known for using high-quality materials and employing excellent construction across all their product lines, and they do it without charging outrageous prices. Need proof? Look no further than the Perdomo Slow-Aged Lot 826 Maduro. Once taste of this high-end bundled cigar, and you won’t believe you didn’t pay ten times as much.Four different Nicaraguan tobaccos, including a spicy ligero leaf for added complexity are covered by a rich & toothy Connecticut Broadleaf wrapper, and produce a smooth mellow-medium bodied profile with notes of coffee, cocoa, earth, and toast. Smooth, delicious, and affordable makes the Slow-Aged Lot 826 Maduro another undeniable winner from Perdomo.

A gem from Esteli, Nicaragua.Last year delivered a bumper crop of new brands from Tabacalera Perdomo, including the fantastic, re-blended Perdomo Reserve series. But, the Slow-Aged cigars might be the pick of the litter. It's just my kind of cigar: see, not only do we get quality tobaccos, over-the-top aging and superior flavor but the price is unbeatable for a blend of this caliber. The wrapper is a smooth, oily Connectiut covering four different Nicaraguan long-leaf tobaccos, including a choice strain of ligero leaf that amps up the flavor profile just a touch. This complex blend results in a deliciously smooth, robust and vivacious flavor with creaminess and coffee-like notes. Topping off the exquisite experience is the price.

The sun shines on Slow-Aged!Fans of great cigars and even better values can’t pass up on Perdomo’s Slow-Aged Lot 826. What could be better than a premium, long-filler bundled cigar that matches or even exceeds the quality of most of the boxed selections on the market, for a fraction of the price? Nothin’, that’s what, and with the addition of the new Slow-Aged Lot 826 Sun-Grown, the trilogy is complete, and there’s a Slow-Aged selection to fit any palate.The blend starts with Nicaraguan long-fillers, including a high-priming ligero leaf to keep things complex & interesting. When covered by a rich, oily Sun-Grown wrapper leaf, this carefully crafted blend delivers medium-bodied notes of leather, spice, and wood. Grab a bundle of Perodmo Slow-Aged Lot 826 Sun-Grown, and enjoy a top-quality blend for as little as $2.99/stick.

Master blender Nick Perdomo Jr. delivers a 3-part line with each blend boasting as rich a flavor as the Perdomo family cigar history. Coming to America from Cuba during the revolution, the Perdomo family found the freedom to continue their craft as skilled tobacco artisans, and they haven’t looked back. Forward to today, and Nick Jr. is at the top of his game, and with his next release, the Perdomo Small Batch Series, a carefully selected blend of 10-year-aged tobaccos showcase the skills gained by decades of industry knowledge.  The Connecticut variety features a golden-tan colored Ecuadorian Connecticut wrapper leaf. Lying just underneath, a bevy of well-aged Nicaraguan longer-fillers are encased by a refined Nicaraguan binder. mellow to medium-bodied, Perdomo Small Batch Connecticut delivers refined and subtle notes of sweet spice, vanilla, and caramel. A long and well-balanced finish caps off the experience and with Perdomo’s seal of approval, you know you can’t go wrong.​

Master blender Nick Perdomo Jr. delivers a 3-part line with each blend boasting as rich a flavor as the Perdomo family cigar history. Coming to America from Cuba during the revolution, the Perdomo family found the freedom to continue their craft as skilled tobacco artisans, and they haven’t looked back. Forward to today, and Nick Jr. is at the top of his game, and with his next release, the Perdomo Small Batch Series, a carefully selected blend of 10-year-aged tobaccos showcase the skills gained by decades of industry knowledge.  The Maduro variety features a dark-chocolate colored Nicaraguan maduro wrapper leaf. Lying just underneath, a bevy of well-aged Nicaraguan longer-fillers are encased by a refined Nicaraguan binder. Full-bodied, Perdomo Small Batch Maduro delivers bold notes of white pepper, earth, and leather. A long and well-balanced finish caps off the experience and with Perdomo’s seal of approval, you know you can’t go wrong.​

Master blender Nick Perdomo Jr. delivers a 3-part line with each blend boasting as rich a flavor as the Perdomo family cigar history. Coming to America from Cuba during the revolution, the Perdomo family found the freedom to continue their craft as skilled tobacco artisans, and they haven’t looked back. Forward to today, and Nick Jr. is at the top of his game, and with his next release, the Perdomo Small Batch Series, a carefully selected blend of 10-year-aged tobaccos showcase the skills gained by decades of industry knowledge.  The Sun Grown variety features a medium-brown colored Nicaraguan wrapper leaf. Lying just underneath, a bevy of well-aged Nicaraguan longer-fillers are encased by a refined Nicaraguan binder. Medium to full-bodied, Perdomo Small Batch Sun Grown delivers rich and complex notes of spice, wood, and almond. A long and well-balanced finish caps off the experience and with Perdomo’s seal of approval, you know you can’t go wrong.​

These ain’t your grandma’s pearls.... Perla del Mar, originally a Cuban brand, literally means “Pearl of the Sea.” Legend has it that some of the earliest explorers who hit the shores of Cuba discovered a golden leaf, which they immediately named Perla del Mar. This historic brand is being reintroduced by J.C. Newman, the very same boutique factory that gave us premium blends like Brick House and El Baton.Perla del Mar is a box-pressed Nicaraguan handmade. Dressed in a silky Ecuador Connecticut wrapper, it offers smooth sailing from the very first glance. Inside, a blend of all Nicaraguan long-fillers from three distinct growing regions merge in perfect harmony. Flavors are smooth and creamy, and they do wonders to please the palate from start to finish.Perla del Mar received a well-deserved 90-rating noting: "Sweet woody notes, toast and hints of graham cracker make for a tasty smoke. The draw on this short, thick cigar is open and full, delivering substantial amounts of smoke."

A fistful of pearls!Some cigars let you know they’re going to excellent at first glance. Perla del Mar Maduro is firmly in that camp. The Perla del Mar Maduro is, you guessed it, a maduro-wrapped successor to the 90-rated, Connecticut-wrapped Perla del Mar. Originally manufactured in Cuba, the Perla del Mar brand now lives in the same factory that produces Brick House and El Baton. Handmade in Nicaragua, Perla del Mar Maduro bursts onto the scene with a thick and dark-chocolate colored wrapped that’ll immediately have you thinking of a king-size chocolate bar. Under the expertly applied wrapper, you’ll find Nicaraguan binder and long-fillers from three different growing regions. Working together in perfect balance, the tobaccos here deliver, and they deliver big. Bursts of spice, coffee, dark chocolate, and a creamy-smooth core dance on the palate. J.C. Newman makes some of the best cigars in the industry, and Perla del Mar Maduro is primed to enter that conversation.  ​

A home-run for machine-mades with Phillies cigars!Phillies blunt cigars are famous for more than just their name. Filled with a tame blend of Dominican and Honduran tobaccos, these decadent premiums are a top-seller for over a century, Phillies are one of the most recognized blunt cigars, and are available in extensive sizes, shapes and flavors at convenience stores and cigar shops around the world including Phillies Titan cigars. Known for their unique earthy flavor and sweet fragrance, the cigar is mellow, smooth and consistent. Including blends such as Blunt Chocolate Aroma, Blunt Strawberry, and Phillies Titan cigars there's a Phillies blunt blend for any palate. Phillies machine-made cigars are a hit out of the park.

A smooth slow-burner.Pinar del Rio is made in a smaller factory in the Dominican Republic. But unlike many of the neighboring factories, PDR cigars are loaded with flavor and boutique charm. To create Pinar Del Rio Clasico, a Connecticut Shade wrapper from Ecuador overlays a medium-bodied blend of Nicaraguan and Dominican long-fillers. The result is a smooth, creamy blend that's surprisingly flavorful. A few notches in above most Connecticuts in body, but layered with notes of oak, cream, nuts, and coffee, PDR Clasico is a tasty little offering at a modest price.

prod_name: Pinar del Rio Habano Sun Grown
desc: A ultra-flavorful boutique handmade.Pinar del Rio is made in a smaller factory in the Dominican Republic. But unlike many of the neighboring factories, PDR cigars are loaded with flavor and boutique charm. The Habano Sun Grown utilizes an oily, reddish-brown Habano Sun Grown wrapper from the Dominican Republic. Within, a rich Criollo '98 binder from the Dominican and a bold blend of Nicaraguan and Dominican long-fillers. The result is a full-bodied blend that's complex, refined, and layered with rich notes of earth, spices, cedar, coffee, and a hint of pepper on the finish.
Shapes: Churchill, Corona, Double Corona, Gordo, Lancero/Panatela, Robusto, Torpedo

desc: Dark and delicious. Pinar del Rio is made in a smaller factory in the Dominican Republic. But unlike many of the neighboring factories, PDR cigars are loaded with flavor and boutique charm. Pinar Del Rio Oscuro employs a thick, dark Brazilian Oscuro wrapper overtop a rich blend of Dominican and Nicaraguan long-fillers to create a medium-bodied profile that's loaded with flavor. Notes of coffee, cocoa, pepper, and a naturally sweet finish meld perfectly to create a cigar that's complex, smooth, and balanced.
Shapes: Churchill, Corona, Gordo, Lancero/Panatela, Robusto, Toro, Torpedo

desc: Enchanting, to say the least.Pinar del Rio. Remember the name. Write it down. After you taste this cigar, you'll realize why....and the PdR brand will likely be ingrained into your brain, fo​rever filed away next to the timeless Farrah Fawcett swimsuit poster. Both are quite enjoyable.Reserva Limitada is Pinar del Rio’s latest and greatest. A gorgeous creature built with eight different tobacco varieties to generate a wealth of satisfying, complex flavors that intensify throughout the burn. It all begins with a dark and sultry Dominican Habano wrapper. This leathery leaf literally drips with oils, and hugs a feisty blend of aged long-fillers. Nicaraguan tobaccos from Jalapa and Esteli combined with Dominican Criollo ’98, Dominican Corojo, and a rare Dominican leaf known as Negrita Canca Habano. So much tobacco, two thick binders were required to secure this blend – a feisty Criollo ’98 and a rich Brazilian Habano. This involved recipe of superior tobaccos tastes as complex as it sounds, enveloping the palate with a rich core of oak and leather complemented by underlying hints of roasted coffee bean and black tobacco. A somewhat sweet series of hearty spices lingers after each puff, completing a bold yet balanced, medium to full-bodied treat for the senses.

A true beaut!In most cigar quarters, the reasonably-priced quality handmade may have gone the way of the dodo bird and beehive hairdo. But at Camp CI, a different story is unfolding. Exhibit #14,843: Pioneer Valley - a handmade beaut hailing from one of Nicaragua's premier cigar factories. Quality materials, expert craftsmanship, and enjoyable flavors....all for $1.50 apiece. That's the CI Way, son!Pioneer Valley is an attractive handmade cigar hugged by a silky Connecticut wrapper. Beneath this gorgeous natural leaf a well-aged combination of mellow Cuban-seed long-fillers from Nicaragua and the Dominican Republic resides. The cigar is smooth, offering a creamy core of toast and cedar, complemented by crisp tobacco notes. Mellow, tasty, and well-made....all for an absurdly great price. Dig in.

A crazy price on a tasty premium.In most cigar quarters, the reasonably-priced quality handmade may have gone the way of the dodo bird and beehive hairdo. But at Camp CI, a different story is unfolding. Exhibit #14,843: Pioneer Valley — a handmade beaut hailing from one of Nicaragua’s premier cigar factories. Quality materials, expert craftsmanship, and enjoyable flavors....all for as low as $1.50 apiece. That’s the CI Way, son!Pioneer Valley Maduro features a dark, toothy Broadleaf Maduro wrapper. On the inside, a flavorful, well-aged combination of mellow Cuban-seed long-fillers from Nicaragua and the Dominican Republic resides. The cigar is smooth, offering a creamy core of toast and cedar, complemented by crisp tobacco notes and a pleasant richness on the finish. With four tasty sizes to choose from and a ridiculously low price tag, Pioneer Valley is a cigar you want on that wall, one you need on that wall.

Pirata Pequenos are tasty little handmade treats that are custom-built for “in-between” times. Made from short filler tobaccos - leaves left from regular premium cigar production - these Pequenos are good quality, quick cigars at an exceptional price. Smooth and tasty with a slightly sweet cap, Pirata delivers an enjoyable handmade for pennies.

A finish so strong, you might call it “Pistoff”Kristoff, created by Glen Case, First started making cigars in 2004 and has been one of the fastest growing boutique cigar manufacturers ever since. This is due to the combination of exclusively using only the highest quality double and triple fermented premium tobaccos from around the world and a team of master blenders with generations of Cuban cigar making experience. With too many excellent blends to mention, Kristoff has introduced a new cigar that it felt their portfolio was missing. Named by a customer, The Pistoff Kristoff is a deceivingly strong and full bodied cigar.Wrapped in a natural San Andres wrapper, Pistoff Kristoff features an Indonesian binder and Nicaraguan long fillers. With notable nutty character you will also enjoy hints of spice, toffee, toast and a long sweet finish. As warned by Kristoff, “Don’t let the smoothness of the cigar fool you; this one packs a punch.” Quite simply, Pistoff is a must try for all full-bodied cigar enthusiasts.​

For over five generations, the Plascencia family has been responsible for some of the industry’s best and most recognizable brands: Gurkha, Rocky Patel, 5 Vegas, Romeo y Julieta just to name a few. Whether you knew it or not, it's very likely you've enjoyed a premium cigar from the Plasencia factory at some point. Now, Plasencia releases their magnum opus: 1865 Alma Fuerte. Their other cigars are good, but this one is in a world of its own.Plasencia 1865 Alma Fuerte features hearty Nicaraguan long-fillers wrapped in an oily Nicaraguan wrapper. This combination makes for an exceptionally rich and bold blend with hints of cocoa, leather, and spice. The 1865 Alma Fuerte sports masterful construction which lends to a pleasingly complex experience. Small-batch, expertly crafted, and truly unique — this one's a certified winner in every aspect. Plasencia Alma Fuerte earned an impressive 93-rating in 2017, and was named the #9 Cigar of the Year. Here's what the experts had to say, "The cigar burns evenly, offering big notes of cocoa powder, leather, and toast. There is a pleasing minerality on the finish."Note: Plasencia 1865 Alma Fuerte has recently undergone a packaging update, and no longer include the ashtray with boxes.

Plasencia's Alma Mater! Plasencia, a family of cigar producers dating back five generations, is notorious for crafting some of the most notable and finest cigar brands such as Rocky Patel, 5 Vegas and Romeo y Julieta among others just to toot their horn a little bit. These premium favorites have been sampled by the droves over the years, but more recently Plasencia’s newest masterpiece is second release of the 5-tier Alma series, Alma Del Campo. Following the Alma Fuerte, a beautifully oiled Nicaraguan wrapped medium to full-bodied cigar, the Alma Del Campo shows the family resemblance. The seamless beauty is covered in a milk chocolate brown wrapper giving off a sweet and bold aroma of dark cocoa, dark earth, leather, cedar and dark fruit. Nicaraguan fillers bring out the same notes of dark cocoa powder, cedar, coffee beans, and the dark fruity flavor. Your taste buds will thank you for hours on end when you try Plasencia Alma Del Campo. The cigars alone are worth the asking price, but check out this packaging. The box doubles as a classy four finger ashtray that will last long after the cigars are gone. Pick up a box today enjoy a top-shelf cigar experience from the best in the business. Good news! Plasencia Alma del Campo as received a well-deserved 90-point rating, noting: "This oily looking cigar has a good draw. Woody notes of cedar play off the cigar's inherent salt-and-pepper qualities. The bready finish hints of sweetness and spice."

Born from fire, and to the fire it shall return.When you gaze across the waters of Lake Nicaragua, two volcanoes can be seen rising imposingly from the shores of Ometepe Island. The Conception is the active volcano to the north, and the inactive Maderas lies to the south. These volcanoes are the reason the soil of Ometepe is so black & rich in nutrients, and why the island grows some of the best tobacco in the world. The Plasencia family has long loved the leaf that comes from this island, and the Alma del Fuego is their tribute to Ometepe. To acieve the full potential of the volcanic soils, all the Ometepe tobaccos used for the double binder and half the filler blend are aged for seven long years. The wrapper and remaining fillers are from Jalapa, and all the tobacco contained herein was grown on Plasencia’s own farms, operating for more than five generations. The body is medium-full and the flavors aren’t shy, producing tons of earth, leather, and espresso with a spicy finish. Alma del Fuego is Spanish for Soul of Fire, a fitting name. Born from the sun and volcanoes, and awaiting the flame of your lighter to burn it down to the nub.Good news! The Plasencia Alma del Fuego has been awarded with a 92-point rating, noting "Gleaming with oils, this box-pressed cigar is fashioned with a flat head and closed foot. Its open draw offers plenty of spicy, woody smoke that's accentuated by touches of coffee bean, dried fruit and cloves. The finish is nutty and sweet."

146 Reasons to love PlasenciaPlasencia is killing it this year with their own brand Plasencia 1865, by introducing one outstanding cigar after another. The family-oriented tobacco growers have been in business for over 150 years, and some amazing brands were born over that timeframe including 5 Vegas, Rocky Patel, Gurkha and so much more. This year we’ve already gotten a taste of the Reserva Original, the Alma Fuerte, and the Alma Del Campo. Now the newest bundle of joy to welcome the Plasencia family is Cosecha 146. This robust blend is inspired by the 146th crop grown by the family since they started in 1865! They’ve certainly been busy. The Plasencia’s have christened this premium with a Honduran wrapper and filled it with Honduran and Nicaraguan leaves from 2011. Another premium cigar created by the Plasencia family that will make a great gift or enjoy it yourself. The Cosecha 146 earned a stellar 92-rating and was honored as one of the Top 25 Cigars of 2018. One review noted: "Well made with an even burn, this cigar delivers woody notes of oak and fresh tobacco interspersed with red pepper spice. The finish shows some vanilla sweetness."

It's back, baby!Technically an oldie but a goodie, the Reserva Original is a cigar that Plasencia debuted years ago as Reserva Organica. The Plasencia family is ecstatic about this, as they should be because it is truly a one-of-a-kind cigar. Described as one that Columbus would have enjoyed when he discovered Nicaragua, it is the first and only fully organic blend in the entire world! This green niche product began growth in 2001, and the Plasencia family has this unique tobacco for the Reserva Original certified by OSHA every year. These handmade beauties are medium in body and are made with the same sweet tobacco blend as the Reserva Organica. Give this resurfaced gem a whirl.
Shapes: Churchill, Corona, Petite Corona, Pyramid, Robusto, Toro

desc: Short and sweet.It doesn't happen often, but when I find myself in the mood for a quick, sweet cigar, Platinum cigarillos are the perfect remedy. Ideal for when you’re short on time, these tasty cigarillos are a perfect companion when the weather’s cold, when you’re doing errands, or on your daily commute. Choose from the wide variety of mouthwatering flavors, check out our magnum sized discount prices, and order by the boatload.Pink Berry: A slightly tangy fruity essence

Classic Cuban flavorI don't have a time machine, but I can transport you to Havana, Cuba in 1834 with just two words: Por Larranaga. It was a simpler time, with quality tobaccos going into immaculately constructed cigar day in and day out. And Por Larranaga, with its smooth, rich flavor and satisfying natural sweetness, was the crown jewel of Cuba. Luckily for you, this isn't all just a dream: those behind the revival of Romeo y Julieta and H. Upmann have brought Por Larranaga back onto the scene, and its ready to reclaim its crown. Hay, earth, and a thickly sweet finish come through on each and every puff of this Ecuadorian Connecticut wrapped handmade. It's hard enough to create one standout blend in this industry. But with the lineup of relaunched Cuban brands that Altadis manufactures in the Dominican Republic, they've managed to create a dynasty rivaling that of the Shaq/Kobe Lakers. Por Larranaga cigars are modern-day classics, and well worth your consideration.

- From the makers of Middleton’s Black and Mild- Utilizes only Middleton’s top pipe tobaccos- Smooth and sweet with a pleasant aroma- Mellow in body yet long on flavor- A quick cigar that offers a relaxing break

prod_name: Private Stock Long-Filler by Davidoff of Geneva
desc: A dependable every day blend from the folks at Davidoff of Geneva.Private Stock is an immensely flavorful cigar from the Davidoff of Geneva factory in the Dominican Republic. Each of these cigars employs premium long-filler tobaccos and attractive Connecticut shade wrappers combined with the same quality and care as the company's higher-end lines. All this makes for a top-notch handmade cigar from one of the world’s most prestigious names, at an incredible CI-like bargain price. Private Stock Long-Filler is here to keep your humidor, and your wallet, nice and full.

Anything but standardCrafted by Bill Ives and Juan Cancel, Protocol cigar company may be small, but they dream big. What else would you expect from two NY police officers? This boutique brand has been picking up steam year after year and finally, after much demand in our retail stores, lands at the sunny shores of CI. Today, we shine the spotlight on their original release, Protocol. Crafted by Erik Espinosa’s factory, La Zona Cigars, Protocol features an Ecuadorian Habano Oscuro wrapper leaf overtop quadruple ligero long-fillers from Nicaragua. Packaged in affordable mazos of 10, each Protocol cigar delivers notes of chocolate, coffee, and a dark sweetness that’s uber-enticing. If you’re looking to go off the beaten path a bit, dip your toe into this boutique portfolio: you won’t be disappointed.

This collaboration between Protocol and the Cigar's International Retail store team wont be a secret for long!Produced at The LaZona Factory in Estelí, Nicaragua, Protocol Confidential Informant is crafted with a silky, Ecuadorian Sumatra wrapper, Nicaraguan binder, and hearty, well-aged Nicaraguan long-fillers.  This recipe was specifically blended by Erik Espinosa then box-pressed to perfection to deliver a dense, creamy profile that's layered with rustic notes of leather, cedar, black pepper and a touch of cocoa on the finish. Medium-plus in body, but with plenty of flavor to go around, this one brings all the sizzle. The unique packaging and extremely limited availability (only 500 Packs of 10 were produced) only add to the equation. In short, buy this now before it's too late.

Line up and enjoyFor the last few years, Bill Ives and Juan Cancel have been slowly but steadily building a boutique legend with their Protocol cigar line. Working hand in hand with Erik Espinosa (blender behind 601 Cigars and the 94-rated Laranja Reserva), each Protocol release has been a hit with those who love the unique and obscure. Today, we take a look at the fourth release from Protocol: Official Misconduct. Handmade once again at the La Zona factory in Esteli, Nicaragua, Protocol Official Misconduct is a Nicaraguan puro of the highest standard. Delivered in beautiful silver boxes of 10, each Official Misconduct delivers a medium to full-bodied blast of black pepper, earth, leather, and dark chocolate. Easily the richest and fullest-bodied Protocol to date, you should most certainly do yourself a favor and secure a box while they last.

Cause for enjoymentThe follow-up to the La Zona produced boutique hit, Protocol, is finally here, and I hope you’ll join me in celebrating. Welcome Protocol Probable Cause, a hot new offering from Bill Ives and Juan Cancel, crafted in Erik Espinosa’s famed Nicaraguan factory. With a gritty Mexican San Andres wrapper overtop Nicaraguan binder and long-filler, it’s no wonder this cigar delivers such a rich, chewy profile. Medium to full-bodied, Protocol Probable Cause features a beautifully slow burn accented by hints of pepper, nuttiness, and a rich earthy note that’ll keep you coming back for more.

Third time’s the charmThe first two Protocol blends are boutique bombshells, that’s no doubt. But with their third release, Protocol Themis, Juan Cancel and Bill Ives knocked one outta the park. Named after the Greek Titaness of law and order, Themis is the first mellower offering from the company, and one I can easily recommend. Crafted once again in Erik Espinosa’s La Zona cigar factory (home of the popular 601 Series of cigars as well as the 94-rated Espinosa Laranaja), Themis features a silky smooth Ecuadorian Connecticut wrapper leaf up to. Complemented by Nicaraguan binder and long-filler, this golden beauty weighs in right around medium in body. Toasting it, you’ll find the classic hay and cedar flavors of Connecticut blends, with notes of coffee and black pepper that make this a perfect companion to your morning mug.

A cigar that momma Bates would love.PSyKo Seven cigars are your ticket to escape the mundane, to disconnect from the disorder and tumult of daily life, and to “medicate your mind.” This cigar is crafted to tantalize the palates of the new generation of cigar enthusiast and offer a richness and depth of flavor that will have you craving another go ‘round with this delectable blend.Coming from Ventura Cigar Company and crafted by Henke Kelner in the Dominican Republic, these unique cigars boast a six country blend of tobaccos. This stick features a prescription form as its band listing the tobaccos, and signed by “El Diablo Blanco.” This beauty is draped in a Dominican Hybrid wrapper over a Mexican Sumatra binder and Peruvian Pelo de Oro Viso, Honduran Holancha Seco, and Pennsylvania ligero, to deliver a mellow to medium-bodied experience with a complex transition of flavors. Expect notes of cream, nuts, wood to emerge, and complement each other while maintaining a perfect balance. PSyKo Seven received a well-deserved 92-rating, noting: "First puffs show notes of sweet cedar and oak before building ot savory leather, black pepper and a touch of brown sugar sweetness." ​​

A more mellow side of PsykoPsyko Seven was introduced as a cigar to unwind and “medicate your mind” with, and Psyko Seven Connecticut rounds out the collection in a mellow to medium-bodied dose. Disconnect from chaos and commotion with the latest Psyko Seven line. Relax with this exclusive blend of seven tobaccos from six countries encased in a sleek Ecuadorian Connecticut wrapper expertly crafted in the Dominican Republic. A palate-pleaser for sure. Psyko Seven eludes savory notes of bread, cream, baking spice, almond, and oak that will simply let your worries slide off your shoulders.

Up your dose of PSyKo.The original PSyKo Seven urged you to “medicate your mind,” and the PSyKo Seven Maduro comes on the scene to up the dosage. Featuring the same prescription-style wrapper that highlights the blend and signed by “El Diablo Blanco,” the PSyKo Seven Maduro adds some spice and ratchets up the intensity.PSyKo Seven Maduro is graced with a deliciously dark and oily San Andres maduro wrapper concealing an Ecuador Hybrid 151 binder and Nicaraguan ligero, Peruvian Pelo de Oro, Dominican Hybrid, Honduran Holancha, and Pennsylvania ligero long-fillers. This blend is brazenly bold and full-bodied with a host of flavors including cherry, raisin, pepper, cream, leather, fruit, chocolate, and coffee with off the charts complexity. If you’re looking for a cigar that boasts the complete package of flavor, balance, complexity, and affordability, your search ends here, so add these to your cart and see what you’ve been missing out on.  PSyKo Seven Maduro received a well-deserved 90-rating noting: "A heavy-ring-gauge cigar with a creamy milk chocolate sweetness that's balanced by salty, leathery notes and briny finish."​
Filler: Dominican, Honduran, Nicaraguan, Peruvian, United States

desc: A budget-priced beauty from Alec Bradley.Alan Rubin, founder of Alec Bradley, is no stranger to 90+ ratings. The brand has a packed stable of winners, including plenty on the Top 25 Cigars of the Year list, and there’s an Alec Bradley blend to fit any palate. Super-premiums are Alan Rubin’s thing, and his commitment to quality doesn’t stop no matter how low his prices go. Case in point: Puck by Alec Bradley. Puck is a box-pressed beauty with a Cuban-Sandwich style filler, that blows all other value brands out of the water. The Habano leaves used in Puck’s filler are the very same leaves utilized in some of the brand’s higher-priced lines, and are gracefully covered by a dark & oily Honduran Habano wrapper. Hand ‘em out to your friends and they’ll think you paid twice as much when they get a taste of the rich notes of espresso, pepper, and cocoa. Truly another winning blend from Alan Rubin.

Punch Bareknuckle Cigars - The new full-bodied evolution of a legend.This little number, rightfully called Pun​ch Bareknuckle, deserves 10s across the board, that's for sure. When you're enjoying Punch Bareknuckle, the grass is already as green as it's ever gettin' and it's always sunny in Philadelphia. One of the most respected brand names in the world - Punch, a stout, exceedingly tasty blend, with a highly attractive p​rice point. Yeah, this thing's a homerun. Draped in an oily, richly-hued Ecuadorian Habano Sun-Grown wrapper and jam-packed with long-fillers from Honduras and Nicaragua, this Punch cigar brings the 'wow' in droves. A looker that tastes even better, Punch Bareknuckle cigars deliver a full-bodied, full-flavored profile that's layered with notes of pepper, earth, espresso, and sweet cedar. Bold, but impressively smooth, this new handmade is certifiably delicious.

These convenient tins are slam-packed with 20 flavorful Punch cigarillos. Machine-made in the Dominican Republic, these tasty treats incorporate the same premium tobacco that's present throughout the entire Punch line. Robust and full-flavored, these little cigars are smooth with a slight spiciness. Punch is a world class cigar, and these cigarillos are a great addition to their portfolio.

Smooth with some spiciness, a Punch cigar will fit everyone's palate.With an excellent range of flavor but not overpowering, Punch cigars are superbly constructed and consistently delicious. Honduran, Dominican, and Nicaraguan filler, Connecticut binder and a dark wrapper. Robust and full-flavored - Punch is a world class cigar.Punch cigar review earned a well-deserved 93-rating, as long as being honored as the #12 cigar of 2018, noting, "the tobaccos here come together quite cohesively, each leaf playing off the next for a dense, chewy smoke that’s earthy and sweet."​NOTE: Punch got a new look! We currently have mixed inventory of old and new packaging, we cannot guarantee which you will receive.
Shapes: Cigarillos, Corona, Double Corona, Lonsdale, Perfecto, Presidente, Robusto, Rothschild, Toro

desc: A step up from the traditional Punch.Using Cuban-seed tobaccos from Nicaragua, Honduras and the Dominican, and robust sun-grown wrappers, the Punch Deluxe cigar is an amped up version of the standard punch line. Rich in earthy, cedar-like undertones, Punch Deluxe is a medium to full-bodied cigar that's complex and satisfying.

Punch enters the dark sideComing in hot from IPCPR 2018 Punch delivers its boldest creation to date – Punch Diablo. Punch cigars have been produced in Honduras since their inception in 1960, but when it came time to blend a new, bolder Punch, they turned to none other than AJ Fernandez in Esteli, Nicaragua. The task was to use aged tobacco to create a cigar with strength and bold flavors, complementing the Punch portfolio. They used a bevy of dark tobaccos from four different countries resulting in a bold new creation that is sure to offer full-bodied enthusiasts another reason to love the classic Punch brand. At first glance you’ll find a 4 years aged Ecuadoran Sumatra Oscuro wrapper that’s dark and toothy. Underneath you’ll find another 4 years aged blend of Nicaraguan and Honduran Habano ligero leaves, bound by a bold Connecticut Broadleaf binder that’s been aged 6 years. This 4 country concoction offers up indulgent and spicy flavors with notes of wood, earth, and leather. If you’ve been on the prowl for a new powerhouse cigar, you can count on AJ’s new take on Punch cigars. Good news! Punch Diablo has earned an awesome 93-point rating from the critics, noting: "Every puff of this dark cigar gives the sensation of biting into a piece of chocolate fudge, studded with nuts, espresso beans and toasted coconut. Hints of caramel and earth make this smoke a sublimely rich experience."
Shapes: Corona, Gordo, Gordo Extra, Robusto, Toro

desc: A bold step up from the traditional Punch brand.Introducing, the Punch Gran Puro cigar. That’s right, puro. The ancient Punch brand has now utilized everything that the San Agustin Valley of Honduras has to offer by creating a robust all-Honduran leaf cigar to tantalize your​ taste buds. But that’s not all; this powerful recipe features a spicy Havana-seed sun-grown wrapper, along with a sun-grown binder. You guessed it: this puppy has some punch (no pun intended). Medium to full bodied, this rich peppery treat will definitely hold your attention for a good hour and a half.Punch Gran Puro is honored as the #10 cigar of 2016 and has received a well-deserved 93-rating noting: "This chocolate brown robusto burns perfectly even and draws well, delivering sweet and floral smoke with profound undertones of leather, dried red fruit and a hint of cinammon."​

A punch of Nicaraguan flavorWhatever Punch tries to do, they do well. So when they set out to make a Nicaraguan version of the Honduran Gran Puro, which has been a favorite in cigar enthusiasts humidors for decades, we all knew it would be a success. Punch Gran Puro Nicaragua is a medium to full-bodied palate-pleaser enriched with a hearty Connecticut Broadleaf maduro wrapper. Nicaraguan long-fillers deliver bold notes of pepper and cedar combined with earthy hints of leather. Punch Gran Puro Nicaragua is the ultimate cigar for body and flavor. Top-notch construction and high quality tobaccos paired with the low everyday prices from CI is a match made in heaven. So if you're a fan of the classic Honduran Punch cigars but have acquired a liking to rich Nicaraguan premiums, its not hard to get behind the flavorful punch the Gran Puro Nicaragua delivers. Punch Gran Puro Nicaragua has received a well-deserved 90-rating, noting: "This dark, toothy cigar has an even draw and burn. It starts out earthy with heavy mineral notes but becomes sweet with hints of apple, almonds and cedar."Note: Punch Gran Puro Nicaragua cigars are currently undergoing a packaging change. We have mixed inventory of new blue bands and the old green bands, but the blend remains the same. We cannot guarantee which version you will receive.

The Grand Cru cigar series from Punch is their top of the line, crafted from vintage tobaccos aged from 4-5 years.Made in Honduras, Grand Cru cigars are satisfying and robust in taste, yet with a sweet bouquet and silky smooth draw. Gorgeous, golden brown wrappers highlight a select, complex and refined cigar worthy of your attention.Punch Gran Cru received a well-deserved 93-rating noting: "Squarely pressed with a dark wrapper, this torpedo delivers a pleasant mix of spice, licorice and wood that builds to a tarry finish."

Honoring an ‘ICON’ic legacy.Punch is a cigar brand with some serious staying power. The name was first registered as a Cuban brand in 1840 but moved to Honduras following the embargo, and the cigars have remained on the top shelf of brick & mortar cigar shops ever since. Renowned for their complexity, consistency, and wide range of flavors, Punch is the perfect example of an iconic cigar brand that truly made a mark on the cigar industry, and Punch ICON is the perfect way to celebrate that legacy.Punch ICON is a beautiful specimen. A dark, oily Ecuador Sumatra wrapper and hearty Connecticut Broadleaf binder cover the finest blend of Dominican, Nicaraguan, and Honduran long-fillers to ever wear the famous Punch band. This selection comes in just one 5.7”x 54 robusto size, ready and waiting to coat your palate in the perfect interplay of leather, mocha, earth, and pepper that can only be achieved after more than 170 years of expertise. Of course, Punch couldn’t have done it without the dedication of fans like you, so grab a box and toast to another 170 years!

A budget-busting Punch!Are you tired of paying more for your cigars, and getting less? You work hard for your money, why pay high prices for cigars that just don’t live up to the hype? If you’re looking for a well-crafted, reliable cigar that tastes great and won’t break the bank, then listen up! Mr. Punch has strapped on the gloves and stepped into the ring, and pounded the competition into submission with the new Punch Knuckle Buster. The Knuckle Buster’s knockout blend starts with Nicaraguan and Honduran long-fillers secured within a Nicaraguan binder, and draped in a beautiful Nicaraguan Habano wrapper leaf. The medium-bodied profile will be a treat to any hard-working herfer, and the smooth notes of earth, leather, cedar, and nuts will provide any cigar lover some much needed relaxation time. So go ahead and grab a box today, kick up your feet, and relax. You earned it.

G​oing, going, going, going...Going fast indeed. The Punch Rare Corojo cigar always disappears in a wink. In all honesty, sometimes I wonder why I even bother putting it in the catalog or online, since it's gone before I know it. The key to this cigar is its unique, burgundy-colored Sumatra-seed wrapper grown in the natural mountain mist of Ecuador. Its extra rich flavor, complemented by a blend of Nicaraguan and Dominican long-filler tobaccos, then square-pressed in shape, make these robust, hea​dy smokes a real treat.Punch Rare Corojo received a well-deserved 92-rating noting: "This rouge-hued robusto is silky and box-pressed. The smoke is rich and aromatic, complementing flavors of leather and wood. It has notes of cherry and a fine finish."Note: Punch Rare Corojo recently underwent a packaging change. The blend has not changed.
Shapes: Corona, Figurado, Gordo, Robusto, Rothschild, Toro

desc: Introducing Punch Rare Corojo 10th Anniversary.Punch is a legendary brand. A Honduran giant catering to those seeking a full-bodied, full-flavored cigar of the highest caliber. Within the mighty Punch stable is the heavily-sought Punch Rare Corojo. A limited production series produced annually. Now ten years strong, Punch Rare Corojo 10th Anniversary cigars have been born.For starters, the 10th Anniversary cigar is not your traditional Punch Rare Corojo. To craft this delicious morsel, a rare Cuban-seed Corojo leaf from Connecticut was hand-selected, carefully fermented, and extensively aged. This thick wrapper variety is loaded with spicy, hearty flavors, packing a truckload of full-flavored charisma and complementing the complex recipe of Dominican and Nicaraguan long-fillers inside. Expect a unique series of bold flavors throughout the burn, including coffee and cream with savory notes of pepper and a satisfying hint of earth and sweet nuances. Each cigar is gently box-pressed, delivering these robust flavors in a smooth, yet concentrated fashion guaranteed to soothe the palate.

Punch at the top of their game.An industry leader in innovative, high-end tobacco blending for 175 years, Punch remains one of the most recognizable brands in the biz. Once the face of the Cuban cigar market, Punch found a new home in Honduras in 1969 with the nationalization of Cuba, and they have been refining their craft ever since. Their newest release may be their proudest, tastiest work of art to date.Dubbed Punch Signature, a combination of rare and extremely refined tobaccos are at play. At first glance, you are met with a spotless Ecuadorian Corojo wrapper leaf with an updated and eye-catching white and black-colored Punch band. Lying just beneath is a feisty, one-of-a-kind Nicaraguan binder cloaking vintage long-fillers from lush growing regions in the Dominican and Nicaragua. Rich, full-bodied notes of aromatic spice, cedar, and leather, along with a slight cinnamon nuance all enter the fray giving way to a complex blend with unwavering balance. Punch Signature also received an impressive 91-rating noting: "Bold impressions of smoked meat, leather and mesquite are elegantly interwoven with sweet touches of dried stone fruits, caramel and a raw cocoa bean finish."​​

​Such a gem.Here’s your knowledge learnin’ tip o’ the day: Amber is an exotic, naturally occurring stone in the Dominican that takes millions of years to properly form. Once it reaches a certain point of age, however, it enjoys worldwide acclaim for its rare and beautiful colors. In other words, it’s worth the wait. This Puro Ambar cigar is takes inspiration from this captivating gemstone.Medium to full-bodied and oh-so-tasty, this Dominican puro has real charisma. Just like Clasico, it features a wine fermented Criollo ’98 binder, which imparts a plethora of unique fruit flavors. The filler mix includes Criollo ’98 and 1900, a leaf that’s exclusive to Tabacalera El Artista. The T13 wrapper is also exclusive and one-of-a-kind. These components all add up to one thing – rarity. Just like amber. ​

​Made by Cuban-trained cigar making legend Rolando Reyes, Sr.Puros Indios are handmade from Honduras with Cuba-seed filler, and a rich, oily Ecuadorian wrapper. The result is a spicy, medium to full-bodied, aromatic taste. Rated ’93’ by Cigar Aficionado.Cuban-expatriate Rolando Reyes, Sr. has been called the world’s best blender on more than one occasion. In fact, his cigars are critically acclaimed for their raw richness and complex layers of flavor. Back in-stock and better than ever!Try the Puros Indios Maduro Gran Victoria for an all-day herf extravaganza! Weighing in at 10"x 66, you might need to clear your schedule, but the Maduro wrapper and high-quality long-fillers ensure that you'll be enveloped in delicious flavors the whole darn time.

It is not easy being green…sometimes we can be so misunderstood!Rolando Reyes Sr. was never a true fan of the local tobaccos in Honduras, so he ventured into planting 50-acres of his own crop in the early 2000’s. Since then, the tobacco has aged with maturity and refinement and is used to produce Reyes Family Cigars. Among those produced is a beautiful candela leaf, the striking feature of the Puros Indios Candela cigar. Lending a natural sweetness and subtle tones of hay to the Honduran and Nicaraguan fillers this wrapper’s smooth burn and enjoyable taste is great to enjoy in the early morning with your favorite cup of coffee. Be sure not to judge this cigar for its Double Claro color, after all… green may just become your new favorite color!

A golden oldie.When it comes to post-SCHIP-era monster deals on handmades, this one is a candidate for Cigarzilla. With prices that range from $34.99 - $49.99, Puros Indios Viejo feels like the good old days. Fittingly, Viejo means "old" in Spanish....and these puppies are literally just that. Featuring aging you simply can’t buy - these sticks were resting in Rolando Reyes’ aging rooms in Danli for, according to PI president Carlos Diez, "literally 6 years." The blend is composed of top-grade Sumatra wrappers and lush Jamastran fillers. So why did Puros Indios release the hounds all at once? To beat the April 1, 2009 SCHIP cigar tax deadline, Rolando wanted to get every cigar in his factory on a boat to America (insert Neil Diamond music here) by March. You and me, well son, we’ll enjoy the benefits of this exodus....at least for a while. Look, I know guys are split 50/50 on Puros Indios: some love them, some don’t. But if you’re in the first camp, jump on this now because for one, the price is shaq diesel and for two, the age on this cigar delivers an unmatched experience that’s at once bold and elegant. A medium bodied handmade with an earthy core complemented by a pleasant touch of sweetness. Smooth from beginning to end, given the quality and flavor coupled with the ridiculously low price makes Puros Indios Viejo yet another CI no-brainer deal.Now available in both Natural (Sumatra) and Maduro wrappers.

40 years and still going strong. But soon they'll be going, going, gone!An ode to 40 years in the biz, Manuel Quesada releases Quesada 40th Anniversary. This release serves as a constant reminder of the decades of hard work and dedication that it took Manuel to rise to the ranks of master blender. This addition to the star-studded Quesada portfolio boasts three regular production sizes along with two limited edition sizes (Toro Press and Salomon Press). Only the best blend would suffice for this monumental occasion, and the proof lies in the pudding.Hailing from the famous Quesada Cigars factory in the Dominican Republic, 40th Anniversary arrives with a Mexican San Andres wrapper. Beneath, a cocktail of long-fillers from the Dominican and Nicaragua meld perfectly with a well-aged Dominican binder. This medium to full-bodied offering reveals notes of spice, pepper, and a hint of smoky BBQ. A true pleasure to enjoy, this is one blend to grab while the iron is hot!Quesada 40th Anniversary received a well-deseerved 90-rating noting: "An unusual, double-tapered perfecto that is pressed in the middle and bulges at each end. Herbal at first, this cigar develops notes of spicy licorice and rich chocolate."​

A once European exclusive now arriving here at Cigars International!Having been in the tobacco industry for over a century, the Quesada Family began their company in Cuba with tobacco that was given to them to pay off a debt. Looking to broaden their tobacco portfolio, the family traveled to the Dominican Republic and created a new manufacturing company. Starting with just 3 rollers, they found great success with the Dominican Republic branch, experiencing continued growth while being led by the fifth generation of the Quesada Family. The Espana line was created as a budget-friendly competitor against the Cuban cigars so readily available in Europe. Wrapped in an Ecuadorian Arapiraca wrapper, the cigar's Dominican binder combines with Nicaraguan and Dominican fillers to offer a medium-bodied experience full of coffee, leather and caramel flavor notes on palate great for any time of the day enjoyment. Even though they just arrived stateside, when they're gone, they're gone. Don't miss your chance to try this once European exclusive cigar!

Turn your humidor into a kegerator!Figuratively speaking of course. But you can claim to once you stuff it to the gills with Manuel Quesada’s next pairing marvel, simply dubbed, Keg. Coming in only one size, a 6” x 50 toro, Keg was crafted to pair with those dark and flavorful Irish stouts. Teaming up with legendary tobacco grower Nestor Plasencia, it took the Quesada clan months of searching before they pin-pointed the perfect blend for the challenge, and the result was nothing short of fantastic.Keg boasts ripe notes of dark chocolate, pepper, and a slight floral note that meld perfectly with those famed Irish stouts. Packaged in a miniaturized beer barrel shaped box with a shamrock shining on the lid, this blend is primed for St. Patrick’s Day. As for the blend, it features a super-fermented, dark Pennsylvania Broadleaf wrapper cloaking a binder and long-fillers hailing from Nicaragua. At last, you have found your lucky charms! ​

Oktoberfest – Beer, brats, and now cigars!October....no longer a month for beer festivals and prancing about town in your Spiderman costume. Introducing, Quesada Oktoberfest, a small-batch seasonal cigar from Manuel Quesada - maker of Casa Magna and Fonseca. With production limited to a mere 500 boxes, Oktoberfest was specifically manufactured to pair with everyone’s favorite libation....beer! Blending a cigar to pair with beer is no easy feat. But who better to fill the tall order than the legendary Manuel Quesada? This hearty Dominican puro all begins with a Dominican Cibao wrapper that is thick, dark and oily. This beautiful leaf hugs an all-Dominican recipe of long-filler criollos, visos, and ligeros, producing a hearty medium to full-bodied cigar chock full of flavor and complexity. From the first puff, you’ll know why the Oktoberfest is so special. Pleasant notes of cedar, earth, and dark chocolate mingle throughout a cool slow burn. Like many of the beers Oktoberfest was crafted toward, expect rich natural flavors to highlight a smooth but robust body. Beer, or no beer, the Oktoberfest is great any time of year.

Q D’Etat is back baby!Quesada released their Q D’Etat line in 2012 and sadly was one of the first brands to get hit by the man in the cigar industry. Now you can do your happy dance because Q D’Etat is being rereleased in limited quantities. Available in three vitolas: Molitov a 5 inch figurado, Howitzer a 6X60 Gordo, and Daga a 7X54 Salomon. Treat yourself to the Molitov and Howitzer Dominican puros, or try something different with Daga featuring Dominican and Nicaraguan fillers and an Ecuadorian Arapiraca wrapper. Grab these limited gems before they sell out. Good news, Q D'Etat has received an awesome 91-point rating, noting: "Huge and dark, this cigar burns evenly and draws well, offering heavy earthy notes of leather, salted nuts and toast before a touch of caramel on the finish."

Five generations of tobacco knowledge embodied.In Manuel ‘Manolo’ Quesada Jr’s. newest creation, old meets young, tradition meets new-age, and refinement meets flavor. Quesada Reserva Privada pays homage to the 5 generations of the Quesada family that led to where they are today, with bold, modern packaging that looks toward the future. Utilizing tobaccos cultivated before Manuel Sr. passed away 18 years ago, a crop that was even in height when cut which results in the nutrients being spread evenly throughout the plants, consistency is a sure bet, and flavor is top-notch. Without further ado, welcome Quesada Reserva Privada.Featuring a silky-smooth Ecuadorian Connecticut wrapper leaf, Reserva Privada sets the stage for deliciousness from the get-go. Underneath, a Dominican Criollo binder harvested in 1997 hugs long leaf ligeros from Pennsylvania and San Vicente (Dominican). A tasty buffet of nuances including pepper, wood, and a rich sweetness culminate a cool and long finish. Mellow to medium in body, Manolo delivers a blend as rich as his family’s history in the business, and worthy of representing it. Don’t miss the boat on these gems.Quesada Reserva Privada received a well-deserve 92-rating noting: "This blonde corona gorda has a great draw and a wavy burn that corrects itself. Rich, creamy smoke blossoms on the palate to show orange peel and toasted almond."​

Quorum, where quality meets price.Look up the word 'value' in the dictionary, and you just may find a bundle of Quorum pictured next to it. From the folks at J.C. Newman, these medium-bodied handmades are high quality with a low-budget price. The all-Nicaraguan blend issues a satisfying profile with ample amounts of flavor and body that doesn't come close to breaking the bank.Quorum is available in three varieties. A shade-grown Ecuador Connecticut wrapper,  a dark Ecuador sun-grown, or a rich Nicaraguan maduro.
Shapes: Churchill, Corona, Gordo, Petite Corona, Robusto, Short Robusto, Toro, Torpedo

desc: Raji gets a hero's funeral.Maybe just a regular funeral. Better still, a rather unceremonious dump in the ash heap of the cigar industry would be more fitting. Raji's Untimely Demise is a questionable brand complemented by a dubious blend. This thing was DOA from day one. The artwork eyebrow-raising, the name remarkably cheesy. Run my friend. Run fast and far, no matter how the $30 price might tempt you.

Who is Ramon Bueso? A few years ago, that question rung across the halls of CIGARfest as enthusiast after enthusiast frantically scrambled to get their hands on the hottest, newest, boutique release. The cigar that caused all the pandemonium — Ramon Bueso Genesis The Project. An ultra-smooth, ultra-savory blend that introduced the world to the legend of the Bueso name, this cigar started a trend of fantastic releases from Ramon. Today, we're proud to present his newest blend, one that's destined to be a national treasure in humidors the world over: Ramon Bueso Exclusivo. While the Bueso brand has only been around for a few years, Ramon himself has spent decades honing his craft in the world's most illustrious cigar factories. And that skill is fully utilized in making Exclusivo. A gorgeous, Connecticut wrapper hugs Nicaraguan long-fillers to deliver a creamy and slightly peppery profile that'll be sure to wake you up. As the cigar progresses, slight notes of coffee and cedar join the mix. Full in flavor, but not in body, Exclusivo is deserving of a look from even the most grizzled cigar veteran. Quite simply, this is a perfect mellow cigar. Don't hesitate.

Rounding out the best new cigar line in years, welcome Genesis Habano.Ramon Bueso has taken the industry by storm in the past two years, but he has been honing his craft since 1977. He played an integral part in catapulting the legendary Villazon factory to new heights, and worked right alongside master-blenders such as Frank Llaneza and Estelo Padron. Responsible for highly-acclaimed blends from Hoyo de Monterrey to Punch, Ramon’s credentials speak for themselves.Genesis Habano is Ramon’s third offering, and brings his core line full circle. Ramon took his time with this concoction, and meticulously scoured through endless wrappers leaves until he was satisfied that he had hit a homerun. After securing his choice wrapper and adding a hearty portion of select ligeros to Genesis Habanos core, Ramon has set the stage for an instant showstopper. Two years on tinkering behind him, Ramon’s pride and joy, Genesis Habano, has finally come to fruition, and the result was most certainly worth the wait. His original Genesis blend was tweaked to perfection and paired with a dark, leathery, and insanely delicious Ecuadorian Habano ligero wrapper, to create a bold, unique experience. A rich and hearty tobacco core laced with ligero is backed by complex notes of wood, espresso, pepper, honey, and roasted nuts in this smooth, full-bodied creation.  ​​

Everybody Loves Ramon!Telling the Genesis story with just two paragraphs - or even three - is extremely difficult. Not to mention, it can’t possibly come close to doing the cigar and its creator justice. Genesis deserves pages of praise, but catalog pages cost a whole lot of money, so our space here is limited. That said, here’s the skinny.Genesis is a small-batch super-premium, meticulously hand-crafted by Ramon Bueso in Honduras. Who is Ramon Bueso? Trust me when I tell you he isn’t some ho-hum street corner vendor. Quite the opposite, in fact, Ramon has been an integral player in the cigar industry for nearly 4 decades. Since 1977, Ramon has been honing his mastery of cigars and has perfected every facet of cigar production. From grower to roller to master-blender to factory supervisor. Early in his career, Ramon Bueso was vital in catapulting the legendary Villazon factory to new heights, working alongside cigar legends Frank Llaneza and Estelo Padron, and producing some of the world’s biggest and most successful blends in the process. Blends you enjoy early and often, from the likes of Hoyo de Monterrey, Excalibur, Punch, and so much more.Truth is, Ramon’s mind and hands have created more brands and blends than one can accurately count, let alone imagine. But this....this is by far his most irresistible creation yet. His raison d’etre, if you will. Genesis began as ‘The Project,’ a limited production, local favorite exclusive to the Honduran market, mostly used for gifts and events. Now available on a grander scale, the Genesis is ready to make its mark. The lush, well-aged tobaccos used to craft Genesis deliver a scrumptious and complex medium to full-bodied bouquet. An exceedingly complex core of vintage long-fillers from Nicaragua and Honduras, including select ligeros, visos, and secos. This complex recipe is expertly blended, secured inside a feisty Jamastran binder, then cloaked by a dark and inviting, triple-fermented Connecticut Broadleaf maduro wrapper boasting gorgeous oils. From the very first puff, it’s clear this cigar is something special. Each Genesis wastes no time asserting its distinct array of eventful profile. Thick and creamy flavor coats the palate, dusting the taste buds with hearty notes of espresso, roasted nuts, earth, and nutmeg.
