The finish is long and savory, offering a unique spicy-sweetness after each puff. Complex, yet highly refined and skillfully balanced, Genesis is a mere peak into the window of Ramon Bueso’s extraordinary talents. Genesis The Project....it’s just the beginning.

​Dare I say, crowning achievement?Although it’s only been a few years since Ramon Bueso’s first project, it feels like I’ve been waiting for decades. I, like many of you, am a huge fan of Bueso’s other blends. Genesis is still in my regular rotation, and there are few things finer than an Odyssey paired with a hot mug of coffee. But I’m greedy, and I want more. Well, finally, that wait is over. Ramon Bueso Olancho Vintage is here, and burning one of these feels like coming home from a long trip.This is the cigar that Ramon always wanted to make, and his passion really shines through. All of the tobaccos in this blend are absolutely flawless, aged, handpicked leaves, with each cigar receiving personalized attention and care. So what's in this recipe? We've got an aged 2005 binder leaf from Talanga Valley, and a wide variety of long-filler leaves including selections from 2008 Nicaraguan Esteli, 2010 Honduras La Entrada, 2008 Honduran Jamastran, and 2003 Honduras Olancho. On top of all of that, the wrapper is a Colorado Oscuro Olancho, grown exclusively for this cigar. These leaves were purposefully fermented for a shorter amount of time than industry standard, and the experiment paid off with an absolutely unique flavor unlike any other cigar on the market. Lighting this one up, I find a medium to full-bodied blend with blasts of earth, spice, leather, and cedar in a harmony that feels different than anything I’ve burnt before. Each cigar this guy puts out tastes better than the last, and with Olancho Vintage, we’re seeing Ramon’s finest work to date. I’d easily recommend this cigar to any enthusiast. Stock up, because with the rarity of these fine leaves, this is one limited release you absolutely don’t want to miss out on. ​

Mellow in body, smooth in flavorIf there’s one thing we can all agree on, it’s that finding a bargain is awesome. Draft specials at baseball games, discounted tee times, slightly “scratch and dent” but otherwise perfectly fine humidors. I live for the deal. Maybe that’s how I ended up a staffer at Camp CI. Either way, my favorite deal is finding a perfect everyday smooth blend. Ramones Connecticut delivers, and it delivers in spades. Let’s take a peek under the sheets and figure out what we’re working with here. An Ecuadorian Connecticut wrapper is flawlessly applied over mix-fillers from the Dominican Republic, Honduras, and Nicaragua. The Indonesian Sumatra binder lends a natural sweetness to this otherwise creamy, slightly spicy blend. Oh, I almost forgot the best part! Ramones Connecticut is manufactured by Camacho. Yes, that Camacho. So jump on in, the water’s fine. ​

Camacho delivers againIs it just me, or is everything getting too expensive nowadays? I’m not talking about cigars here, I’m just talking about the world in general. A sandwich and a bag of chips for lunch is double what it used to be, and I spend so much on stuff like coffee it feels like a mortgage payment. Maybe I just exaggerate, or maybe I’m getting old and cranky, but either way: I love seeing a fantastic cigar with an awesome price. Especially when that cigar is this good.Ramones Sumatra is a medium-bodied blend handmade in the Dominican Republic that is itching to be your new everyday favorite. Lighting one of these suckers up, you’ll get notes of natural tobacco sweetness, a slight pepper, and a pleasant chocolate taste. Add in the Camacho name behind the manufacturing, and you’ve got a recipe for success that deserves immediate consideration.  ​

A bold return. From the late 19th century through the early 20th, Red Lion, PA was among the largest cigar-producing towns in the country, with 30 factories producing millions of cigars. Among their most heralded brands was their namesake, Red Lion, and now it’s back with plenty of old-time charm. Don’t be fooled by their small size, this handmade cheroot combines Pennsylvania Broadleaf and Kentucky fire-cured tobaccos to create a hearty, robust profile filled with spicy, smoky-sweet flavors. ​

A taste of PhillyFresh from the streets of Philly – the City of Brotherly Love – comes a prince of a cigar, dubbed Renzulli. A small batch, boutique blend, Renzulli exhibits its premium character at first glance. A mouthwatering, chocolate brown wrapper grabs your attention, and on closer examination you’ll find the stick is well-filled without any visible seams. Crafted at Erik Espinosa’s heralded boutique La Zona factory in Esteli, Nicaragua, this medium to full-bodied cigar hits the palate like a flavor bomb. Graced with a Habano Rosado wrapper hugging a hearty blend of Nicaraguan long-fillers, Renzulli delivers an onslaught of flavors that will keep you entertained. Much like the famous Rocky training montage, this cigar packs punches of earth, leather, spice, cocoa, and a slight sweetness to keep you on your toes. And just a quick note on the sizes. Each of these is named for Philly and Italian slang. Cing U Bezz  translates to five dollars a piece, "cuz" is slang for cousin, minchia means "wow!", and as any Sopranos fan knows, a goomad is a mistress, or a girlfriend. Grab a box of Renzulli today, the best taste to come from Philly since the infamous cheesesteak. ​

No speed-wagon includedMany of you may remember the REO cigar released under EO Brands in years past. The cigar, for those who aren’t familiar, was a great medium-full bodied blend, one that consistently performed time and time again. Sadly, REO became a casualty of business disputes. With three different industry titans involved in the making of this handmade, there were simply too many mouths to feed. Partnerships severed, and REO went the way of the dinosaurs. However, it was always the brain child of Eddie Ortega, and finally, he's brought this delicious premium back for all to enjoy.At hand today is the rereleased REO, back and better than ever. An oily maduro wrapper is draped over Honduran and Nicaraguan long-fillers to create a tasty handmade that can be enjoyed any day (especially at these prices). Pair it up with a hot cup of coffee, or a cold glass of rum, and enjoy the slightly sweet, coffee and chocolate dominant profile. If anything is an indication of how great this rerelease is, it's how quickly the samples "disappeared" from our offices. And let's not forget the best news: You can enjoy these blends at CI for well below retail every day of the week. ​

Delicious 7"x58 handmade figurados!This is a crowd favorite. We've been offering these in our retail stores for a little while now and they are absolute show-stoppers. Hand-crafted with aged tobaccos and rolled fresh, Reposado '96 arrives packed to the gills in hefty chests of 30. Each hails from Nicaragua, made from rich, Cuban-seed tobaccos - each rolled in a thick, 58-ring Salomon shape that delivers tons of complexity and ample flavor. You're in for a delicious cigar experience at a price that is positively eye-popping. 7.1"x58 figurados, layered with flavor and made from quality, aged long-leaf tobaccos. And with your choice of Connecticut, Maduro, or Habano wrappers, there's a Reposado '96 for any palate!Maduro: Cuban-seed Nicaraguan long-fillers are draped in a hearty San Andres Maduro leaf to produce a medium-bodied flavor profile with deep, heavy notes of espresso and toast. Habano: A Nicaraguan puro consisting of Cuban-Seed long-fillers and a sultry Habano wrapper, this cigar is predominantly leather and wood forward, with some spicy nuance. Medium to full-bodied, and very smooth.Connecticut: Fans of mellow to medium-bodied cigars are in for a treat with this Connecticut-wrapped blend of Nicaraguan long-fillers. The flavors are creamy and smooth with cedar and a touch of spice.

Rocky's done it again.After Rocky introduced Decade (10th Anniversary) the praise was unanimous, with many critics citing it as his best blend yet. But that was before he released the 15th Anniversary. Capping off 15 years of continued success in the cigar business, the 15th Anniversary goes above and beyond any of Rocky's previous offerings. A truly delicious morsel, each 15th comes draped in a flavorful Ecuador Habano wrapper, concealing a long-filler core of lush Nicaraguan tobaccos and binder. This recipe yields a wonderfully balanced and extremely smooth cigar that delivers with every puff. No doubt Rocky's finest creation, the 15th produces savory notes of cocoa, espresso bean, and spices behind a long sweet finish. Throughout the slow burn expect the intensity to build, inching toward a bold satisfying crescendo. Rocky Patel 15th Anniversary has impressive resume. It was awarded the #6 Best Cigar of 2011, scoring 93-points. It was again honored as a Top 25 Cigar of 2018, landing at #20, scoring 92-points. One such review noted: "The Ecuadoran wrapper that covers this cigar combines with the Nicaraguan tobacco on the inside to produce a medium-to-full-bodied smoke redolent of nuts, chocolate, oak and vanilla."

Return of a kingOriginally released a few years back, Rocky Patel 1961 celebrates the year Rocky was born. Now, we could be immature here and make jokes about Rocky becoming an old man, but instead we’ll be serious. If you’ve ever burnt a Rocky Patel cigar, you know that this guy is the real deal. He’s got tons of blends, and they’re all great for different occasions.  1961 is a medium-bodied blend that’s fit for any occasion. We’ve got a perfectly applied triple-cap on top of a seamless Ecuadorian Habano wrapper. The construction here is flawless. Rocky’s been in the cigar game for quite a while, and it shows in his skill. Lighting this one up, you’ll find a delicious bouquet of sweet, warm bread, with a light cedar-y spice. Easy to enjoy, easy to burn, easy to love — Rocky Patel 1961 is a homerun. ​

Aged. Limited. Rare. Ask any master blender or grower what the secret to a great cigar is, and 9 times out of 10 they’ll tell you the same thing: “You can’t rush tobacco.” Indeed, when you cut corners in the aging process, you can certainly get a good cigar but you’ll never get something truly outstanding. Rocky took that lesson to heart with the creation of A.L.R., a single-batch release of 100,000 sticks that’s been patiently aging for the last three years. Rolled back in 2016, this silky and complex medium-bodied cigar is truly decadent. The result is a complexity that you won’t find on most cigars, with layers of flavor coming through on every puff. Cocoa and earth mingles with slight hints of black pepper and roasted coffee, while the finish is surprisingly sweet and smooth — truly, one of the best Rocky blends I’ve ever tried, you’d best do yourself a favor and grab a box of these while you can.

Back with a whole new bag of tricks.2018 marked the release of the ALR, one of Rocky’s finest and most memorable releases to date. What made it so good? The best quality tobacco, carefully blended and rolled, and aged for an impressive two years after being rolled. One year later, the ALR is already a classic blend with sales numbers that prove it. Now, Rocky Patel is back from the drawing board with the follow-up to that excellent release, the ALR Second Edition.This isn’t a tweaked blend. It doesn’t use different primings of the same leaves. No my friends, this blend is all new and all Patel. Rolled at Rocky’s TAVICUSA factory in Nicaragua, these box-pressed gems come stuffed with the best fillers from Rocky’s own farms and are lovingly wrapped in a dark, oily Mexican San Andres wrapper before being laid down for a two year cedar nap. The flavors are big, bold, and chewy, and produce an eclectic mix of flavors including earth, dark fruit, toasted wood, and espresso. The hype over the first ALR proved to be well-merited, so you should get your hands on a box of Second Edition today to get ahead of the bandwagon. ALR stands for ‘Aged, Limited, Rare’, and they won’t be around forever, so don’t miss your chance!Note: Due to manufacturer delays, RP ALR is out of stock with an ETA of July 2020!

Rocky kicks it up a notch.This new addition to the Rocky Patel family extends the uber-popular Rocky Patel Connecticut line with a richer, more robust offering that’s equally delicious…and equally affordale. Rocky Patel has been delivering delicious boutiques to the masses for years, and with RP Broadleaf, he adds a dark, enchanting profile to his portfolio of wallet-friendly pleasers. A dark, oily, top-grade Connecticut Broadleaf maduro wrapper conceals a hearty blend of Honduran and Nicaraguan long-fillers to create a smooth, complex experience that’s layered with notes of cocoa, espresso, honey, and pepper. Delicious, perfectly made, and yours for a song thanks to your friends at CI.​

Rocky Patel Cargo at must-go prices.​​Never heard of Cargo? Understandable, only Central America has released more brands than Rocky Patel since 2005. Here's the skinny. While Rocky Patel is mostly known for his 90+ rated, award-winning blends, RP also creates a wide profile of wallet-friendly blends that'll please your palate as much as your bank account. Affordable, dependable, and rather delicious, Rocky Patel Cargo is like a cool drink on a hot summer day. Despite Rocky Patel Cargo's modest appearance, this medium-bodied blend delivers full-flavored goodness in spades. ​Nicaraguan tobaccos are carefully combined in Cuban sandwich-style, then hugged by dark and oily Ecuadorian-grown Connecticut wrappers to produce a rich and creamy bouquet. Earth, sweet cedar, leather, and espresso bean linger on the palate just before a sweet series of gentle spices completes each puff.

Hey slick, here's the catch.If I told you that one of Rocky's new releases was being sold for significantly less than the rest of his lineup, you'd probably ask, "What's the catch?" Exactly. Catch Twenty-Two is the latest to don a Rocky Patel band, and it could definitely be sold for more, and probably should be. That's the 'catch'. Clear as mud? Good. Now let's get down to business.Catch Twenty-Two comes outfitted in a flavorful Corojo wrapper, which hugs a core of balanced Honduran and Mexican long-fillers. Medium-bodied and producing abundant notes of cocoa, earth, and spices, along with a hint of sweetness, Catch Twenty-Two is proof big results don't require a big price tag. I just wish my wife saw it the same way....

Heads up – Catch! Who doesn’t love Rocky Patel, am I right? Owner of dozens of 90+ ratings, and a plethora of best-sellign blends, Rocky has it all at this point. The only thing not to love? The price. I mean, seriously, some of these cigars can get up towards the $10-$12 a stick range… a little too rich for my blood. Luckily, a few years back, Rocky introduced the Catch 22 line of premium cigars – designed to give you the signature RP experience without the normal asking price. Today, we check out the second entry in the series: Rocky Patel Catch 22 Connecticut.For Catch 22 Connecticut, Rocky Patel utilizes a mellow but flavorful Shade Grown wrapper leaf. The binder and filler leaves are undisclosed, but let me assure you, it’s a mystery you’ll most certainly enjoy. The lush Ecuadorian Connecticut wrapper leaf offers a gentle, smooth, but incredibly flavorful profile including hints of cedar, sweet spice, and a thick, honey-like sweetness.

A deliciously subtle, exclusive handmade from Rocky Patel cigars.It would be impossible for me to count how many of these I've burned through in the past few months, and I can tell you confidently that those who crave their cigars mellow in body yet long on flavor will go cuckoo for cocoa puffs over the RP Connecticut cigar line. Given the quality, the reasonable price (more on that later), and the pedigree - Patel is the maker of the 95-rated Sun Grown maduro, 94-rated Decade, and many other fan-favorite blends. Suffice to say, I've been extremely excited about this cigar. Subtle, smooth and loaded with crisp, soothing flavors that can satisfy just about any palate, the Connecticut by Rocky Patel is, simply put, another outstanding super premium from one of the hottest makers in the business today. As far as price....you’d probably expect this to be a $7 or $8 cigar. Nah! Instead, a remarkable $4 to $5 per cigar, only at CI.

Cri-oh-jo-goodStop me if you’ve heard this one before — Rocky Patel has a new cigar out, and its one fantastic blend. It may be an old song, but it’s a good one, and it’s still true. The newest offering from Rocky Patel, the Cri-ojo, is a tasty morsel of premium caliber. Handmade in Honduras, Cri-ojo is a slow-burning cigar that has tons to offer for any fan of Rocky Patel’s work. Keeping this one standing out from the pack, the wrapper is a fantastically tasty hybrid Havana-seed wrapper that lends Cri-ojo a distinct flavor profile. Rounded out with Honduran and Nicaraguan long-fillers, the RP Cri-ojo delivers earthy notes, charred meat, slight cocoa, and a slightly sweet note. Medium-bodied and unbeatably complex, Cri-ojo is a Rocky that easily deserves a spot in your humidor.​

Let me assure you, this Dark story has a happy ending. At this point in his career, you might think Rocky’s done it all, but take a closer glance and you’ll notice a few small blemishes. For instance, he’s never produced a Dominican-made cigar before! Shocking, no? Well, recently Mr. Patel visited the Dominican and he must have liked what he found, since he returned with a tasty new handmade. Rocky has worked with these factories before, but always the Honduras one. They make great cigars, but the Dominican factory is really the flagship one, and this is Rocky’s first venture with the main operation. Maybe you’re familiar with this factory's work — in addition to making the uber-popular Cohiba line, General Cigars and Rocky have worked together on the 90+ rated Rocky Patel Vintage line in the past. Dark Dominican comes from a heralded past to say the least, and once you get one of these weighty Dominican puros in your hand you’ll be more than impressed. Medium-bodied, Dark Dominican delivers leather, nuts, and a slightly sweet cedar, crafting a Dominican selection you can’t miss.​Great news - Rocky Patel Dark Dominican earned an esteemed 91-rating, noting, "Wearing a dark, near oscuro wrapper, this cigar exhibits a rich, earthy character and caramel sweentness with underlying toastiness. The finish hints of crème brûlée."

The 95-rated Decade gets a brand new bag.Rocky Patel Decade is easily one of the most prolific cigar releases of the last…err…decade. 95-rated, among Cigar Aficionado’s ‘Top 25’ cigars of the years, rated 90+ on over 10 occasions - Rocky Patel Decade’s accolades are seemingly endless. And still, even 6+ years after its release, it is still one of the hottest brands on the market. Because it’s damn good…and it’s about to get better. Enter Rocky Patel Decade Cameroon.While working on new blends at the factory and taste-testing tobaccos, Rocky made a startling discovery. To taste the new crop of Cameroon wrapper they wanted to test it with a control they knew very well. So they passed the Cameroon wrapper overtop Decade’s filler and binder. Instantly, they knew they had something special. A whole new taste profile that might even trump the original. The use of an Authentic Cameroon wrapper leads to a smooth, complex, and very well-balanced profile that’s layered with sweet and smoky notes of wood, caramel, coffee, and roasted nuts. In a word, exceptional. Rocky Patel Decade Cameroon received a well-deserved 90-rating noting: "Though first puffs of this dark pyramid are sweet with coconut and vanilla bean, the smoke picks up some savory elements of leather and a bit of earth."

The newest addition to Decade!Rocky Patel Decade has a huge track record, and more awards than you can shake a fist at. With Decade CI 20th Anniversary, Cigars International and Rocky Patel joined forces to bring you a special edition package of Rocky Patel Decade that you won’t soon forget. Crafted in a never before seen 6”x54 toro especial size, this new addition to the Decade line delivers the good in a long, slow burning format that hits all the right notes. Bold nuances of cedar, rich cream, and smooth spice a just a few of the highlights in this ultra-complex gem. Get in line early before the vultures leave nothing but scraps. ​

Behold the 95-rated Decade.Featuring a dark Sumatra wrapper, Decade cigars were ​created to commemorate Rocky Patel's 10th Anniversary in the cigar industry. It's hard to believe, considering the top-notch cigars he has produced in the past, but the Decade may very well be his finest blend yet. While Rocky's gone on to created a slew of popular, 90+ rated blends, Decade remains one of his best-selling... and once you try one for yourself, you'll quickly realize why. Rocky Patel Decade is, quite simply, an unforgettable cigar with a smooth, rich, and complex flavor. A testament to how far Rocky has progressed, this cigar is just as good now as it was in its original release, years back. The extremely delicate balance and distinct taste will leave you craving more — to combat these cravings, CI prescribes a minimum dosage of at least 5 Rocky Patel Decades available in your humidor at all time. In addition to a stunning '95' rating, Rocky Patel Decade was named one of Cigar Aficionado's Top 25 Cigars of the Year. The reviewers wrote, "Oily and pressed with a great draw. The cigar has a rich and creamy texture with distinct notes of black cherry and a nutty finish. Balanced and elegant."
Shapes: Corona, Gordo, Lonsdale, Robusto, Toro, Torpedo

desc: Pressed with power.Edge Square Corojo is a delicious new(ish) way to enjoy Rocky Patel's 91-powerhouse masterpiece series, The Edge. Edge Square Corojo used to sit on the shelves of every retailer naturally, but then, for whatever reason it disappeared… today, we’re happy to welcome Edge Square Corjo back. Available in a variety of sizes and sharply box-pressed to deliver a bold new array of flavors to your entire palate, Edge Square Corojo takes some of the world's strongest and most flavorful tobaccos and turns them into something tasty for all to enjoy. Sit back and savor a balanced mixture of long-leaf ligero grown in Nicaragua and Honduras, wrapped in a Cuban-esque Corojo leaf. A full-bodied bouquet of bold, hearty flavors, including notes of earth, coffee, and wood are presented in a smooth, balanced fashion, then finished by a naturally sweet spice that lingers long on the aftertaste.

Pressed with power.Edge Square Maduro is a delicious new(ish) way to enjoy Rocky Patel's 91-powerhouse masterpiece series, The Edge. Edge Square Maduro used to sit on the shelves of every retailer naturally, but then, for whatever reason it disappeared… today, we’re happy to welcome Edge Square Maduro back. Available in a variety of sizes and sharply box-pressed to deliver a bold new array of flavors to your entire palate, Edge Square Maduro takes some of the world's strongest and most flavorful tobaccos and turns them into something tasty for all to enjoy. Sit back and savor a balanced mixture of long-leaf ligero grown in Nicaragua and Honduras, wrapped in a rich maduro leaf that's dark and oily. A full-bodied bouquet of bold, hearty flavors, including notes of earth, coffee, and wood are presented in a smooth, balanced fashion, then finished by a naturally sweet spice that lingers long on the aftertaste.

What a winner.Rocky Patel Edicion Unico is a tasty blend that took home top honors at the Honduran Cigar Festival in 2011. The first go-round was released that same year, and due to popular demand, it’s back now and just as good as before. The second production version is identical to the first in that it’s a Honduran puro featuring a Honduran Jamastran wrapper overtop a hearty blend of long-fillers from Jamastran and Talanga Valley ligero. The overall character on each Rocky Patel Edicion Unico is rich and complex, featuring notes of espresso, tobacco, sweetness, and a little bit of spice to keep things interesting. This beauty is a limited edition, and only 1000 boxes of 100 are being produced. My suggestion? Don’t wait around on this award-winning find... chances are if you check back in a few months, this thing'll be permanently written in the history books.

Fifty-Five is twice as niceThis year, Rocky Patel turned 55! So he celebrated the way any cigar legend would celebrate a milestone birthday. He blended an awesome cigar. Rocky Patel Fifty-Five is a new, top-shelf addition to the boutique Rocky Patel brand. Technically speaking this one’s part of Rocky’s “Artisan” Series, and is made at the company’s factory in Esteli, Nicaragua. Sitting on the top of every Rocky Patel Fifty Five is a gorgeous, reddish-brown Nicaraguan wrapper leaf. Underneath, you’ll find a tasty Costa Rican binder and Nicaraguan long-fillers. You’ll get an awesome mixture of creamy cocoa and cinnamon, with slight oak and pepper on each puff. It’s tough to compare all of Rocky’s awesome cigars, but for my money, this is one of his best blends on the market today. So let’s light one up, and wish Rocky a happy birthday in style. ​

A quarter century later, they're still great..Working from the Rocky facility in Naples, Florida, expert blender and master cigar roller Hamlet Paredes has been churning out classics for a quarter of a century. To mark that momentous anniversary, Hamlet has cooked up a true masterpiece.The Rocky Patel Hamlet 25th Year is a truly celebratory cigar, marking a career in tobacco that's ready to go down in the history books. With a mellow to medium body, the Rocky Patel Hamlet 25th Year utilizes a deep, rich Ecuadorian Habano wrapper to encase hearty Nicaraguan and Honduran fillers. Hamlet Paredes operates with Cuban quality in mind, so each stick in these boxes is a certified masterpiece. With hints of cedar, coffee, and a little bit of spice on every puff, the answer to the question of “to buy, or not to buy?” should be most obvious.

Cuban-esque at its core.Hamlet Paredes was one of Cuba’s most sought after cigar rollers, often traveling internationally to do in-store rolling demonstrations. Rocky Patel aided Hamlet and his family in escaping Cuba and coming to the US, and now Hamlet is releasing his first cigar for Rocky, Tabaquero by Hamlet Paredes.Hamlet had never touched non-Cuban tobacco before working for Rocky at his Burn Lounge in Naples, Florida, and was very excited about the potential for extracting flavor and richness from these new leaves. Tabaquero comes draped in a San Andres wrapper concealing binders from Brazil and Mexico, and Nicaraguan long-filler. Medium-bodied, and containing Cuban-esque richness, flavors abound including spice, cocoa, coffee, pepper, earth, and subtle cream. Hamlet Paredes has received an impressive 90-rating noting: "Near black and gleaming with oils, this cigar delivers rich, leathery intonations coupled with spice, herbs and a touch of licorice."

Rockys fit for a kingI could stand up here and sing the praises of Rocky Patel all day long, but let’s be real – you know how great this brand is in this day and age. Holder of various 90+ ratings, Top 10 Cigar of the Year awards, and countless blends ranging from the mellow and smooth to the rich and full-bodied, there’s nothing Rocky hasn’t been able to accomplish throughout his years in da biz. That’s what makes today’s featured product so special. Feast your eyes on Rocky Patel Imperial, a small-batch handmade that’s just as delicious as you’d expect from the blender behind Decade, Sun Grown Maduro, and Royale. Medium-bodied, Imperial is a balanced and complex treat, delivering the perfect mixture of sweet and spicy notes throughout its long, cool burn. And here’s the best part: these gems are packaged in economical mazos of 10, meaning you’re not paying for bells, whistles, or fancy packaging. Rocky Patel long-fillers starting at just $40 a bundle? Sign me up!

Rocky’s seeing greenBack in the cigar boom of the 90’s a little known lawyer named Rocky Patel broke into the cigar business with his new line of handmades. In the years following, Rocky would drop his original branding and put cigars out under his own name, but like all good things, ITC is back and better than ever. Today, we welcome a whole new blend to this storied line: the ITC Emerald. I’ll shoot you straight, I’m always wary of Candela wrappers. But when a mastermind like Rocky sets his mind to something, you can rest assured it’s going to be great. Featuring the green Candela wrapper leaf that’s so rare nowadays, ITC Emerald delivers a medium to full-bodied profile with loads of earth, black pepper, and toasted woodsy notes balanced out by the grassiness that Candela brings to the table. Give it a shot today, and I’m sure you’ll agree: Emerald is a gem.

ITC’s smoothestThe original ITC cigars were the blends that put the Rocky Patel name in cigar households across the nation. A few years back, this brand went the way of the Dodo, but now they’re back and just as good as you remember. Besides some cosmetic changes on the band, these are the EXACT cigars you’ve all come to know and love. Maybe you haven’t been around the game long enough to have enjoyed these 20 years ago — if that’s the case, say hello to your new favorite. Made by Rocky Patel in Honduras, this Connecticut wrapped cigar clocks in at a nice medium-body. The silky smooth Ecuadorian wrapper joins a Mexican binder and Honduran and Nicaraguan long-filler. Clip the cap and take a puff, and you’ll find naturally sweet herbal notes and a hint of coffee. Which is great, because this cigar should become your go to with a morning mug o’ joe on the weekends. Priced right with complexity to boot, ITC Limited Reserve deserves immediate attention.

prod_name: Rocky Patel ITC Super Fuerte Maduro
desc: It’s back, baby! ITC Super Fuerte Maduro is here, and cigar fans across the nation are rejoicing. If you’ve done your Cigar History homework, you likely remember this as the original blend that put Rocky Patel on the map all the way back in the 1900s (well, the 90’s, but you get the point). And I’ve got good news for you — this blend hasn’t been tweaked a bit. It’s the same as it always was. And in this case, that means it’s just as rich and mouthwateringly decadent as ever. Hey, if it ain’t broke… Let’s take a quick look at the stats here. Up top, a thick and oily Connecticut Broadleaf maduro wrapper. Underneath, Nicaraguan, Costa Rican, and Honduran long-fillers are blended together in perfect harmony. The result is a dense and thick flavor profile, ripe with chocolate, earth, leather, and a nice kick of black pepper. It’s a cigar that wakes up every taste bud you’ve got available, with droves of flavor coming through on every puff. Don’t sleep on this one — the original release was an absolute monster, and I expect these are going to move just as quickly.

prod_name: Rocky Patel ITC Super Fuerte Natural
desc: 92-rated and back in businessRocky Patel ITC Super Fuerte is a brand cigar historians are well aware of. THE cigar that put the Rocky Patel name on the map in the cigar boom of the 1990’s, this Honduran handmade was a fan-favorite across the nation. Not to mention the prestigious 92-rating bestowed upon it. Now, the brand is back in all of its former glory — and there’s no trick up the sleeves. Same blend, same wrapper, same factory… same delicious flavor. In short, the ITC Super Fuerte Natural from Rocky Patel is a beauty. In long? From first sight right down to final puff, this cigar will captivate you. An awe-inspiring blend of long-leaf fillers from Costa Rica, Nicaragua and Honduras work together to generate voluminous clouds of thick, creamy flavor. Rich with hints of chocolate and a buttery smooth finish, this is a blend designed to be enjoyed down to the finger-burning nub. The flavorful Cuban-seed Corojo wrapper finishes this all off. Plus, Rocky ages each cigar to perfection, so they’re ready to enjoy as soon as you receive them. AKA, as soon as the mailman show up it’s time to chow down.

After 9 long months....it's time for a cigar.Between the baby classes, your hand being squeezed to a pulp, and all the mood swings, it's finally time to sit back, relax and celebrate your new bundle of joy. Sure you'll be strapped for cash for the rest of your life, but it's worth it right? But before you start panicking about how much college is going to set you back, enjoy a fine handmade from Rocky Patel. Donned with it's a boy or girl bands, these new handmades from Rocky are sure to cap off your special occasion just right. Medium-bodied and draped in a seamless Connecticut wrapper, each cigar dishes out smooth creamy flavors and a pleasant aroma. The beauty here is, It's a Boy/Girl cigars are fairly tame and are perfect whether you're a grizzled vet or a first timer. Having twins? Just to be safe I'd go with two boxes.

Rocky knows Nicaraguan.Rocky Patel might be based in Honduras, but they possess mastery of all types of tobacco. Most connoisseurs know that some of the richest, most flavorful leaf in the world is grown in the black volcanic soils of Nicaragua, due to a high concentration of nutrients not found in any other country. Combine this amazing tobacco with some of the best Honduran leaves available, and you have the base for the newest phenomenal blend from Rocky Patel.Weighing in at a smooth medium-body, the blend starts with fillers grown in Condega and Esteli Nicaragua on Patel’s own farms. A heavy ligero from the Jamastran Valley in Honduras is added for character, and it’s all tied together with a gorgeous Ecuador Connecticut wrapper. You can expect notes of earth, toast, leather, and coffee, for a taste that’s welcome at any time of day. Rocky Patel has another instant classic with the LB1, so grab a box and try it out today!
Shapes: Churchill, Corona Gordo, Gordo, Robusto, Toro

desc: This one is for you Erik Nording.Chances are you recognize the Nording name from the world of pipes, but maybe not. Either way, Erik Nording has been one of the world's premiere pipe craftsman for the past 50 years. With a renowned reputation that stretches to all corners of the globe, his pipe designs only seem to get better with each passing day. But Erik Nording isn't just a pipe guy either, he's a true lover of the leaf. Wanting to create his own exclusive cigar, it's no surprise that he turned to Rocky Patel, one of the best cigar makers in the world.Carefully crafted in Honduras, each Nording comes cloaked in an oily and dark brown Nicaraguan Colorado wrapper. This extraordinary leaf conceals a rich bouquet of Nicaraguan long-fillers, blended to achieve Erik Nording's ideal flavor and strength. Each puff reveals smooth and cool flavor, imparting notes of toast, leather, tobacco and spicy-sweet undertones. Medium to full in body, but so smooth you might not notice, Nording cigars are sure to satisfy enthusiasts and novices alike. A fine collaboration between two men who know their craft well, err scratch that extremely well, Nording cigars are a must-try.Great news! Nording received a well-deserved 90-rating noting: ""Topped with a tightly-wound pigtail, this dark, oily cigar draws evenly and consistently, bringing steady notes of cedar, coffee and toasty to the palate. A touch of acidity lingers on the finish "

The big 5-0.Nowadays, it's not easy turning 50. Especially when you account for all the humiliating cards and relentless ribbing of jokes that start to pile up. But in the case of the Nording 50th, Erik Nording should be pretty darn pleased. Capping off 50-years of hard work and success in the pipe industry, enter the Nording 50th Anniversary cigar by Rocky Patel.After teaming up with Rocky on his previous endeavor titled, Nording, it seemed only natural the two would once again meet for this special-edition cigar. Each 50th Anniversary is carefully crafted in Nicaragua into a gorgeous 6" x 54 toro. This generous size delivers a medium to full-bodied profile, and produces a rich well-balanced array of savory flavors, greeting the senses with hints of spice, pepper, nutmeg, coffee and a naturally sweet finish. This complex bouquet, is the result of a dark brown Ecuadorian Habano wrapper draped over a bold core of aged Nicaraguan long-fillers. Masterfully blended for a master, by a master, that's the Nording 50th cigar.

What’s in a name?Rocky Patel works hard on all of his releases to make sure they’re the best they can possibly be, and this latest release is no exception. When producing a new cigar, blenders will typically make several different slightly tweaked versions of the same blend before they settle on a final recipe. When the smoke had cleared from all of the product testing on this newest Rocky creation, it was blend number 6 that stood out as being the best. They had the perfect blend, all they needed was the perfect name. A few ideas were floated but nothing seemed to stand out to Rocky, so he decided simply to name it after the test blend number, and so the Rocky Patel Number 6 was born. Nish Patel describes the flavor of this beauty as having a lot of sweetness, and accurately boasts that it’s totally unlike anything else they’ve released to date. Up top is a Corojo wrapper grown in Honduras, concealing the finest leaves from Rocky’s own farms. The profile is held down by a unique honey note, overtop layers of vanilla, coffee, earth, and bread. The Patels spare no expense in creating only the best cigars, and you’ll undoubtedly agree when you light up a Rocky Patel Number 6. Oh, hey! Looks like Rocky Patel's Number 6 just got a 93-rating with the talking heads noting: "...the excellent draw produces dense, luxurious smoke layered with vanilla, caramel, orange peel, black pepper and cocoa bean before the spicy, nutty finish."
Shapes: Churchill, Corona Gordo, Gordo, Robusto, Toro

desc: A decade old best-sellerTen years after its original release, Olde World Reserve returns to the world of premium cigars… and we can’t wait to greet it. One of the blends most responsible for Rocky Patel’s success, why this cigar ever disappeared is a mystery to all of us. But we don’t need to reminiscence or wonder why here, we can just soak in the goodness that is Olde World Reserve and rejoice. Offered up in two distinct wrappers, first up is the Maduro. Handrolled at Rocky’s Tavicusa factory in Esteli, Nicaragua, this bold and powerful blend weighs in around a medium to full-bodied profile, delivering classic Nicaraguan flavors of pepper, earth, and natural tobacco sweetness. For the Corojo, Rocky’s producing the cigar in the Paraiso factory in Danli, Honduras. The stick is more of a medium-bodied beast, with a lot more sweetness than spice. Toasting the foot, you’ll find a rich, woodsy core, complemented by the natural sweetness of the Corojo leaf. Whichever wrapper you go for, you’re in for a winner here — so what are you waiting for? Welcome Olde World to the new world today, and secure yourself a handful most ricky-tick. Good news! The Rocky Patel Olde World Reserve Maduro has earned a 91-point rating, noting "Light touches of earth and black pepper usher in a richer, sweeter smoke profoundly redolent of cocoa powder. The salted caramel finish adds some refinement."Olde World Reserve Corojo has also received a 90-point rating, noting: "This large, box-pressed cigar smokes well, with toasty notes of wood and graham cracker as well as a hint of chocolate. The finish is sweet."

The OG SGWe brought this hidden gem on a few years back due to a purchasing mistake, a big one. Instead of sending them back, we threw the towel in and offered them up anyways. You can't go wrong with Rocky, right? Well, they ended up being a huge success, and now they're back for round 2. Here's the background:Rocky Patel ‘OSG’ was the original RP Sun Grown blend, a delicious medium to full-bodied cigar with literally 5 years of additional aging. The Sun Grown wrapper hails from Honduras, boasting a thick, oily and leathery texture. Light one of these bad boys up: it greets the palate with a toasty, woody blast, while a pronounced peppery flavor begins to develop toward the back half of the cigar. Medium to full-bodied in strength and, fundamentally, very complex and satisfying. Naturally, I was sure this would be a huge hit and bought all of them, a veritable boatload of which we sold every last one. Now they're back for a limited run. Reasonable price, terrific full-body, Rocky Patel blend. You can't go wrong here, dig in pal.

Not trying this cigar is prohibited. If you’re a fan of Rocky Patel, it’s likely that you already know he’s one of the industry’s biggest defenders, spending much of his time in Washington, DC fighting for the protection and rights of the premium cigar industry. So it’s natural that he’d want to send a message to the FDA with one of his new cigar releases. And he does it perfectly with the new Rocky Patel Prohibition. The message is far from subtle: the federal government’s ban on alcohol during Prohibition was a complete failure and the FDA’s attack on premium cigars will result in a similar outcome. Gorgeously packaged in Rocky Patel-branded Mason jars inspired by the moonshine bootleggers of the Prohibition era, Rocky Patel Prohibition is much more than just a message to the FDA…it’s a damn good cigar. Handcrafted in Esteli, Nicaragua at Rocky’s Tavacusa factory, Prohibition comes available in three delicious wrapper options:Connecticut Broadleaf Maduro: rich and sweet with spicy nuances and notes of coffee, leather, dark chocolate, and molasses. Medium-bodied. San Andres: uses 100% binder and filler from Rocky’s farms. Sweet and earthy with notes of spices, cedar, chocolate, roasted nuts, and a long, toasty finish. Medium to full-bodied. Connecticut: weighs in at a considerably smooth medium body. Cedary, with hints of cream, hay, and slight black pepper.Rocky Patel Prohibition San Andres received a well-deserved 91-rating noting: "A toasty, bready smoke whose notes of cloves, black pepper and molasses combine for a zesty, sweet-and-spicy character overall."

prod_name: Rocky Patel Puro Cubano by Hamlet
desc: Puro Cubano. Tobacco done right. Born and raised in Cuba, Hamlet Paredes is a name you need to become quickly acquainted with. Here’s the skinny: originally working in Habanos S.A. factories rolling Cuban cigars, Hamlet quickly moved up the ranks. Within years, Hamlet was travelling internationally, rolling custom shapes and sizes for some Europe’s top shops, and rolling cigars “free hand” – without molds or presses. Today, now that he’s stateside, Hamlet has joined the Rocky Patel family and crafted high-end blends like Tabaquero, Liberation, and the cigar at hand today: Puro Cubano. Wrapped in a seamless Ecuadorian Habano leaf, with a PA Broadleaf binder and choice Honduran and Nicaraguan long-fillers, Puro Cubano delivers an effortlessly smooth draw and flawless burn. Flavors of natural sweetness, slight creamy notes, and a toasty finish meld together beautifully into a cigar that could only have been crafted by a true master of tobacco.

Oh yes.The latest bait to emerge from Rocky Patel’s deep bench of blends is the ‘R4’. Set to be released nationwide, I pulled a crafty move and stuck my prodigious snout in the trough, buying his entire production. This blend is tasty enough that we could easily charge a pretty penny for it, but instead, we decided to eschew sticking them in a fancy box, and bring them to you in a bundle for a steal.The Rocky Patel ‘R4’ cigar is draped by a thick and hearty maduro leaf and blended with aged long-leaf tobaccos from Honduras and Nicaragua, resulting in a delicious medium-bodied profile....it's earthy, rich, nutty, and buttery smooth, Rocky Patel R4 will no doubt set up shop as a permanent resident in your humidor. These won't be around forever, so act fast and grab a home-run blend from Rocky that's as affordable as it is delicious!

Rocky Patel's Purple Drank!R​​ocky Patel's Vintage series of cigars are highly celebrated. Receiving a slew of outstanding ratings peaking at the 93-point mark, RP Vintage has secured a seat as one of the most notable and memorable cigar blend​s ever created. Recently, Rocky added a limited production extension to the series....the Royal Vintage. This purple-banded beauty is exceptionally tasty, employing all of that good old RP Vintage goodness with an exciting new twist.The RP Royal Vintage cigar is handcrafted with dark, oily, very well-aged Ecuadorian Sumatra wrappers. This leaf is thick, but silky, with a lovely reddish-brown hue. Inside is a well-blended mixture of long-leaf tobaccos from Nicaragua and Honduras. The profile is mellow, but filled with rich, elegant flavors. Medium to full in body with notes of espresso, earth, and spices, Rocky Patel Royal Vintage cigars are highly enjoyable.

You can’t go wrong with Royale.Yet another gem from Rocky Patel, Royale is a beautiful super-premium addition to an already stellar brand. This box-pressed handmade utilizes an Ecuadorian Sumatra wrapper and a hearty blend of Honduran and Nicaraguan long-fillers. The flavors are gloriously complex, with notes of almond, spice, espresso and leather situated around a rich and earthy core. When you just feel like indulging in a medium to full-bodied cigar that won’t let you down, Rocky Patel Royale has just what you need.Great news! Rocky Patel Royale recently was bestowed the honors of #5 cigar of the year for 2014 and earned a 94-rating, noting: "The Royale is a rich, spicy smoke, with pleasant hints of chocolate. It's a delicious cigar, giving Patel his best-ever showing in a Cigar Aficionado Top 25 test."

Fumas get the Royale treatmentRocky Patel Royale — a gloriously complex gem, receiver of a rare 94-rating, and the highly respectable #5 Cigar of the Year in 2014. It’s a blend that members of CI Nation across the globe know and love, but it’s certainly not priced for everyday indulgence. Until today, that is. Rocky Patel Royale Fumas are here to offer the same flavor and quality you love from this RP classic, at a much more agreeable asking price. Now I know what you’re thinking. What’s the catch? One, the cigars have dropped the fancy box and packaging for economical bundles. Two, these are Cuban Sandwich style blends. Ask anyone who’s tried other Rocky Fumas, and they’ll tell you these cigars are well worth the price of admission. Medium to full-bodied, Royale Fumas sports an Ecuadorian Sumatra wrapper and notes of leather, coffee, and spice. Act fast, ‘cuz these are guaranteed to go quick.

A mellow masterpiece that'll soothe the beast within.Rocky Patel Signature cigars. This supremely limited collection showcases Rocky's trademark quality but in a new incarnation: a mellow to medium-bodied blend with unparalleled balance.  A perfect "step-up" from the uber-popular Rocky Patel Connecticut, the Signature Series is one you should most certainly pay attention to. It all starts with a silky Ecuadorian Connecticut wrapper encasing a recipe of Nicaraguan and Honduran fillers. This yields an exceedingly rich flavor profile - a richness not normally found in a mellower cigar - plus a distinctive creamy, buttery goodness. Plus, with that signature CI discount slapping a big ol' 50% off sticker on boxes of these, you'd be a fool not to jump on 'em.

The RP Strada-caster!Psst… you. Yeah, you! You wanna enjoy premium Rocky Patel quality without paying top-dollar? Want to stock your humidor to the brim with RP sticks, all while keeping the ol’ wallet fat and happy? Of course you do. So let me introduce you to your new best friend – Strada by Rocky Patel. The saving’s grace for those who want classic Rocky flavor, without dropping big bucks. Packed with an all Habano filler blend from Honduras and Nicaragua, Strada is complemented by a Connecticut binder and an oily and dark Nicaraguan Jalapa wrapper leaf. Hints of leather, sweet cream, and slight red pepper keep this medium-bodied stick interesting the whole way through. Strada proves once again that Rocky is a blending genius, and compares favorably to cigars that cost twice as much.

Another smash hit from Senor Patel.Sun Grown by Rocky Patel cigars is one hell of a cigar. Though the follow-up hit, Sun Grown Maduro, receives all the praise these days, Sun Grown was one of the original 90+ rated Rocky blends. And the best news? Even though this cigar delivers top-shelf quality, it's priced for everyday enjoyment.T​he rich blend of choice tobaccos light up your palate with a combination of complex, rich flavors while the 5 year old Ecuadorian Sun Grown wrapper delivers a spicy sweet element that you’ll savor until the very last puff. Aged to perfection, and masterfully blended, this smooth burn starts with a bang and finishes with a long, full-bodied finish. A serious cigar for any true connoisseur.Great news! Sun Grown has been named one of the 'Top 50' Cigars in the world along with solid '90' and '91' ratings! Here's what the panel had to say: "A good-looking cigar that performs well. It's earthy and spicy, with a cedar base and a tangy finish. Medium- to full-bodied."
Shapes: Gordo, Petite Corona, Robusto, Toro, Torpedo

desc: Sun Grown goes dark.Rocky Patel has achieved nearly mythical status in our industry, and as his travel schedule attests, is one of the hardest working men in the biz. Despite this hectic workload, Rocky continues to amaze with one stunning blend after another. This new release adds a maduro option to his fan favorite Sun Grown line.Sun Grown Maduro is brazenly full-bodied, coming with a broadleaf maduro wrapper atop dual binders and Nicaraguan long-fillers. A bona fide treat for the full-bodied fan, hearty and booming flavors will electrify you, setting the table for a sensational and enjoyable ride. Construction is spot on, and you’ll savor the long, pleasant finish. Great news! Rocky Patel Sun Grown Maduro was named the #2 Cigar of the Year in 2016 and received a well-deserved 95-point rating, noting: "an attractive appearance that hints at the bold blend of Nicaraguan tobacco under the broadleaf wrapper—and they harmonize beautifully, imparting earthy, nutty notes and bittersweet chocolate with the sweeter properties of the wrapper."

Super Ligero....here to save the day!When I first heard Rocky Patel was releasing Super Ligero, I half expected a cheesy band with some corny superhero theme. But I have to admit I was wrong. Dead wrong. After taking one for a spin, Super Ligero not only looks sharp, but its going to appeal to a ton of people. Don't judge a book by its cover. I preach it a thousand times over. But this is one handmade you can safely pass judgement on from very first glance. The verdict? A bold son of a gun that packs one hell of a punch. Dressed in a dark, feisty Honduran Habano wrapper, Super Ligero isn't afraid to let its presence known. And once you pull back this veritable peel, the fruits that await inside are even more intense. Muy intense long-fillers from Nicaragua and Costa Rica produce a heady profile laced with oak, cinnamon, white pepper, and toasty tobacco. Growing more intense throughout...I suggest sitting down to full enjoy this one. Move over Edge....Super Ligero now wears the crown as Rocky Patel's strongest. Rocky Patel Super Ligero was recently awarded with an awesome 90-rating, noting: "notes of black cherry are punctuated by spicy notes of crushed red and black pepper."​

Celebrate Rocky’s homebaseWhen the right guy gets to the top, he remembers every step he took along the way. Take Rocky Patel for instance. Now a household name in the cigar industry, and the proud owner of many 90+ ratings and Top 25 Cigar of the Year awards, Rocky’s never forgotten where he came from or all the people that helped him get there. And surely one of the most important keys to his success is his boutique operation in Esteli, Nicaragua: a factory that opened its doors just a short decade ago.TAVICUSA honors the factory and rollers that bring you cigars like Decade, Sun Grown, Edge, and the RP 20th Anniversary. Wrapped in a natural San Andres leaf, this blend also features a balanced mixture of Nicaraguan long-fillers from Condega, Jalapa, and Esteli. Toast it and find a rich, medium to full-bodied flavor with toastiness, coffee, and a natural, fruit sweetness. So light one up, and join us in a toast to the past and future of Rocky Patel!

Happy 10 years to The Edge!After a much-anticipated delay, Rocky Patel The Edge A-10 is ready for enjoyment, and it was well worth the wait. Crafted in celebration of the 10th anniversary of one of Mr. Patel’s most coveted lines, The Edge, A-10 is nothing short of a showstopper. The Edge initially hit shelves in 2004. A-10 was the result of intense hard work and effort, as Rocky demanded only the best tobaccos adorn this anniversary blend. But good news, the standards have been exceeded by leaps and bounds.Sporting a barber pole wrap from primary band to foot band, A-10 catches the eye from a mile away. The dual wrapper utilizes the maduro and Corojo leafs that were used on the original Edge releases. Beneath, a Honduran binder can be found with vintage long-fillers from Panama and Nicaragua filling out its core. Refined notes of sweet spice and leather can be found stemming from the maduro wrapper, with hints of black pepper and earth appearing as a result of the Corojo wrapper. Quantities are extremely limited for this 10-year anniversary blend, so I recommend scooping up a gaggle before everyone else discovers the gold mine.​Great news, Rocky Patel The Edge A-10 has received a well-deserved 90-point rating, noting: "First puffs of wheat and tea become increasingly intense as the cigar burns, with sweet cedar and spice emerging later."

They’re not short...they’re vertically challenged.According to the man himself, Rocky Patel Edge B52s were made to accommodate the man who wants that big taste but doesn’t have a whole lot of time. They’re short (4 ½ inches) and stout, but no less flavorful and intense than their full-height counterparts. It’s the Edge experience you know and love...miniaturized. Rocky Patel Edge B52s come with your choice of wrapper leaf: a dark, oily maduro or an ultra-robust Corojo. In both cases, the double binder duo hails from Nicaragua and Honduras, and the filler is top secret. One thing Rocky did reveal is that the filler mix includes a dose of Panama ligero, and the overall character is medium to full in body. Flavorful, impactful, and easily enjoyed in a hurry, this is just what you need for those harsh winter months ahead.

A whole new side of The Edge.Since its inception, Rocky Patel’s The Edge has taken the market by storm. Refined yet punchy, smooth and suave but oozing with character and hearty spice, The Edge has no counterpart. Now after countless tests and years of experimentation, there’s a new member being welcomed to The Edge family, and it’s fresh out of the barrel.The bourbon barrel, that is. A Habano wrapper covers a long-filler blend of Nicaraguan and Honduran ligeros, a goodly portion of which was aged patiently in barrels once containing tasty bourbon. This extra step in the creation adds a noticeable layer of flavors to the eponymous Edge profile. The Edge Barrel-Aged starts with a medium-bodied profile which slowly build in intensity, and pumps out notes of charred oak, caramel, pepper, earth, and leather. It’s not often a blend as good as The Edge is improved, but innovation is one of the main reasons Rocky Patel sits at the top of the heap.

A well-aged powerhouse from Rocky Patel and company.The Edge Candela by Rocky Patel cigars is waiting, so get your favorite chair ready. Comprised of a dazzling array of superior, aged premium tobaccos including ample Hondurian Ligero and wrapped in a beautiful Candela wrapper, Edge Candela allows one to realize the combined blending and cigar-making skills of Rocky Patel and Nestor Plasencia. The Edge Candela is no doubt one of the stronger cigars on the market. Ho​wever, the power is controlled, the strength extraordinarily well-balanced, the flavor extremely smooth - a feat for any blender crafting such a full-tilt blend. The mature, crisp flavors coalesce at just the right moment, allowing you to gradually appreciate the complexity and strength of the cigar, as opposed to being simply overpowered by a potent blow to the palate. In the end, you're left with a full-flavored blast of spicy, well rounded accents that will fully entertain the most veteran of palates.

​Enjoy the gentler side of Edge cigars.Many have fallen in love with Rocky’s original Edge, a full-throttle blend that combines an aggressive, full-bodied strength with perfectly balanced flavor. However, for most of us pedestrians this is not an everyday cigar. That’s why Edge Connecticut cigars were created.Crafted for those seeking big-time flavor without the knockout punch, Edge Connecticut combines a robust blend of Honduran-grown ligero – the same tobaccos used for the original Edge cigar – inside a silky Connecticut shade wrapper that’s super smooth. This wrapper tames the beast inside, issuing a smoother, creamier blend but retaining the complex layers of flavor that made it so popular.Good news! Rocky Patel The Edge Connecticut has earned a well-deserved 91-point rating, noting: "A sweet and spicy double corona with hints of citrus and a floral finish. The smoke is dense in texture and the cigar draws quite consistently."
Shapes: Double Corona, Gordo, Robusto, Toro, Torpedo

desc: A well-aged powerhouse from Rocky Patel and company.The Edge Corojo by Rocky Patel cigars is waiting, so get your favorite chair ready. Comprised of a dazzling array of superior, aged premium tobaccos including ample Honduran Ligero and wrapped in a spicy, mucho-robust Corojo leaf, Edge Corojo allows one to realize the combined blending and cigar-making skills of Rocky Patel and Nestor Plasencia. The Edge Corojo is no doubt one of the stronger cigars on the market. Ho​wever, the power is controlled, the strength extraordinarily well-balanced, the flavor extremely smooth - a feat for any blender crafting such a full-tilt blend. The mature, crisp flavors coalesce at just the right moment, allowing you to gradually appreciate the complexity and strength of the cigar, as opposed to being simply overpowered by a potent blow to the palate. In the end, you're left with a full-flavored blast of spicy, well rounded accents that will fully entertain the most veteran of palates. Edge Corojo has received an impressive 90-rating, noting: "this torpedo burns and draws evenly, with wood, caramel and cocoa flavors. The finish is dry and long with a hint of pepper."
Shapes: Double Corona, Gordo, Robusto, Toro, Torpedo

desc: Newsflash: Rocky Patel Knocks Off Own Brand!If you can’t beat him, join him! Or... be him already? Yes, this just in, after Rocky Patel's famous Edge brand has been knocked off more times than I can count, Rocky Patel himself decided to get in on the action. That's right, the official Rocky Patel The Edge "Counterfeits" are here. How can a man counterfeit his own cigar? Don't ask questions! Rocky Patel The Edge Counterfeits take the same ultra-flavorful, full-bodied powerhouse blend as Edge and simply produces the cigar in Nicaragua, instead of Honduras. Sounds crazy I know, but once you try one of these, you'll soon be grinning from ear to ear. The Edge Counterfeits offer the same characteristically powerful, full-bodied flavor, with a remarkably well-balanced character. If you like The Edge cigars, you should jump on The Edge Counterfeits ASAP - same great flavor at a fraction of the regular price!

A Fuma Free-For-AllThree of Rocky Patel’s best-sellers can NOW be yours for as low as $2.00 per cigar. This probably has you thinking, “Holy s**t! What’s the catch?” No catch, my good man. These three Fumas blends are ‘Cuban Sandwich’ versions of their namesakes, and are each crafted with the trimmings of those much more expensive blends. But considering the massive amount of cash you’re saving, and how damn similar the taste is, there’s really no reason to complain. You’d be wise to get in line now, ‘cause these are gonna fly. A bold, well-balanced flavor profile. These are available in three different wrappers: a spicy, mucho-robust Corojo leaf, a super-rich maduro that’s dark and glistening with oils, or a hearty Habano option that's rife with Cuban-esque character. Refined strength combines with a full-bodied flavor profile, which offers up plenty of spice and complexity for each variety.​

Didn't lose an 'edge'.Edge Habano cigars represents the next chapter in Rocky Patel's 91-rated Edge saga. Known as some of the industry's most full-tilt, yet well-balanced blends, the Edge Habano had some pretty big shoes to fill. But the good news is, it doesn't ju​st fill them, it stomps around in them like no tomorrow. Marking the first Edge to utilize purely Nicaraguan tobaccos, each Edge Habano shows up well-equipped for a full-flavored ride. On the outside awaits a dark and feisty Nicaraguan Habano wrapper, patiently aged and fermented. This leaf conceals a rich and powerful core of long-filler tobaccos hailing from the volcanic black soils of Nicaragua's most fertile regions. Together this recipe strikes up a bevy of bold yet refined flavors. Notes of cedar, spice, black pepper, cocoa, and earth mingle in this uber-smooth, full-bodied blend. Put this one in the books - Edge Habano cigars are winners.Rocky Patel Edge Habano received Top 25 honors for 2015 (#7 overall) and a well-deserved 94-rating noting: "The countrified blend is spicy and woody, smacking of hickory and leather."

A well-aged powerhouse from Rocky Patel and company.The Edge Maduro by Rocky Patel cigars is waiting, so get your favorite chair ready. Comprised of a dazzling array of superior, aged premium tobaccos including ample Honduran Ligero and wrapped in a dark and oily Habano maduro leaf, Edge Maduro allows one to realize the combined blending and cigar-making skills of Rocky Patel and Nestor Plasencia. The Edge Maduro is no doubt one of the stronger cigars on the market. Ho​wever, the power is controlled, the strength extraordinarily well-balanced, the flavor extremely smooth and super-rich - a feat for any blender crafting such a full-tilt blend. The mature, crisp flavors coalesce at just the right moment, allowing you to gradually appreciate the complexity and strength of the cigar, as opposed to being simply overpowered by a potent blow to the palate. In the end, you're left with a full-flavored blast of spicy, well rounded accents that will fully entertain the most veteran of palates. Edge Maduro has received a well-deserved 92-rating, noting: "A mini torpedo with a strong earthy, salt-and-pepper smoke that also leaves notes of hickory and molasses on the palate."
Shapes: Double Corona, Gordo, Robusto, Toro, Torpedo

desc: We're living on the Edge! Rocky Patel has been the deserved recipient of a ton of awards and accolades from cigar critics over the years. The man takes seriously the attention to detail required to create memorable cigars that appeal to cigar lovers up and down the taste spectrum. One of his most popular offerings is the hearty, 91-rated Edge Sumatra. Nicaraguan long-fillers are snugly held together by an oily Ecuadorian Sumatra wrapper, for a spicy and woody finish to what is one of Rocky’s most flavorful cigars. This complex cigar is a must try for anyone that appreciates the unparalleled craftsmanship that Rocky Patel stands for.Rocky Patel Edge Sumatra has received a 90-rating and two 91-ratings, noting: "strong and spicy, with wood and ground pepper notes."

Rocky celebrates a milestone.Rocky Patel celebrated 15 years in the cigar industry with a blend (15th Anniversary) many said he wouldn’t be able to top…well it may have taken him 5 years, but top it he did. Celebrating 20 bountiful years, Rocky Patel’s 20th Anniversary line sets a new standard with perfect balance and complex character. A treat for the senses, the 20th Anniversary is a gorgeous cigar coming dressed in an elegant Honduran wrapper containing long-fillers from Honduras and Nicaragua. With premium, flavorful tobaccos and sporting a perfect box-press with expert construction, the 20th Anniversary has the all makings of a legendary cigar. Your palate will be dancing with flavors of leather, espresso, cinnamon, mocha, earth, wood, pepper, and light spice.  The 20th burns slowly and allows you to savor the depth and richness of flavors, setting the table for a truly memorable cigar, one worthy of celebrating a 20th anniversary.Rocky Patel Twentieth Anniversary received an impressive 90-rating, noting: "The oak and hickory character of this box-pressed robusto is enlivened by a spicy cinnamon zing, tough of graham cracker and mineral finish."

Rocky Patel turns 20… again? At this point, I think the Rock has turned 20 two and a half times… but as long as he keeps gifting himself delicious birthday presents like the Rocky Patel Twentieth Maduro, I won’t complain! The latest in a long line of anniversary and celebratory releases from the man, the myth, the legend, Rocky Patel himself, Twentieth Maduro is a rich and redolent cigar that’s ripe with flavor. A box-pressed and oily Maduro that reminds me of CAO Flathead and Rocky Patel Sun Grown Maduro (two 95-rated blends, mind you), Rocky Patel Twentieth Maduro immediately impresses. Consisting of the same Honduran binder and Nicaraguan and Honduran long-filler, Twentieth Maduro delivers a beautiful and complex mixture of coffee bean, dark chocolate, rich tobacco, and natural, creamy sweetness.

’79 – a most fine Vintage indeedChoosing a favorite Rocky is no easy task, but if you pushed me, I’d lean towards the Vintage family. One of the cigars that helped put Rocky on the map, the “Vintage” series features tobaccos aged for over a decade, and the results are nothing short of excellent. But nothing could prepare you for the masterpiece at hand today: Rocky Patel Vintage 1979. Yeah, you read that right: 1979. This cigar features a gorgeous, silky-smooth genuine African Cameroon wrapper leaf first cultivated 40 years ago. Don’t believe me? Taste one for yourself and you’ll be quickly convinced. The amount of delicate sweetness and subtle spice that pours out with every puff on this gem is the type of flavor you can only get from expertly aged leaf. As for the performance? Don’t worry about it. Every one of these cigars that I gobbled down (I mean… sampled) delivered a razor-sharp burn line and a smooth, buttery draw that was oh-so-appealing. I won’t lie: these boxes are going to set you back a pretty penny. But for a cigar this rare and delicious, it’s worth every red cent.

Rocky Patel Vintage, A masterpiece.In the "cigar community" (is it me or is there a "community" for everything these days?), Rocky Patel's Vintage Series of cigars have been blazing hot. For good reason. This Vintage '90 blend is nothing short of masterful: complex and smooth, with layer after layer of deep box-pressed flavor. With these beauties, the wrapper tobacco is the key ingredient. In fact these wrappers are incredible. Let me explain:Vintage 1990 is a blend of Dominican and Nicaraguan Ligero draped in a tantalizing natural Broadleaf wrapper from Honduras. It's medium-bodied and box-pressed with a really enjoyable, complex smooth-rich flavor. To accompany its spot within the world's Top 50 Cigars, Vintage 1990 received a '93' and '92' rating! "A pressed, attractive cigar with great oils and nice color. It's nutty, earthy and sweet, with a medium to full body. A finger burner."
Shapes: Belicoso, Churchill, Gordo, Perfecto, Petite Corona, Robusto, Toro, Torpedo

desc: Rocky's bread and butter.In the "cigar community" (is it me or is there a "community" for everything these days?), Rocky Patel's Vintage Series of cigars have been blazing hot. For good reason. This blend is nothing short of masterful: complex and smooth, with layer after layer of deep box-pressed flavor. Offered in 2 styles, Vintage 1990 and Vintage 1992. With each, the wrapper tobaccos are the key ingredient. In fact these wrappers are incredible. Let me explain:Vintage 1992 boasts the identical Nicaraguan and Dominican ligero long-fillers as the 1990, with the variation being very dark 10 year old Ecuadorian Sumatra wrapper. It's medium-bodied and box-pressed with a creamy, nutty, and full flavor.Great news! Rocky Patel Vintage 1992 received a 91-rating, noting: "A thick, medium-bodied cigar full of coffee and earth. It draws and burns evenly, taking on licorice flavors and a woody finish."
Shapes: Churchill, Corona Gigante, Gordo, Perfecto, Petite Corona, Robusto, Toro, Torpedo

desc: Complete the Vintage cigar trilogy!Capitalizing on his unrivaled success of the 93-rated Vi​ntage '90 and '92 series, Rocky has created the Vintage '99 cigar, a tasty, subtle-bodied morsel coated with a silky Connecticut shade wrapper. The '99 Connecticut uses an exquisite 7-year-old Connecticut leaf to tame his award-winning mixture of 8-year-old Dominican and Nicaraguan long-leaf ligeros. The result is a hearty, slightly spicy cigar with creamy notes of earth and toasted wood. Enjoy this mellow change of pace from Senor Patel, a choice cigar to pair with your morning cup of coffee or w​orkday commute.
Shapes: Churchill, Cigarillos, Gordo, Gran Rothschild, Perfecto, Petite Corona, Robusto, Toro, Torpedo

desc: A new decade of Rocky Patel Vintage cigars.Rocky Patel's Vintage Series is his bread and butter. They're the cigars that put him on the map years ago. And even today, they continue to wow c​ustomers - new and old alike. There's a reason why these heralded handmades have scored so highly, on so many occasions - with ratings reaching as high as 93-points. Because, well, the cigars are simply exceptional. And now, the Rocky Patel Vintage cigar saga continues. This round features a dark and oily 8-year-aged Cameroon wrapper overtop a robust blend of Nicaraguan and Dominican long-fillers that are equally well-aged. Flawlessly constructed, this medium to full-bodied handmade delivers a serious array of flavor including notes of cedar, black pepper, coffee, and a caramel-like sweetness on the finish. It's got some oomph, it definitely has plenty of flavor, and it's smooth and well-balanced too. Yet another feather in RP's now-overloaded cap.Rocky Patel Vintage '03 Cameroon received a well-deserved 92-rating, earning a spot in the Top 25 Cigars of 2017. The reviews noted, "Its melange of Dominican and Nicaraguan tobaccos serve to showcase and exalt the rare wrapper, which is delightfully sweet-and-sour in character."
Shapes: Churchill, Gordo, Petite Corona, Robusto, Toro, Torpedo

desc: A new Vintage? That's right! The Rocky Patel Vintage line is one of the finest collections of premium cigars on the market. From the rich and sultry Vintage '92 to the buttery-smooth Vintage '99, each of these handmades is crafted with the utmost attention to detail and quality. Today, a new "Vintage" joins the fold with the Rocky Patel Vintage 2006 — and this San Andres wrapped cigar is a perfect addition to the lineup. The latest in the Vintage brand, 2006 San Andreas is crafted in Rocky's Nicaraguan cigar factory. Proudly donning an 11-year-aged Mexican wrapper with Nicaraguan long-fillers and a Connecticut Broadleaf binder, this charmer delivers a rich and leathery finish. Spicy, chocolatey, and expertly balanced, this is one fiesta you surely don't want to miss out on. Try Rocky Patel Vintage 2006 San Andreas today.

Thanks to minor cosmetic blemishes, Rock Patel’s Vintage 2nds cigars are a steal!It’s amazing, really, to watch the success of Rocky Patel’s new blends over the past two years. You’ve got to admire him. Initially hailed for his innovative, full-throttle Indian Tabac cigars in the late 90’s, yet just a few years later Rocky was cast aside as an outsider by most of the clubby cigar makers, the usual suspects claiming to be superior because of their “3 bazillion years in the business,” and “100 generations of family experience” in tobacco. But Rocky just kept plugging away, the hardest working man in the business – a guy who is on the road constantly, visiting even the tiniest of retail shops and working countless days in the factories of Danli, Honduras. In fact, I’ve been with him numerous times to Honduras; it is a sight to watch him relentlessly push for perfection, driving everyone in the factory nuts, single-mindedly devoted to crafting a great product. So it’s good to see things come full circle for him, garnering a slew of 90+ ratings and high praise from all who sample his blends.Particularly good are his RP Vintage cigars. And particularly special is this deal. You see, his rate of rejection is much higher than average, thus a small mountain of “Seconds” has been accumulating in the factory. These Seconds are labeled as such because they have been rejected strictly for cosmetic reasons. The wrappers are a little splotchy here or have a slight discoloration there. The blend is the same, box-pressed and aged to perfection​. You could burn them blindfolded and detect no difference. The beauty is that the price is far, far less. Just keep in mind: this is not a regular production cigar. My supply is dictated strictly by what the factory happens to have available to ship me. That’s why I recommend you act soon if you’re interested.Note: As mentioned above, supply is dictated strictly on what the factory happens to have available.​
Shapes: Churchill, Perfecto, Petite Corona, Robusto, Toro, Torpedo

desc: Great things come from unexpected places.If you’re a seasoned world-traveler, or paid close attention in geography class, you may have heard of the Baku people. For the rest of us, the Baku are an ethnic group that calls the rainforests of southeast Cameroon home. If the name is new to you, try RoMa Craft’s new Baka cigar, and you’ll never forget it.The only details we were given about this mysterious cigar is that it was hand-crafted in Nicaragua and wears a wrapper leaf from southeast Cameroon. The binder & long-filler blend are undisclosed, but the RoMa Craft Baka still managed to catch quite a bit of hype upon its announcement. It lives up to that hype, too, coming in compact sizes but absolutely booming with complex, medium-bodied flavors of toasted earth, nuts, vanilla, and spice. If you’re tired of the same old tastes, pick up a box of RoMa Craft Baka, and light up one of the most unique cigars in recent memory.

An evolving, flavor-packed blend.RoMa Craft Tobac bases their business on the three T’s – Tobacco, talent, and time. They take their time in sourcing and aging the finest leaves across the globe. This, combined with expert craftsmanship, is RoMa Craft’s prescription for success in producing consistently superb blends. Their talents are put on full display with the CroMagnon line, a dark and gritty offering that’s easy to get behind.This 3-country blend plays host to long-leaf fillers from three Nicaraguan growing regions – Esteli, Condega, and Pueblo Nuevo (a small farm located on the Honduran border). The last of which is a top priming ligero that produces a unique and savory, smoky flavor. Held in place by a rustic Cameroon binder and capped with a rich Connecticut Broadleaf maduro wrapper, CroMagnon produces bold, evolving notes of leather, pepper, and oak with thick, billowing clouds featuring a camp fire-esque quality. Excellent after a juicy porterhouse...be sure to try one for yourself.​The boutique handmade CroMagnon received a 93-rating and was named the #15 Cigar of 2016, noting: "The result is a fairly bold blend with earthy aspects of dark cocoa and nutty qualities that play off each other effectively." ​
Shapes: Corona Extra, Gordo, Perfecto, Robusto, Robusto Extra

desc: If the cigar fits, you must ‘aquit’.RoMa Craft Tobac bases their business on the three T’s – Tobacco, talent, and time. They take their time in sourcing and aging the finest leaves across the globe. This combined with expert craftsmanship is RoMa Craft’s prescription for success in producing consistently superb blends. The second addition to their heralded CroMagnon line, Aquitaine, gives the original a tune up in strength and flavor.CroMagnon Aquitaine hits the scene with guns blazing. This no-nonsense blend features the same core as its big brother, utilizing a Cameroon binder atop Nicaraguan long-fillers from Esteli, Condega, and Pueblo Nuevo. The difference lies in the uber-spicy Ecuadorian Habano ligero wrapper leaf. This high priming new addition gives Aquitaine the full body and full flavor that has been making fanatics return to the trough for years. Featuring heady notes of white pepper, earth, and a bold spicy sweetness, this is one concoction with a recipe for greatness. ​
Shapes: Corona, Corona Extra, Perfecto, Robusto, Robusto Extra, Toro

desc: A boutique beautyIn times like these, we need a cigar like Intemperance. Much like the insane propaganda of the 1920’s, the cigar industry has been under fire from government legislation and some days it seems like the U.S. is trying to make the simple act of enjoying a cigar completely illegal. With this stogie, RoMa Craft Tabac says enough is enough. It’s time to rise up, and start the contemporary intemperance movement. And there’s no better way to start, than with a premium cigar in hand. The Intemperance line comes in two distinct wrappers, and at hand today is the B.A. version. Named after the oily Brazilian Arapiraca wrapper that coats this handmade, this medium bodied blend pushes flavor to the absolute limits. Notes of tangy BBQ, charred meat, leather, and earth join a natural sweetness that’ll keep you coming back for more, time and time again. And you don’t need to worry about construction, every sample of this stick I burnt was razor-sharp. Light up the Intemperance BA, and let our government know: we’ve had it.   Good news, RoMa Craft Intemperance BA XXI has earned an awesome 90-point rating, noting; "Rolled with a dark wrapper that doesn't quite reach the foot of the cigar, this robusto has a lush draw that delivers notes of oak wood and earth before sweeter hints of caramel come through."

Mellow body, full flavorThe Intemperance line of cigars from Mike Rosales and Skip Martin of RoMa Craft Tabac is a stogie with a message. Taking artwork from the bootleggers of the 1920’s, Intemperance reminds us that the anti-cigar movement is alive and strong, and that it’s time for us to rise up together again. It’s a great message, and one we can all get behind. But, let’s be honest. We’re not here to taste the message. The good news is, these cigars actually perform exceptionally well, and are a treat any cigar enthusiast can enjoy. This mellow to medium-bodied handmade features a silky Ecuadorian Connecticut wrapper, with flavors of cream, subtle spice, earth, and natural tobacco sweetness. Intemperance EC XVIII is a movement everyone should get on board with. ​
Shapes: Belicoso, Perfecto, Petite Corona, Robusto, Short Robusto

desc: Join the rebellion.The year is 1794. Tensions are high as distillers fight the first tax levelled on a domestic product, whiskey, and George Washington himself is called on to suppress the rebellion and reduce conflict. Will the federal government solidify its authority over the colonies, or is a secession and another war on the horizon?
