This is the scene evoked by RoMa Craft’s newest creation, the Intemperance Whiskey Rebellion 1794, with flavors just as bold as the distillers fighting to keep their liquid gold tax-free.The front lines of the Whiskey Rebellion are fortified by a meticulously created filler blend from Nicaragua and the Dominican Republic. Backup is provided by an Indonesian Besuki binder, and a tenacious Ecuador Habano Ligero wrapper leads the charge to a resounding success. This is a full-bodied cigar for anyone with a fighting spirit, which lives up to its name with notes of spice, caramel, leather, and earth and a heavy finish. Grab a box of RoMa Craft Intemperance Whiskey Rebellion 1794 today, and join the fight for freedom!
Shapes: Belicoso, Perfecto, Petite Corona, Robusto Extra, Short Robusto

desc: This cigar will take you backCalling all full-bodied cigar lovers. Get in here now, cuz we’ve got the newest RoMa Craft, and if my experience tells me anything, it’s that these boutique boomsticks are gonna go fast. Billed as the strongest cigar from RoMa Craft to date, Neanderthal is a dark, toothy blend that tastes like a dream. Similar to CAO’s 95-rated Flathead this cigar has… well, a flat head. A punch or a sharp blade will open it up nicely, and once it’s lit, this thing burns like an absolute champion. Anything I write here won’t do it justice, you’ve gotta hold one of these in your hand to really feel the weight and density of this stick. Flavors of leather, earth, burnt coffee, cedar, and a healthy dose of spice abound. The only thing that makes this cigar better? A cold glass of bourbon, and I’ll leave that part to you.

Call 505 for NicaraguaA one-hit wonder is impressive. A dynasty is in a league of its own. And at this point, it’d be hard to call Romeo y Julieta anything other than a “dynasty” brand. Seriously, take a look at this list, RyJ’s got it all — Cuban roots. Amazing, smooth blends. Recent, full-bodied successes. And now, a Nicaraguan puro from Nicaragua. That’s right, this is what you’ve all been waiting for.Now listen, I know you’re not supposed to judge a book by its cover, but sometimes you can’t help yourself. And Romeo 505 Nicaragua clearly comes dressed to impress. A gorgeous Habano seed wrapper is expertly box-pressed over Nicaraguan binder and filler. Chow down on this treat and you’ll find a full-bodied mixture of earth, coffee, spice, and slight nuttiness. After a few of these, you’ll realize why everyone’s calling it one of the best Romeos around. Good news, Romeo 505 Nicaragua has recently received a well-deserved 91-rating, noting: "A gorgeous Churchill wrapped in a dark, oily cover leaf. The sweet, cedary smoke also shows savory notes of leather with hints of roasted nuts and black pepper."

prod_name: Romeo ANEJO by Romeo y Julieta
desc: Romeo shows his ageFor 14 decades, 140 years, Romeo y Julieta has represented one of the finest names in premium cigars. From their beginnings as a humble brand in Cuba, to their current status as a household name across the world, Romeo y Julieta has only improved with every year that’s passed. Today, we shine the spotlight on one of Romeo’s fullest-bodied offerings to date: Romeo Anejo, a 91-rated blend handmade in the Dominican Republic. Featuring a four-country blend of fine, hand-selected tobaccos, Romeo Anejo starts things off with a toothy and thick Connecticut Broadleaf maduro wrapper. Holding everything together is a Dominican binder overtop Nicaraguan and Honduran long-fillers. From the word go, this cigar delights with rich notes of cedar and sweet tobacco. It’s a fine blend from a fine brand, and one that should be a no-brainer for any cigar enthusiast worth their salt. Romeo Anejo has received a stunning 91-rating, noting: “An easy draw delivers lots of earthy, woody smoke to the palate.”

Known around the world for their mellow and satisfying cigars, Romeo y Julieta is easily a household name by this point. But it’s time for their story to get a bit more interesting. The Romeo by Romeo y Julieta is an awesome twist to this popular classic. Made with some of the finest and rarest tobaccos available, Romeo by Romeo is a full-bodied and robust cigar unlike any RyJ you’ve had before — and it’s one you don’t want to miss out on. A dark Ecuadorian Habano wrapper is handpicked for each cigar, guaranteeing rich color and full-bodied taste. Expertly applied to a Dominican binder and long-filler leaves, this complex stick booms with black and red pepper spice, chewy leather notes, and heaps of dried fruit. A balanced cigar to a “t”, Romeo by Romeo deserves serious consideration from any cigar enthusiast.Great news! The Romeo by Romeo y Julieta was given an astounding 94-rating, and was named the #3 Cigar of 2012. The review noted, “ a truly balanced cigar that convers the sweet, salty and spicy spectrum with elegance and strength.”

prod_name: Romeo San Andres by Romeo y Julieta
desc: Romeo – back in black! For years, the Dominican Republic based Romeo y Julieta brand stayed small. Not necessarily in their popularity – this brand has been a mainstay in humidors for decades. But in their offerings. Carrying only a few classic Cuban sizes, RyJ was content to let their popular 1875 line drive home almost all the sales. A few years back, though, Romeo y Julieta introduced the ROMEO by RyJ concept – a slightly confusing name, but one which signals that the cigar under it is a more modern, complex cigar than the brand’s standard fare. Today’s Romeo San Andres joins that family. Blended and made by A.J. Fernandez in Esteli, Nicaragua, Romeo San Andres is a dark and toothy powerhouse, featuring a Mexican San Andres wrapper leaf overtop choice Dominican and Nicaraguan long-fillers. The profile is dense and rich, offering up lots of chocolate, charred oak, and slight hints of earth and black pepper. It’s not your traditional Romeo fare, but if you like the cigars Nicaragua is producing today, I think you’ll quickly come to love this one.

The most famous of the Romeo y Julieta cigars: 1875.From their humble beginning making Cuban cigars, to their more modern blends made in the Dominican Republic, RyJ cigars are always in demand. And none more so than 1875. With a slightly oily Indonesian wrapper and Dominican binder and long-filler, this pleasant-tasting cigar offers perfect balance. Not overwhelming, yet very satisfying. Toast the foot, and you’ll find a medium-bodied profile of cedar and earth, with an easygoing draw and nice, slow burn. And after you try just one of these, I guarantee you’ll find that this ever-popular offering from Romeo y Julieta is one of the finest in the business. Around here, 1875 cigars go quickly, so order soon. Good news! With an esteemed 92-rating, 1875 is officially one of the best Romeo y Julieta cigars around. The Romeo y Julieta 1875 review states, “It has a heavy aroma and a clean, white ash. Strong, toasty flavors smack of wood and leather. There’s a sweetness to the long finish.”
Shapes: Belicoso, Churchill, Cigarillos, Lancero/Panatela, Petite Corona, Robusto, Toro

desc: A legendary brand, miniaturized!Romeo y Julieta is a name every cigar smoker knows, no matter their location or experience level. A lot of us can say that one of our first cigars wore the famous Romeo y Julieta band, and they still proliferate in humidors all over the world. The most popular and most-awarded line from Romeo is the 1875, and for good reason! Excellent construction, flavorful Indonesian wrappers, and expertly blended Dominican fillers make for a great experience, but unfortunately, sometimes the amount of time you have isn't quite sufficient to enjoy a full stick. Now with the 1875 Cigarillos, that issue is a thing of the past. 4 different sizes to choose from, all full of the delicious flavors you know, and sized right for quick enjoyment. I already said they were very popular, but I'll say it again just to emphasize: These go quick, so stock up today!

A new day for Connecticut.If you’re a fan of Connecticut-shade wrappers, you’re probably used to seeing them come from either the Connecticut River Valley or grown under the natural cloud-cover of Ecuador. Now, compliments of Rafael Nodal and Nestor Plasencia, you have the rare opportunity to try a cigar wrapped in the first Nicaraguan-grown Connecticut seed tobacco. Ever. Introducing: The Romeo y Julieta 1875 Connecticut Nicaragua.With the Romeo y Julieta 1875 Connecticut Nicaragua, you’re in for a never-before-tasted experience of the smooth, creamy notes typical of Connecticut-shade leaf with an extra dimension of complexity and richness that can only be produced by the black volcanic soil of Nicaragua. This cigar is a result of several years of collaboration and experimentation from two of the top-names in cigars, with Rafael Nodal handling blending, and all tobacco grown by Nestor Plasencia. It’s not every day an all-new wrapper varietal hits the market, so grab a box today and be among the first to try!

Welcome to Esteli, Romeo!If I have to tell you how popular Romeo 1875 is, you’re either real green around these parts, or you’re living under a rock. One of the most successful Cuban-roots brands, Romeo y Julieta has been delighting cigar aficionados both old school and hipster for years now with its ties to old Havana. Delivering a consistently well-made product at a price that doesn’t break the bank, it’s no reason there’s a love story written around Romeo. Today, we welcome the newest innovation from this decades old brand… Romeo y Julieta 1875 Nicaragua. This Nicaraguan makeover is a puro, meaning it contains 100% Nicaraguan leaves, manufactured in the famed Plasencia factory. Medium-bodied, complex, and balanced, Romeo 1875 Nicaragua delivers a toasty core, with hints of spice and natural sweetness.Good news, Romeo y Julieta 1875 Nicaragua has earned an awesome 90-point rating, noting; "This oily robusto burns evenly, showing a mostly woody character with touches of graham cracker, milk chocolate and caramel. The finish hints of spice."

Anniversaries - not just something your wife nags you about.Romeo y Julieta Aniversario was crafted to cap off Romeo y Julieta's 130 years in the cigar business. And that ain't nothin' to shake a stick at, that's a hell of a long time. So when it came time to create the Aniversario, they made sure all their ducks were in a row. It all starts with an extensively fermented Ecuador Sumatra wrapper. This super-smooth leaf houses a long-filler core of Dominican, Nicaraguan, and Peruvian tobaccos before being hugged by a Connecticut Broadleaf binder. This complex array of tobaccos dishes out a similarly complex flavor profile. Slightly spicy and fairly assertive, the strength remains medium-bodied as hints of roasted nuts, cedar, leather, and a touch of earth are presented within a toasty foundation. Romeo y Julieta Aniversario earned a well-deserved 92-rating, noting: "It’s quite a cigar, rich and dark bronze with cedar, earth, licorice and nuts on the palate."

prod_name: Romeo y Julieta by AJ Fernandez
desc: AJ’s dynasty spreadsRomeo y Julieta — the OG of the cigar world. Or I guess in this case it’s an OC – an original Cuban brand that has been satisfying cigar enthusiasts for generations. Now, teaming up with industry legend AJ Fernandez, this newest Romeo y Julieta incarnation is here to make its mark on the world. Delivering a complex flavor and featuring some of the finest tobaccos in the world, Romeo y Julieta by AJ shows us a glimpse of what can happen when two legends unite. Handmade in AJ’s factory in Nicaragua, the Romeo y Julieta by AJ Fernandez features a spicy Habana 2000 Maduro wrapper and a bevy of Nicaraguan long-fillers. The result is a slow-burning cigar, rife with notes of cocoa, subtle spice, and roasted nuts. You may think Romeo is only capable of producing mellow cigars — but with Romeo by AJ, that thought should be immediately dismissed.

A dark n' delicious Romeo.When it comes to Romeo, you all know the drill by now. Relentless quality, affordable prices, and reliable handmades that deliver time and time again. The new Romeo y Julieta Media Noche holds true all that Romeo's known for, but adds in a little something extra: loads of rich, complex flavor. To create Romeo y Julieta Media Noche, a naturally fermented San Andres Maduro wrapper is loaded with a rich blend of vintage Dominican long-fillers. This combination leads to a spicy, robust profile that’s layered with toasty notes of coffee, nuts, black pepper, and honey. Delicious, brimming with flavor, and ridiculously well-made…but you wouldn't expect anything less from Romeo.​​
Shapes: Belicoso, Churchill, Corona, Gordo, Robusto, Toro

desc: Pocket-sized Romeo y Julietas!Romeo y Julieta Miniatures might be small, but these tasty cigarillos allow you to enjoy a full Romeo y Julieta experience, in a fraction of the time. Containing the same premium tobaccos as their larger counterparts, Miniatures deliver smooth, big-time flavors. The best part is, Miniatures are packaged in pocket-sized fresh-sealed tins, which require no humidification until you open them! Convenience at its finest, from Romeo y Julieta. ​White: medium to full-bodied, hearty yet smooth.Blue: mellow and extraordinarily smooth.Red: mellow to medium-bodied with a sweet aroma.

Romeo – always a gem! Since its humble beginnings in Havana, Cuba, all the way back in 1875, the Romeo y Julieta name has been a mainstay in the industry. Producing tons of classic, Cuban-inspired cigars along with a slew of new, bold innovations under their ROMEO line, RyJ continues to stay on the tip of cigar lover’s tongues in discussions of the finer things in life. Today, we proudly shine the spotlight on the newest blend to bear the Romeo y Julieta title: Perlado. Sneak a quick glance at this, and all you can say is wow. From the seamless Ecuadorian Connecticut wrapper leaf to the simply elegant white band, this cigar is most certainly jaw-dropping. And here’s the best part: this looker performs just as well. Notes of cream and slight cedar rush forth from the Connecticut wrapper, while a tri-country blend of Colombian, Dominican, and Nicaraguan long-fillers underneath round it out with naturally sweet tobacco, hints of hay, and a crisp finish. A must-try for any lover of Cuban heritage cigars or Connecticut wrapped blends, this one’s a winner.

Yet another chapter has been written to the Romeo y Julieta cigar story.     Introducing Reserva Real cigars. Like the Romeo Viejo, it's a more rich and flavorful blend than you may be accustomed to with Romeo. Adding a healthy helping of Nicaraguan long-filler to the traditional Dominican blend, you'll notice a more flavorful, heartier cigar than the 1875 line. Add an Ecuadorian grown Connecticut Shade wrapper to smooth the flavor a bit, while adding the right amount of spice to the palate to keep things interesting. Available in a slew of sizes, you're sure to find something you'll like in this line.Romeo y Julieta Reserva Real received a well-deserved 91-rating noting: "Attractive, with nice oils, this cigar has a fine draw and a spicy, chewy flavor with hints of leather. It has a pleasant, cedary finish."
Shapes: Belicoso, Churchill, Corona, Gordo, Lonsdale, Robusto, Toro

prod_name: Romeo y Julieta Reserva Real Nicaragua
desc: Back and better than ever!We’ve seen it happen in Hollywood…somebody takes an original creation and makes a sequel that kills the franchise. Luckily, that is exactly the opposite of what has occurred here! A.J. Fernandez and Rafael Nodal have come together again with amazing collaboration and developed Romeo y Julieta Reserva Real Nicaragua, a blend that some may even say, even surpasses the original Reserva Real in excellence. A year and a half in the making, the two cigar masters developed the follow up to be more complex and fuller in body than the original while still making sure it wasn’t overwhelmingly strong.   Using only tobaccos grown on A.J. Fernandez's farms in Esteli, Romeo y Julieta Reserva Real Nicaragua flaunts flavors of a distinguished puro. With a medium-full profile, one can expect notes of cedar, leather, and toast to dance across the palate, while the exceptional craftsmanship allows for a draw that is effortless, and a burn that is solid throughout, enhancing the experience. Don’t miss out on your chance to try the newest cigar from the Romeo Y Julieta collection, it will make you fall in love with the brand all over again.

A dark addition to RyJ cigars. Romeo y Julieta was one of the original Cuban cigars, beginning their legacy as a world famous brand. Nowadays, the version most are familiar with is produced in the Dominican Republic by Altadis U.S.A, the maker of other famous brands like Montecristo. At hand today? A medium to full-bodied version of the Romeo brand, the Romeo y Julieta Reserve. Utilizing a robust blend of tobaccos from Nicaragua’s fertile soils to produce a full-bodied and full-flavored profile, this one’s sure to delight. The wrapper is a dark and oily Nicaraguan leaf, which conceals a long-filler mixture of Nicaraguan and Honduran tobaccos secured by a Nicaraguan binder. The flavor is rich and robust, with earthy undertones and a smooth tobacco aftertaste. A peppery sweetness lingers after each puff, thanks to the thick wrapper. Like many of the other Romeo y Julieta cigars before it, Reserve has received a well-deserved 90-rating, noting: “This cigar is rich in color and in flavor, as its toasty smoke becomes full of coffee bean notes and hickory character without being overpowering.”

Enter the dark side of Romeo y Julieta.Romeo Reserve Maduro is the product of years of planning. This more robust line offers a complex blend of Dominican, Nicaraguan, and Peruvian long leaf filler covered by a thick Connecticut Broadleaf Maduro leaf. This bold ble​nd promotes a hearty and smooth experience full of deep, rich flavors and a pleasant aroma.Romeo y Julieta Reserve Maduro received a well-deserved 90-rating: "This thin and dark cigar is toothy. Its rich flavors are toasty, with hints of coffee bean and leather. This cigar performs well, with a long finish."

prod_name: Romeo y Julieta RyJ Nicaragua by AJ Fernandez
desc: That fresh new collaboration AJ Fernandez certainly has the Midas touch. Indeed, every brand AJ touches turns to gold, and Altadis has clearly picked up on this. Not familiar with the Altadis name? They’re the brains behind brands like Montecristo, Romeo y Julieta, and H. Upmann, and in the last few years they’ve been working with AJ to produce some amazingly delicious blends. Case in point? The Romeo y Julieta RyJ Nicaragua – another beautiful entry in this collaborative story. For this latest collaboration between Altadis, USA and AJ Fernandez, AJ utilized a beautiful Nicaraguan Habano 2000 wrapper leaf. This Nicaraguan puro is a beautifully produced powerhouse blend, delivering waves of espresso, black pepper, cedar and earth as it burns slowly to the nub. As for performance? RyJ Nicaragua delivers like a champ – but really, what else would you expect from the latest team-up of two of the world’s biggest brands?

A gorgeous little number.Romeo's Viejo is, for many customers, one of the top Romeo y Julieta blends there is. Its super-smooth, thick, slightly toothy maduro wrapper - grown in the famed San Andres Vall​ey of Mexico - features an oily sheen and triple cap, while the subtle square-press presentation feels great in the hand and adds to the anticipation. The flavor is dependable and consistent throughout: mellow and smooth from start to finish, highlighted by some richness, hints of caramel and a faint sweet woody note. The aftertaste is very pleasant, while the draw is effortless. Of the myriad Romeo y Julieta blends, to me this gorgeous little number is hands-down the best.

Those of you who know Romeo y Julieta are well aware that this is one of the most consistent brands on the market today. Originally a Cuban cigar company, Romeo y Julieta moved their production after the Cuban embargo, and continues to make high-quality cigars to this day. The Vintage series is just another example of that. Introduced in 1993, the Vintage series is a luxury cigar, subtle  with a very smooth flavor and made in extremely limited supply.The Vintage line from Romeo y Julieta is made using pe​rfectly fermented tobacco, with a wrapper hand-picked for its natural, oily sheen and silky appearance. The binder is aged Mexican leaf and the filler is exquisitely blended Cuban-seed and long-leaf Dominican tobaccos. Expect notes of cedar, a slight pepper, and natural tobacco sweetness to combine in this classic cigar blend. And you don't have to worry about keeping these sticks humidified — each Romeo y Julieta Vintage cigar box ships with its own humidification built in. Enjoy!
Shapes: Belicoso, Churchill, Corona, Double Corona, Robusto, Toro

desc: This brand might have reached a new bottom....Ron Mexico! Where to begin with this goodie-laden offering....where to begin. Well, you've got a band with a dude dressed incognito, cigar in mouth, striking a Heisman pose. WTF. Who's the genius that thought that was a good idea - can't you just picture the group of Einsteins in a boardroom somewhere dreaming up this brand and actually believing they were on to something. But I gotta tell you, if you set aside the hopelessly goofy art you've got yourself a Dominican cigar here that's all long-filler. A serviceable if unremarkable mellow, knock-around handmade. It's not going to win any awards - ever - but dadgummit it's cheap enough to burn on a regular basis and barely make a dent in your wallet.

Paying it forward, Room101 style.Matt Booth's original Big Payback release was an imposing cigar with a simple premise: a high-end cigar at an accessible price point, released as a 'thank you' from Matt to all of the fans that got Room101 off the ground. The packaging was intimidating, the name was startling, but once fans got a taste, The Big Payback flew off of shelves and into the annals of cigar history. It was a sad day when the line went out of stock, but now Matt has decided it was time for a follow-up, and time for the Big Payback to take its rightful place at the top of the heap. Introducing: Room101 Big Payback Maduro!The Big Payback Maduro comes to us from General Cigar's Honduras American Tobacco S.A. factory wearing a deep and delicious Connecticut Broadleaf wrapper. This dark & oily leaf is laid over a Connecticut Shade binder and fillers from Honduras, Nicaragua, and the Dominican Republic. The medium-full bodied, spicy flavor profile will have you sitting up and paying attention, but still exhibits smooth notes of cream, leather, and cocoa to make for a truly relaxing and interesting experience. Grab yourself a box of Big Payback Maduro, and pat yourself on the back for supporting a true master of cigar production.

For a limited time, receive FREE shipping on your entire order with purchase of select boxes of Room101 Cigars!Start your day off rightRoom101 is known for some crazy names, right? Right. Blends like FARCE and Chief Cool Arrow are just a few of their brand names, but Breakfast in Portugal? Fine, I'll bite. After a short break from making cigars, Matt Booth has returned with a vengeance, pumping some awesome new life into Room101 cigars. The cigars are being crafted at Tabacalera William Ventura in the Dominican Republic, who has been producing some of the best boutique brands to hit the market lately. Comprised of crisp, well-aged long-filler tobaccos from the Dominican, this beauty adds a flavorful Mexican binder, and is then finished with a silky-smooth Ecuadorian Connecticut wrapper leaf. Mellow and balanced, Breakfast in Portugal is the perfect way to start your day.

Good luck from Room 101.If you told me a cigar and a doll would one day meet, I would tell you to take a long vacation at the local loony bin. But that's exactly what Room101 did, because a Daruma is a Japanese doll symbolizing luck and perseverance. That aside, Room101 Daruma is a limited-edition handmade from Camacho that's well worth your time. It all begins with a golden-brown, toothy Ecuador Habano wrapper. But the real horsepower awaits under the hood, as a medley of feisty Dominican and Honduran long-fillers are hugged by a rich Brazilian binder. This well-blended bouquet pumps out a medium to full-bodied profile of coffee bean, cedar, spices, cocoa and leather. Complex, smooth and slow burning, this handmade from Camacho is downright enjoyable. ​

Get ready to meet your Doom.We’re not saying that the sky will fall and the earth will implode when you torch the newest Room101 creation, but it definitely spells doom for the competition. This cigar is the first horseman to signal the end of mediocre cigar experiences and take your palate on a ride to paradise. It’s time to make room in your humidor for the latest brainchild of luxury Renaissance man Matt Booth, the Room101 Doomsayer.Coming packed in 55-count cabinets are your choice of Habano or Maduro wrapped cigars in a single 6”x 55 size, both containing Nicaraguan, Honduran, and Pennsylvania broadleaf long-fillers cloaked in an Indonesian binder. The ‘Passive’ features a Habano wrapper from Ecuador, and the origins of the Maduro wrapper on the ‘Aggressive’ are a closely guarded secret. The flavors are spicy and bold, but still exhibit a refined smoothness that’ll help you ring in the end times with class. Grab a box of Room101 Doomsayer today, and cast lesser sticks straight into the lake of fire.Great news! Tobacco Business Magazine has awarded Room101 Doomsayer as its 2020 Boutique Cigar of the Year.

For a limited time, receive FREE shipping on your entire order with purchase of select boxes of Room101 Cigars!The FARCE is no joke! Good things come to those who wait, and in this case that good thing is the return of Matt Booth to the cigar industry. The man behind the fan-favorite Room101 blend disappeared for a few short years, but just when he thought he was out… we pulled him back in! His (re)debut blend? FARCE – the first installment in what Booth calls a “multi-blend sub brand for Room101.” Lovingly crafted in the Dominican Republic, FARCE sports an Ecuadorian Habano wrapper leaf, Indonesian binder, and long-fillers from the Dominican, Nicaragua, and Pennsylvania (home of CI HQ). This five-country blend explodes with flavor on the palate, delivering a medium to full-bodied mixture of pepper, balanced by caramel sweetness and cinnamon on the back half. Join us in welcoming Booth back to the industry, and grab yourself a handful of FARCE cigars today.Good news! Room101 FARCE - It Is a Londsdale size has been ranked by Cigar Aficionado as one of the Top 25 Cigars of 2019, and has been given a 92-rating noting, "The draw produces a dense, chewy smoke that has all the sweet and spicy character of a molasses cookie. Plenty of oaky vanilla notes emerge as well, all leading to a finish of maple-cured bacon."

For a limited time, receive FREE shipping on your entire order with purchase of select boxes of Room101 Cigars!Absurdly good.Those who pay attention to the boutique side of the industry know the name Matt Booth. He’s most well-known for creating the Room 101 brand. But a few years back, he decided to take leave from the cigar industry. Luckily, it was short lived. Last year we saw his return with the Room101 FARCE cigars which has since received a 92-point rating from the critics. In 2018, we welcomed its follow-up – Room101 FARCE Connecticut. While the original FARCE was a medium to full-bodied cigar with an exotic 5-country blend, FARCE Connecticut takes a simpler approach. It uses a golden brown Ecuadorian Connecticut wrapper leaf over Dominican and Nicaraguan long-fillers. They’re being produced in the Dominican Republic by Tabacalera William Ventura, where it seems many high quality boutique cigars are being made lately. It falls in the mellow to medium-bodied range with smooth flavors and very little bite. A great cigar for any time of day.

The hits just keep rollin'!Back in early 2018, rumors were beginning to swirl that Matt Booth was done with cigars. The creator of Room101 and contributor to some of the best Camacho and Davidoff blends out there stepped away from blending, but the cigar industry barely had time to mourn before he was back, guns blazing, announcing the release of the FARCE series. Now, just in time to close out 2019 with a bang, the third installment of the FARCE is set to take its place in your collection.Enter Room101 FARCE Maduro. The first thing you'll notice when you open the box is how well the new color scheme of the bands and box compliment the rich, deep, oily Mexican San Andres Maduro wrapper. This beautiful leaf covers a Sumatra binder grown in Ecuador, and a hand-selected filler blend composed of Pennsylvania & Connecticut Broadleaf and Nicaraguan leaves. Hearty is the word that best describes the FARCE Maduro, which will have your palate immediately captivated by medium-full bodied notes of leather, espresso, spice, and chocolate. The original FARCE earned a 94-point rating, and this third installment of the FARCE series is the best one yet, so secure your boxes while you still can!

For a limited time, enjoy an additional $10 off Room 101 Ichiban bundles! Discount is automatically reflected in prices shown below.Matt Booth knows luxury.From liquor, to jewelry, to cigars, Matt Booth is practically a walking men’s lifestyle catalog. Whenever you see the Room101 logo, you know you’re in for a treat. With their high quality products, striking designs, and eye for innovation, it’s surprising how affordable their products are. That tradition of luxury products for an economical price is taken even further with Ichiban.Room101 Ichiban Connecticut showcases hand selected long-filler Dominican tobacco underneath a smooth, sultry Connecticut wrapper. The creamy, smooth flavors make for a truly opulent experience, whether you’re kicking back and relaxing or lighting one up while you work. It’s hard to find this much quality in such an affordable package, but Room101 has you covered.

For a limited time, enjoy an additional $10 off Room 101 Ichiban bundles! Discount is automatically reflected in prices shown below.In Japanese, Ichiban means number one. From Room101, it means number one in taste.Room101 is a luxury brand with a strong fan base. Even Guy Fieri and Snoop Dogg have been seen sporting their jewelry. They make fine products for opulent lifestyles, and their cigars are no exception. Now with the introduction of the Ichiban line, it’s even easier and more affordable to show the world that you have style.The filler is an impressive blend of five year old tobacco from three different regions of Nicaragua, resting beneath a seriously attractive Habano wrapper. You’ll get notes of cedar, toast, and cream, and compliments from anyone you gift one of these beautiful sticks to. Grab a bundle for the great value, and the Room101 Ichiban Habano just might earn a spot in your regular rotation.

For a limited time, enjoy an additional $10 off Room 101 Ichiban bundles! Discount is automatically reflected in prices shown below.Matt Booth has an eye for quality, and Room101 will earn a place in your humidor in no time.Titanium rings, gold jewelry, fine threads… Just a few of the reasons Room101 is synonymous with luxury and elegance. Many celebrities have been seen sporting Room101’s jewelry or burning their cigars, and now you can be among them. But don’t fret! You don’t need to empty your bank account to join this exclusive club, just pick up a pack of Room101 Ichiban Maduro!Made in the Dominican in the same factory as many of the heavyweights in the cigar industry, this beautiful Connecticut Broadleaf cigar will please any fan of the dark, toothy wrapper leaf. Mellow-bodied and well-made, these lovely maduro-wrapped cigars contain the perfect proportions of Dominican and Honduran long-fillers, with a rich habano binder sandwiched between. Your taste buds, your wallet, and your reputation will all be singing the praises of Ichiban when you get your hands on a bundle.

Third time’s a charm.Now that isn’t to say that the first two weren’t, but this addition is flat out tantalizing. Initially launched in 2013, a second addition to the Master Collection lineup was released the year after. Thought of by many to be the best cigars that Matt Booth, (owner of Room101), had crafted to date, the third and final addition is poised to surpass both of its predecessors.  Master Collection III makes use of a golden brown, Ecuadorian Habano wrapper leaf on top of a refined Dominican binder hugging a collection of Nicaraguan long-fillers. Rich notes of white pepper, buttery cream, and smooth coffee combine with excellent balance to offer a one-of-a-kind, medium to full-bodied experience.  Room101 LE Master Three received a well-deserved 90-rating from Cigar Insider noting: "Covered in a toothy wrapper, this large cigar imparts a dense and chewy smoke with woody, peppery notes, earthy underpinnings and hints of tea and licorice."

For a limited time, receive FREE shipping on your entire order with purchase of select boxes of Room101 Cigars!She don’t lie, she don’t lie, she don’t lie…If you’re a cigar fan, Matt Booth is good company to keep. But if you’re his competition, the man is as cold as Tony Montoya in pursuit of his green card. Matt’s like a modern-day Midas, every project he gets his hands on turns into pure gold. Or in this case, white gold. The Room 101 Miami Snow is the latest in a trio of limited edition offerings from the brand, and takes the spot of the mellowest of the three.AJ Fernandez crafts these beauties in Nicaragua out of a long-filler blend of choice Habano seed long-filler and binder leaves, carefully secured by a golden, gleaming Ecuador Connecticut wrapper leaf. This single-size 6” x 50 toro coats your palate in classic Connecticut flavors with a touch of extra spice. Sweet cedar, nuts, and cream are joined by a bit of pepper, and CI’s low prices will surprise you more than, well, snow in Miami! Snow at this time of year is bound to not last long, and so is the case with the Room 101 Miami Snow. Grab a box, they’ll go quicker than a snowman in the Sahara!

For a limited time, receive FREE shipping on your entire order with purchase of select boxes of Room101 Cigars!Strapped to the gills and bringin’ the heat!Check out this latest release from Matt Booth, the luxury goods Renaissance man behind the Room101 brand. We’ve been impressed by his delicious yet surprisingly affordable handmades before, but he brought the big guns for this release. Crafted at the AJ Fernandez factory in Nicaragua, this powerhouse blend is part three in a trio of limited edition Room101 blends to land on the sunny shores of CI Nation. The Muzzle Loader is your ticket to the gun show, and I’m not talking about Matt Booth in a t-shirt. I’m talking about a medium-full bodied blend of Nicaraguan and Mexican long-fillers, secured by a Nicaraguan binder inside a Habano wrapper from Ecuador. I’m talking about creamy, rich notes of leather and wood from a perfectly constructed 6” x 60 gordo. Most importantly, I’m talking about the next cigar you’re going to need in your humidor. Grab a bundle of Room101 Muzzle Loader today before the stores run dry.

Perfect For the Cigar Enthusiast's Sweet ToothIndianHead cigars are here, and if you haven’t tried one yet, you better step to it ASAP son! Overseen by Jose “Jochy” Blanco, IndianHead Tobacco is bringing an awesome mix of innovatively unique cigars and redefined classic brands to the table. With Rough Riders, IndianHead celebrates motorcycle culture, and delivers a badass handmade that any cigar enthusiast can enjoy. Assembled under Rough Rider Sweets are four classic sizes of Ecuadorian-wrapped Connecticut handmades that each feature a slightly sweetened tip. Though the name is Rough, this one’s smooth as silk, delivering a creamy mixture of honey, sweetness, and a slight cedar note. Though some sweetened tip cigars try to hide low-quality tobacco in the mix, this one’s all long-filler, and all Cuban-seed. You could have renamed Rough Rider Sweets to Smooth Sailers and no one would have blinked an eye. ​

A great deal on these popular rum treats.If I could pick an ideal place to enjoy a cigar, it would be on the beach, with a drink in my hand. Well, I’ve got great news for you. No, I can’t send you to the Caribbean, or throw some booze in with your order. So maybe it’s just good news. I can do the next best thing, though. Rum Runner Caribbean cigars have rum added to the cap of the cigar, to lend a taste of the spirit to the cigar. An Indonesian wrapper and binder are fitted around Dominican filler. Sparking up these Dominican handmades you’ll find a mellow, sweet profile. And the best part of all is that unlike a vacation to the Islands, these cigars don’t break the bank.

Now rolled in Honduras, this old Cuban brand returns once again.Re-released....again! This exquisite cigar has been around the block and back again and again. After being manufactured in Cuba, then the Dominican Republic, Honduras may have produced the best Saint Luis Rey yet. Using a hefty blend of Nicaraguan and Honduran filler, this 're-mastered' cigar maintains the rich, full-bodied Saint Luis Rey experience that so many have enjoyed in the past. Wrapped in a thick, oily Nicaraguan leaf, this smooth robust blend is a delight. Be sure to make some room in your humidor for this cool, slow burning, tasty treat.The current version of Saint Luis Rey has received a respectable 91-rating, noting: "Abundant notes of dried red fruits and berries are well balanced by vanilla bean and nougat and a touch of charcoal on the finish."
Wrapper: Habano, Ligero, Maduro, Nicaraguan, San Andres

desc: Cuban heritage meets the bargain barrelThey may not be Macanudos or Romeo y Julietas, but dont sleep on this classic, Cuban-roots brand! Originally established in Havana, Cuba, Saint Luis Rey (or SLR for those in the know) have been perennial best-sellers for years with a small but dedicated group of guys keeping these as a mainstay in their humidors. Now, you can jump aboard this decades old brand for just pennies on the dollar with SLR Estates. Made with Cuban-sanwhich fillers of Saint Luis Rey's original 91-rated best-seller, these Estates are wrapped up in a delectable Connecticut Broadleaf wrapper with a binder of the same leaf. Hailing from the Dominican Republic, you'll devour these medium to full-bodied morsels in no time.

The next generation.Saint Luis Rey is one of the few brands that continues to stand the test of time (it's a scientific fact). For over 70 years, it has firmly stood as one of the most recognizable cigar brands in the world. Now, it gets a taste of some different medicine, modernity. But unlike your Grandma who thinks she's hip because she finally bought a smart phone, Gen2 feels right. Boasting an all new formula from the blend to the packaging, the cigar all starts with the wrapper - an Ecuadorian Sumatra leaf harvested from the plant's upper most priming. Packed with nutrients, and boasting a lovely oily sheen, this toothy leaf conceals a proprietary blend of Honduran and Nicaraguan long-fillers aged for three, patient years. This results in a profile that is best described as complex. Up front you're greeted with bold notes of leather and dried fruit. As the burn progresses, touches of earth, caramel, and chocolate also enter the fray. It's good, real good. And I might not know the difference between a rabbit and a hare, but I know fans of Saint Luis Rey will be eating this one up.

An excellent draft pick by Saint Luis ReyThe newest addition to the Saint Luis Rey line up is Natural Broadleaf. Named for the Connecticut Broadleaf wrapper this sturdy stogie is covered in, Natural Broadleaf is a premium blend of Nicaraguan and Honduran tobaccos. This full-bodied linebacker of a cigar is packed with a solid body giving off heady flavors of chocolate and peppery spice with notes of wood, toasted almonds, and coffee. The smooth draw you get from Natural Broadleaf is a touchdown for sure for Saint Luis Rey.

prod_name: Saint Luis Rey Serie G Maduro
desc: Double maduro beauties from SLR.This new, full-bodied SLR blend combines a toothy, jet-black Connecticut Broadleaf Maduro on the outside with a second Connecticut Broadleaf serving as the binder. These rich tobaccos conceal a robust mixture of Nicaraguan long-fillers and promotes a full-bodied, full-flavored sensation. A complex stogie with rich tobacco flavors delivered in a smooth, slow-burning fashion.

prod_name: Saint Luis Rey Serie G Natural
desc: The lighter side of Serie G.The SLR Serie G combines a smooth, chocolate brown Nicaraguan Habano wrapper with a second Nicaraguan Habano serving as the binder. These rich tobaccos conceal a hearty mixture of Nicaraguan and Honduran long-fillers and promotes a medium-bodied, creamy and flavorful profile. A complex cigar with rich tobacco flavors delivered in a smooth, slow-burning fashion.

Ashton's finest, and most highly anticipated release....ever.After 2 years of careful blending and planning, San Cristobal has come to fruition. Skillfully handmade by Jose 'Don Pepin' Garcia, a Cuban expatriate who is quickly becoming the biggest star in the industry, San Cristobal is a luxurious cigar built for the achieved palate. It all starts in the black, fertile soils of Nicaragua. Here, the leathery, Nicaraguan Corojo wrapper used for San Cristobal is born, as well the blend's rich mixture of Cuban-seed Nicaraguan long-fillers. Carefully balanced and patiently aged, these hand-selected tobaccos present a rich, earthy smoke with complex notes of toasted wood, roasted nuts, coffee, and sweet spices. Indeed, San Cristobal is a sophisticated cigar one must truly take the time to savor.San Cristobal received an amazing 93-point rating, which commented: "This dark churchill has a pointed, torpedo-like cap. The first draws load the palate with spice, nutmeg, and cherry flavors. A very rich and balanced smoke. Body: Full"
Shapes: Churchill, Gordo, Lancero/Panatela, Perfecto, Robusto, Toro, Torpedo

desc: A different shade of San Cristobal.The 93-rated San Cristobal brand, a brand with a storied Cuban history, has been a favorite of full-bodied fans ever since its release. But now, San Cristobal shows its softer side with the Connecticut-wrapped Elegancia. Like the rest of the San Cristobal family, this new release hails from Don Pepin Garcia's heralded Nicaraguan factory. Draped in a silky, golden-brown Connecticut wrapper leaf grown in Ecuador and jam-packed with rich Nicaraguan long-fillers, Elegancia delivers a burn that's notably smooth and creamy, but still loaded with flavor. Medium in body and layered with notes of oak, pepper, earth, coffee, and cream, San Cristobal Elegancia is masterfully blended, elegant, and premium in every sense.San Cristobal Elegancia received a well-deserved, 91-point rating, noting: "Finished with a three-seam cap, this robusto draws evenly. It has savory tobacco flavors balanced by sweet coffee notes that emerge midway through the cigar."
Shapes: Churchill, Corona, Gordo, Pyramid, Robusto, Toro

desc: Stand up and cheer.The new limited edition addition to the San Cristobal portfolio once again comes courtesy of the magical hands of Jose “Don Pepin” Garcia. Since taking the cigar industry by storm, Garcia has firmly established himself as a true tobacco whisperer who channels old world Cuba in his modern day blends.Coming draped in a dark, oily San Andres osucro wrapper that has been intensely double fermented over 2 ½ years, the blend is finished with a Nicaraguan binder and long-fillers from the Garcia family farms. The blend is medium to full-bodied with rich and balanced notes of spice, pepper, coffee, chocolate, earth, and wood. This hearty and robust cigar will dazzle your palate with a smooth progression of flavors, and you’ll be returning to this blend time and time again. San Cristobal has released a new, third vitola: Eminence. A fantastic 5.7"x54 belicoso, rife with complex flavors.​

Quintessentially deliciousAshton Cigars. San Cristobal. Don Pepin Garcia. Three names that have changed the cigar industry radically over the years with their top-shelf handmades. And San Cristobal Quintessence is no different. If you haven't tried any San Cristobals yet, you're in for a real treat. I don’t know what a quintessence is, but for my money you could put this in the dictionary: “One helluva tasty cigar.” Made at the My Father Cigars factory in Esteli, Nicaragua, San Cristobal Quintessence uses an Ecuadorian Habano wrapper most excellently. Medium to full-bodied, this one coats the palate with coffee, spice, and a rich, unique sweetness that you’ll absolutely love. The Nicaraguan binder and long-fillers grown by the Garcia family put this one over the top, into the category of “must-have.” Great news - San Cristobal Quintessence was honored as one of the Top 25 Cigars of 2018 with a score of 92-points. Here's what the critics had to say, "an impressive combination of balance and character. It’s a leathery and spicy cigar but well layered with sweet notes of chocolate. The construction is remarkably good."​

A divine revelation...The fourth addition to the San Cristobal line is the Revelation. In a matter of a few years, this brand has swiftly proven their worth and built up a solid and enduring fan base. They have been in the game for less than a decade, but one taste of their cigars and you’ll quickly see why they have become one of the most popular boutiques out there.These dependable handmades are constructed in Nicaragua, under the benevolent watch of Jose “Pepin” Garcia.  San Cristobal Revelation does what the name implies....it reveals itself, slowly and enticingly. Underneath a sleek milk chocolate Ecuador Sumatra wrapper awaits a hand-selected blend of Nicaraguan long-fillers. The combination is medium to full-bodied, and gently unveils a bold flavor profile with notes of earth, leather, cedar, nuts, and spice that envelop the palate deliciously.San Cristobal Revelation received a well deserved 92-rating! Here's what the experts had to say: "First puffs of this streaky, box-pressed cigar are rich and sweet with cocoa. An underlying earthiness complements the vanilla-bean finish.."

A Dominican-made delight from a true dream-team.There have been more cigar releases resulting from collaborations lately than ever before, but this one is bound to sit at the top of the heap. Finally hitting shelves after nearly a 5-month delay is the San Lotano Dominicano, created through a partnership between two of the best tobacco producers in the world. AJ Fernandez grows some of the best Nicaraguan tobacco, and Jochy Blanco is responsible for a lot of the amazing Dominican leaf in several brands you know & love, and together they can boast countless awards, 90+ ratings, and accolades from all across the industry. Until now the two haven’t yet joined forces, but now you have the opportunity to experience what the top names in the biz can do when they put their heads together.Crafted in Jochy’s Dominican factory, the blend consists of a Cuban-seed Brazilian wrapper over a Dominican binder, and contains a carefully crafted mix of Nicaraguan and Dominican long-fillers. All of the Nicaraguan tobacco inside comes from AJ’s farms, and the Dominican is grown by Jochy. This is the first time a line of AJ’s San Lotano brand has been produced outside of Nicaragua, and the result is nothing short of extraordinary. The flavors are earthy and complex, producing notes of nuts and caramel, while the construction is everything you can expect from the skilled workers at Jochy’s factory. Now if you’ll excuse me, I’m going to stock up before they’re all gone!Good news! The San Lotano Dominicano has received an impressive 93-point rating, noting: "The toasty, woody smoke of this box-pressed torpedo blossoms with big notes of caramel, black coffee and cocoa powder before the licorice finish. A rich and satisfying cigar."

Creating superb cigars since 1904!Royal Agio is not a name that is well known in the American premium cigar markets, because it was only three years ago that they decided to venture out of the European cigar market to establish their own U.S. operations. Since doing so, Royal has expanded their portfolio significantly. Today’s feature is one of those new additions, the San Pedro de Macorís Brazil!This cigar takes a Dominican olor binder and combines it with long-filler tobacco from both Brazil and the Dominican Republic and wraps it enticingly in a sun-grown, reddish brown, Brazilian Arapiraca leaf. The result is a medium bodied flavor profile filled with notes of cedar, leather, almonds, hay, and spice that pleases the palate. Royal Agio has brought the best of their portfolio here to the U.S. Grab yours before they are gone!

Creating superb cigars since 1904!Royal Agio is not a name that is well known in the American premium cigar markets, because it was only three years ago that they decided to venture out of the European cigar market to establish their own U.S. operations. Since doing so, Royal has expanded their portfolio significantly. Today’s feature is a new addition to their San Pedro line, the San Pedro de Macorís Nicaragua!This cigar takes a Dominican olor binder and combines it with long-filler tobacco from Brazil, the Dominican Republic, and Nicaragua, wrappping it enticingly in a Nigcaraguan Habano leaf. The result is a medium bodied flavor profile filled with notes of cedar, pepper, earth, hay, and creaminess that pleases the palate. Royal Agio has brought the best of their portfolio here to the U.S. Grab yours before they are gone!

Creating superb cigars since 1904!Royal Agio is not a name that is well known in the American premium cigar markets, because it was only three years ago that they decided to venture out of the European cigar market and establish their own U.S. operations. Since doing so, Royal has expanded their portfolio significantly. Today’s feature is another new addition to the San Pedro line, the San Pedro de Macorís Sun Grown!This cigar takes a Dominican olor binder and combines it with long-filler tobacco from Brazil, the Dominican Republic, and Nicaragua, wrapping it enticingly in an Ecuadorian Habano leaf. The result is a medium bodied flavor profile filled with notes of cocoa, leather, nuts, spice, and natural sweetness that pleases the palate. Royal Agio has brought the best of their portfolio here to the U.S. Grab yours before they are gone!

Box-pressed beauties. Sancho Panza is a tremendous value at CI prices. Handmade with darker Connecticut Shade wrappers, it delivers a super smooth, pleasant blend that’s extremely satisfying. Due to the success of this blend, countless imitators have come out of the woodwork trying to replicate. Sancho Panza themselves have released a new blend now, too, to appease their adoring fans. If you haven't tried Sancho Panza yet, you owe it to yourself. And with these prices, you can pick up a cartfull without breaking the bank. Sancho Panza has received a slew of outstanding ratings including a couple of 93-point scores and also a 92. The reviewers noted: "This Colorado claro cigar has great shine and texture. The cap is perfect. It burns and draws well. The spicy smoke builds in strength, developing earthy, leathery notes."

​Gorgeous oscuros.The Sancho Panza Double Maduro is a nice-looking Honduran, made from a long-filler blend of Honduran, Nicaraguan and Dominican Piloto Cubano leaves, along with an alluring, dark, oily Oscuro wrapper. Medium to full-bodied with some spiciness.Sancho Panza Double Maduro received a well-deserved 91-rating noting: "This box-pressed corona is dark and attractive. It features an excellent draw and burn. Medium-bodied flavors are rich with a woody, nutty character. The finish has a hint of vanilla."

​A serious Sancho for a serious Sancho enthusiast!Take one puff off this Honduran handmade and you’ll instantly notice some serious power. Wrapped in a shiny, reddish Honduran-grown Cuban-seed leaf and boasting a long-filler blend of hefty Nicaraguan and Honduran leaves, this baby starts and ends with a kick, while adding a few punches in between. Balanced to the T with an assortment of rich, bold flavors backed by a little pepper, the Sancho Panza Extra Fuerte is perfect for any seasoned enthusiast and will add a great finishing touch to that hearty steak dinner.Sancho Panza Extra-Fuerte received a well-deserved 91-rating noting: "A big, pressed corona gorda with a rough cap and a silky wrapper. It has balanced flavors with a hint of caramel and cherry sweetness. The finish smacks of light spice and pepper."

​Triple Anejo, triple the flavor.Prepare yourself, steel your nerves, and behold the full-bodied morsel that lies before you, Sancho Panza Triple Anejo. This Honduran handmade will make your mouth water and knees clatter with its potent, full-bodied mix of premium tobaccos. This savory beaut features Ecuadorian Sumatra, US Broadleaf, and Brazilian Arapiraca long-fillers tucked beneath a high-priming Nicaraguan Jalapa Sun Grown wrapper. Delivering a wallop of hearty spice right from the get-go, expect to be dazzled with flavors of pepper, earth, leather, and coffee with a subtly-sweet undercurrent dotting the finish. ​

An insanely discounted handmade.This one might have you scratching your head a bit - so I'll cut right to the chase. Schizo is a brand new release from Christian Eiroa, of Camacho fame. As a part of his new product line roll-out, he released this little number. It's downright tasty, performs like a champ and is priced oh-so-right. The only catch is it's a Cuban-sandwich style cigar crafted from the remnants of his new line Asylum. But Scout's honor, you won't even notice because each Schizo pumps out a a bevy of mellow flavors. Mellow to medium in body, each Schizo contains notes of leather, natural sweetness, cream, gentle spices, and a hint of cocoa. Highly enjoyable, Schizo is a Nicaraguan puro you can puff on all day long. And at my paltry asking price you can stock up until your heart's content.

The dark side of Schizo.Since its initial release the Schizo line, from the brains behind Asylum cigars, has raised a ruckus for being absurdly affordable and downright delicious. This top-selling brand was missing something though, the yin to its yang, and with the new Schizo Maduro the picture is now complete.Schizo Maduro is made at the El Aladino factory in Honduras and features a San Andres wrapper over Honduran fillers. This blend is Cuban sandwich, meaning it’s a combination of long and short filler, but you won’t notice as this cigar has top-notch construction and releases clouds of pleasing aromas. The stick is medium-bodied and has flavors of chocolate, spice, earth, pepper, and wood making this a perfect budget-friendly blend to add to your everyday rotation.​

Any time’s a good time for a Session.What exactly is a Session cigar? Well, if you like beer as much as we do here at the offices, you might have heard of a session beer. Session beers have a relatively low ABV but are packed with flavor, so you can enjoy them all day long without crossing over into ‘irresponsible drinking’ territory or waking up with a massive headache. That’s the idea behind Session by CAO, a session-style cigar with tons of flavor and a strength level that makes for an all-day puffer. The blend features Dominican Piloto Cubano and Nicaraguan Esteli leaves for the filler, secured with a Dominican Vega Especial binder and a thick, toothy Connecticut Broadleaf wrapper. These sticks are definitely full-flavored, but medium bodied without a whole lot of pepper and without a hint of harshness. The flavors of cinnamon, earth, nuts, and chocolate work in perfect balance resulting in a stick you’ll never think twice before lighting up, no matter what time of day it is. Grab a box and have a session whenever the mood strikes. The CAO Session has been awarded a well-deserved 90-point rating, noting "There's a stark contrast between the white ash of this cigar and the dark wrapper. It's a sweet and spicy smoke that shows elements of red pepper and leather along with hints of chocolate, raisins and vanilla."

Quick, tasty, and an incredible value!Shrapnels are a great quick-fix when you're looking for the full cigar experience and don't have a lot of time. Comprised of quality, aged leaves these short cigarillos come in two varieties. The Naturals are traditional short ones offering a crisp, smooth flavor when time is of the essence, while the Sweets give you a great, sugary-sweet break from the norm. Perfect for 15 minute car rides or work breaks, these little guys rarely disappoint!

No compromises. No exceptions. Steve Saka is one of the most iconic names in cigars. Not familiar with the name? You most assuredly know his work. Originally known for his helm at the top of Drew Estate, Saka oversaw DE when they were hitting their boom with ACID cigars, and was a pivotal force in developing Liga Privada. Since then, he’s gone on to create his own boutique operation, Dunbarton Tobacco and Trust, releasing fan-favorite after fan-favorite like Sobremesa and Muestra de Saka.Today, we welcome Sin Compromiso, a cigar that Saka has called the best one he’s ever blended. And the blogs agree. Check out some Top Cigar of 2018 lists, and you’re almost guaranteed to find this one at the top. Utilizing a growing method inspired by Japanese fruit farmers, the fields Saka uses produce dramatically less yield than a normal tobacco field, but each leaf is absolute perfection. Joined by Ecuadorian binder and Nicaraguan long-filler, Sin Compromiso explodes with rich flavors of chocolate brownies, coffee, and a unique sweetness.Click Here to view the rest of the Dunbarton Tobacco & Trust portfolio

The original boy in blue.Scotland Yard, 1829. Gas lanterns, top-hats, manly mustaches, and most importantly, the constant smell of cigars wafting through the air along with the mystery and intrigue. Sir Robert Peel founded this impressive organization as the world’s first established police force, and set many of the standards for policing still in use today. As a cigar brand founded by two police officers, there’s no better brand to honor Peel’s legacy in cigar form than Protocol. And they knew a man as great as Peel deserves a great cigar.Crafted at the La Zona factory in Esteli, the Protocol Sir Robert Peel comes in one 6”x52 box-pressed toro size in your choice of wrapper: a gorgeous Ecuador Rosado, or thick & oily Pennsylvania broadleaf Maduro. Both utilize a Nicaraguan long-filler blend beneath a Nicaraguan binder, producing medium-full bodied notes of leather and spice, with toast, cedar, and leather from the Rosado wrapper, and cocoa and earth from the Maduro. Whichever wrapper you go with, you’re in for a delicious cigar from a company quickly making a name for themselves. Light one up today and tip your hat to the father of modern-day policing.

A relaxing and complex blend.Sobremesa has no exact translation but loosely refers to the time spent at the table after a meal, time spent in conversation, relaxing, drinking, and enjoying a fine premium cigar. This blend seeks to convey the feeling of enjoyment and embracing life’s simple pleasures. Sobremesa marks the return of Steve Saka, former President and CEO of Drew Estate, to the cigar industry and is the initial release under his very own company, Dunbarton Tobacco and Trust. Sobremesa hails from the Joya de Nicaragua factory in Nicaragua and pays homage to what made Saka fall in love with cigars. The blend begins with a dark Ecuadorian Rosado wrapper hugging a Mexican binder from Matacapan and a long-filler blend of Nicaragua tobaccos and PA Broadleaf ligero. Sobremesa begins with an earthy sweetness and progresses to include flavors of spice, nougat, cedar, and coffee to provide a pleasant and evolving experience. Click Here to view the rest of the Dunbarton Tobacco & Trust portfolio​
Shapes: Churchill, Corona, Corona Extra, Robusto, Toro, Torpedo

desc: A Connecticut for a new age.Steve Saka has been known to avoid clichés. For instance, when he finally caved to the pressure of making a lancero vitola, he named it #NLMTHA, for “Now Leave Me the Hell Alone.” He does things his way, so creating a mellow Connecticut-shade cigar proved to be a daunting task. Most aficionados who reach for a Sobremesa aren’t as interested in the same-old Connecticuts with their bitter, grassy profiles, so he looked to the past.Saka sampled several mainstay Connecticut cigars to come up with the blend for the Sobremesa Brulee, a cigar that’s at the same time classic and contemporary. A luxurious Connecticut shade wrapper grown under natural cloud cover in Ecuador sits atop a Mexican Matacapan Negro de Temporal binder, with a carefully selected Nicaraguan filler blend. The flavors are all classic Connecticut, with extra complexity and refinement that can only come from the high-quality ingredients hand-selected by Saka himself. Connoisseurs and casual hobbyists alike take note: the mellow nutty flavors hearken back to the glory days of Connecticut, and will be right at home in any humidor.Click Here to view the rest of the Dunbarton Tobacco & Trust portfolio.

prod_name: Sons of Anarchy by Black Crown
desc: A Redwood Original.Welcome....the official cigar of TV’s hit drama, Sons Of Anarchy. Carefully crafted with a stunning, extra-fermented Ecuadorian Oscuro wrapper and generously filled with an aged, Cuban-seed blend of long-fillers from Nicaragua, this rich, medium to full-bodied blend delivers a big, booming profile. Loaded with notes of wood, leather, sweetness, spice, and hearty tobacco notes, each silky-smooth puff coats the palate perfectly and finishes clean. It’s got just enough power to keep it interesting, but not nearly enough to overwhelm. In short, SOA is damn tasty. Factor in the iconic Sons of Anarchy artwork plus low CI price and you’re left with a veritable no-brainer. Sons of Anarchy TM & © 2019 Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation and Bluebush Productions, LLC. All rights reserved.

It takes a village, and then some.Look, we’re going to level with you. Making cigars is not easy. There’s so many different steps in the process of crafting fine handmade cigars, and each one requires specific knowledge and very skilled hands. And when you make a product that involves no machinery in any stage of production, it takes a lot of those skilled hands. Around 300, if you want to get specific. All those hands belong to hard-working members of the tobacco industry, and all of them deserve to be praised, respected, and honored. Enter Southern Draw’s 300 Hands. The 300 Hands Connecticut is the third entry into Robert Holt’s tribute to the men & women of the cigar industry, and the mellowest to date. Coming dressed in a shade-grown Connecticut wrapper is a Peruvian binder, and fillers from Nicaragua and the Dominican Republic. The smooth mellow-medium bodied profile is graced by creamy notes of peanuts, cedar, and toast, and burns smooth & straight down to the nub. If you needed another reason to purchase this amazing creation, 25% of the proceeds will go to charitable causes in Nicaragua. A great stick, a great cause, another winner for Southern Draw.

Get your hands on these LE'sSouthern Draw Cigars is a growing force in the Boutique cigar game. Most of their production comes from the AJ Fernandez factory, so you can count on some top-notch blends. At the 2018 IPCPR show, they released a pair of cigars that pay tribute to the hardworking men and women of Nicaragua. Many people say that it takes 300 pairs of hands to create a cigar from seed to shelf, so this pair of blends – a maduro and a habano wrapped option – are fittingly called 300 Hands and 300 Manos. 300 hands is the Maduro wrapped version. It applies a dark and oily Nicaraguan Maduro leaf from Esteli to an Indonesian binder. Underneath are long-fillers from Nicaragua and the Dominican Republic. No doubt a flavor-packed blend, you'll be met with rich chocolate, hints of spice, leather, some sweetness, and bready nuances. Only a limited run of these cigars were produced, but packaged in affordable bundles of ten, you don’t have to pay a premium to get your hands on these beauties.

No hablo? Manos means handsSouthern Draw Cigars is a growing force in the Boutique cigar game. Most of their production comes from the AJ Fernandez factory, so you can count on some top-notch cigars. At the 2018 IPCPR show, they released a pair of cigars that pay tribute to the hardworking men and women of Nicaragua. Many people say that it takes 300 pairs of hands to create a cigar from seed to shelf, so this pair of blends – a maduro and a habano wrapped option – are fittingly called 300 Hands and 300 Manos. 300 Manos, pronounced trescientos manos, is the Habano wrapped version. It applies a stunning Ecuador Habano wrapper leaf atop a Cameroon binder. The core is the same flavorful blend of Dominican and Nicaraguan long-fillers as its maduro wrapped counterpart. Medium to full in body, it provides notes of earth, sweet hay, cocoa, and some red pepper. Only a limited run of these cigars were produced, but packaged in affordable bundles of ten, you don’t have to pay a premium to get your hands on these beauties.

That good woodSouthern Draw Cigars is a rapidly growing boutique cigar brand that was started by a group of long-time cigar-loving veterans who set out to create custom blended cigars of the finest tobaccos with a helping hand from AJ Fernandez. This most recent release draws its name from a type of wood - Cedrus libani – which is known for being firm, high quality wood with a pleasant scent and is often used to make cigar boxes.Originally, only a total of 60,000 of these beauties were made, in a single size, and they came in individually numbered 10-count boxes. Now Southern Draw has added three additional sizes, still limited production, to meet the exploding demand for this fantastic blend. Up top is an Indonesian Sumatra wrapper coating a Nicaraguan Habano 2000 binder. The core is a blend of four different varietals – Dominican Piloto Cubano, Nicaraguan Criollo 98, Nicaraguan habano 92, and Nicaraguan corojo 99. It has a great depth and complexity, spewing out flavors of cedar, pepper, bread, some creaminess, and herbal notes. The draw is nearly perfect as it delivers an overall medium to full bodied experience. Check out a box while you still can.

For a limited time only, enjoy CI Free Shipping on your entire order with any qualifying 10-pack purchase on this page. Use code 'DRAW' at checkout.A Thorn in your humidor, not in your side.Each cigar I’ve sampled from Southern Draw so far has been nothing short of spectacular. The brand’s owner, Robert Holt wanted to focus on perfection, so he decided to create cigars in small batches and he employed the help of blend master AJ Fernandez. The result? A portfolio of absolutely stunning cigars that will absolutely blow your mind.The Firethorn blend is draped with a double-fermented Habano-Rosado wrapper with Cuban seed fillers at the core. The flavor? Glad you asked! This sweet and spicy beauty is delightful with notes of roasted nuts, cocoa, and caramel. Like all of Southern Draw’s cigars, this gem is best paired with a libation - like cream ale, pilsner, Malbec, or Syrah. Note: Southern Draw Firethorn Habano Rosado is now available in special, collector's edition jars of 10. Though one jar is black and the other is white, the cigars inside are identical. But here's the best news - for each collector's edition jar purchased, a donation will be made from CI and Southern Draw to Cigars for Warriors.

Ignite some goodFor a few years now, Southern Draw Cigars has been lighting up the boutique side of our industry. Crafting amazing, immaculate cigars with tobacco grown by renowned master blender A.J. Fernadnez, each Southern Draw blend has caught our eye, and delighted our palates. So when Robert Holt, brand owner of Southern Draw, told us he wanted to work together on a project benefiting Cigars for Warriors, we said yes before he could finish the sentence.Presented below are four entries in the “INGITE” series, each offering up a limited edition size of Holt’s best-selling cigars. But even more important than the blends is the cause — every jar of cigars sold directly benefits Cigars for Warriors, helping to get cigars into the hands of the troops. The Kudzu is a medium to full-bodied Ecuador Habano Oscuro wrapped gem, rife with Cuban-seed tobaccos and cocoa, cedar, and spice. And with Firethorn, Holt delivers a perfectly balanced Habano Rosado gem, one that pairs up beautifully with cream ales or pilsners. Join us in toasting to a great cause, and thanking Robert Holt for this great opportunity to help a cause most near and dear to our hearts, when you grab a jar of Ignite by Southern Draw today.

For a limited time, your entire order ships free of charge with any box purchase on this page, no promo code required!A shared sense of purpose.Southern Draw is at the top of their game. The family-operated boutique cigar brand has gone from obscurity to heavyweight status in the blink of an eye, and their main focus has been giving back to the community and showering their fans with appreciation. One large demographic of cigar fans that deserves our utmost respect and appreciation is our men & women in the military, and the Holts are killing two birds with one stone by pairing with the Navy SEAL Foundation for this year’s IGNITE Series.The Holts are veterans themselves, so choosing a veteran-owned charity providing services to Special Forces members and their families was a no-brainer. This year's limited edition releases come packed in 10-count jars and are limited to just 800 jars each. The bands represent the Navy SEAL Foundation, making this the ultimate collectors piece for anyone who supports those who defend American freedom every day. Act fast and grab one of these jars before they’re all gone, and give us a big HOOYAH!Private Blend #1: An Ecuador wrapper adorns a Nicaraguan binder over Nicaraguan and Dominican fillers. This 7.5” x 50 double corona features mellow bodied notes of nuts, leather, and cedar.Private Blend #3: A 7.5” x 50 double corona with character, sporting an Ecuador wrapper over a Nicaraguan binder and fillers from Brazil, Ecuador, and Nicaragua. Medium-full bodied with notes of coffee, earth, and citrus.Private Blend #4: A Honduran wrapper, dual Nicaraguan/Honduran binder, and Nicaraguan & Honduran filler make up the blend on this 5” x 50 Rothschild. The flavors are earthy and rich, with a touch of spice over smooth oak and leather.

Climbing the Ladder, one cigar at a time...Southern Draw is one of the newest brands to hit our shelves, and I have to say, bravo. Each created by AJ Fernandez in Nicaragua, so you can expect some big things from this brand. Each blend is comprised of the best tobaccos and crafted with precision.Jacob's Ladder is easily one of Southern Draw's most flavorful cigars. Best described as heavenly, this handmade treat features a Pennsylvania Broadleaf wrapper and is brimming with Nicaraguan fillers leading to notes of cedar, spice, and espresso. This delicious little gem will surely leave you wanting more — an easy contender for a "must-have" boutique box.

Don’t look down…What comes to your mind when you think of fire & brimstone? Maybe a lake of fire, maybe eternal damnation, maybe fiery atonement, but when we hear it, we can’t help but think of the latest line extension to Southern Draw’s Jacob’s Ladder: Jacob’s Ladder Brimstone. This is a cigar so bold Lucifer saves them for after-dinner, but so smooth the angels smoke ‘em for breakfast. The intensity sits a few notches higher than the original Jacob’s Ladder, but the flavors are still smooth enough to be accessible to just about any palate. The outside is the same as the original, a toothy Pennsylvania Broadleaf wrapper, but the Ecuador Maduro binder has been swapped for a heavy American-grown leaf. The Nicaraguan filler from the original is accompanied by Dominican tobacco, and a good amount of ligero was included to appease any double-ligero lovers out there. When fire meets Brimstone, you can expect a blast of spicy-yet-smooth flavors of pepper, cedar, earth, and espresso. Coming in just one 6” x 56 perfecto size, this is a cigar you won’t want to wait on. So cross yourself, say some Hail Marys, and order yourself a box of Brimstone today.

A proper thank you, from the Holt family.When Robert & Sharon Holt formed a small cigar company a few years ago, they had no idea the kind of success they would achieve. They attribute their success to wide range of factors, certainly not the least of which is the great brothers & sisters of the leaf who have been willing to give their fresh name a shot, and kept coming back for more. To say thank you, the Holts blended the Kudzu LUSTRUM to be their crown jewel, the one cigar that best shows off their highest quality tobacco and production, and kept it affordable enough for anyone to enjoy.The Kudzu LUSTRUM comes in just one 5.5” x 52 box-pressed Belicoso size, and is limited to just 2500 bundles of 10 cigars. These beauties are Nicaraguan Puros, and the lead component is the intensely flavorful Media Tiempo habano wrapper. Media Tiempo leaves are a rare part of the tobacco plant, which are very small and sprout at the top of the plant above the ligero priming. This rare leaf sits atop an Ometepe binder, and it all comes together for a full bodied profile of earth, pepper, leather, and dark fruit. This is a rare opportunity to grab a bundle of very limited edition cigars, so don’t miss out on one of the best Southern Draw cigars to date.

What's a Kudzu? I don't know, but it tastes good!Southern Draw is the new kid on the block. They’ve been around for a short time, but they’ve made a big bang due to their focus on quality over quantity. You may not have heard of Robert Holt yet, but I bet you know his partner — AJ Fernandez. Crafted in AJ's factory in Esteli, these beauties are nothing short of fantastic. Kudzu Oscuro sports a double fermented wrapper that's silky smooth, and contains a mixture of Cuban-seed and Nicaraguan long-fillers. In short, this cigar's got quite the kick. You’ll get notes of cocoa, cedar, and spice - great when paired with a fine scotch, smoky bourbon, or complex and bold IPA.Note: Southern Draw Kudzu is now available in special, collector's edition jars of 10. Though one jar is black and the other is white, the cigars inside are identical. But here's the best news - for each collector's edition jar purchased, a donation will be made from CI and Southern Draw to Cigars for Warriors.Good news! The Southern Draw Kudzu Oscuro has been honored with a 92-point rating, noting "An oily, box-pressed cigar with an even, open draw. Sweet and spicy notes of brown sugar, pepper and toffee are underscored by a foundation of nuts, wood and coffee bean."

1...2...3... Draw! Balance is clutch when it comes to pairing select beers or spirits with any cigar, something the good folks at Southern Draw Cigars know all too well. With a little help from AJ Fernandez, each of Southern Draw’s premiums were blended to pair with a certain drink - for example, Quickdraw Connecticut is best enjoyed with late harvest wines or seasonal beers. Quickdraw Connecticut is blended with Nicaraguan and Honduran long-fillers and an Ecuadorian Connecticut wrapper. Working together, these tobaccos create a bevy of mellow flavors including cedar, sweet cream, and a hint of spice. Good balance and great craftsmanship? Ladies and gentlemen — we have a winner.

Ready, set, draw!Since Southern Draw Cigars came through our doors, I’ve been enjoying them to no end. Well made with great tobaccos at AJ Fernandez’s factory in Nicaragua - I mean, what’s not to love? Each blend is produced in small batches to ensure perfection, and Quickdraw Dark Habano is no exception.Like the name implies, there’s a rustic Habano wrapper that’s dripping with oils. At the core is a mix of Nicaraguan and Honduran long leaves - this cocktail brings about nuances of espresso, cedar, and a natural sweetness. This totally satisfying premium can best be enjoyed with bolder beverages like IPA’s anise flavored liqueurs, or a nice cabernet.

prod_name: Southern Draw Quickdraw PA Broadleaf Maduro
desc: Strong, dark, and flavorfulThe good people at Southern Draw understand that pairing cigars with beer is one of the simplest, yet most rewarding pleasures in life. A nice brew and a handmade after a long day is sheer bliss. Brand Owner Robert Holt blended his cigars with the help of AJ Fernandez, and in the end what we got were an array of cigars that pair beautifully with specific libations.Take Quickdraw PA Broadleaf Maduro for instance- a full-bodied blend with an oily Pennsylvania Broadleaf wrapper and fillers from Honduras and Nicaragua beneath the sheets. This zesty little number exudes notes of black pepper, coffee, with some woody nuances. Paired perfectly with an IPA, port, or stout - this beat is positively perfection.

For a limited time only, enjoy CI Free Shipping on your entire order with any qualifying 10-pack purchase on this page. Use code 'DRAW' at checkout.Real cigars wear pinkRobert Holt, founder of Southern Draw Cigars gives his wife, Sharon a lot of credit for his success - so he wanted to say thanks by blending a cigar to pay tribute. What we got was an absolute gem that’s made from top-notch tobaccos and has striking flavor.Expertly crafted at AJ Fernandez’s factory, Rose of Sharon boasts a lovely Ecuadorian Sun Grown Connecticut wrapper with Nicaraguan and Dominican long-fillers beneath. This cigar has a subtle spice with undertones of leather, oak, and earth. Complex and memorable, this cigar will surely make Mrs. Holt proud.

prod_name: Southern Draw Rose of Sharon Desert Rose
desc: Resilience doesn’t have to cost beauty.Robert Holt gets a lot of praise for the Southern Draw cigar brand, but he would be the first to tell you that he attributes most of his success to his wife, Sharon. The pair have withstood countless challenges in the process of creating a name for themselves, but they’ve stayed resilient and never forgot their vision, “unity, charity, and service”. The Southern Draw Rose of Sharon is Sharon Holt’s cigar, Robert’s acknowledgement of the integral hand she played in getting them where they are. The newest extension of the Rose of Sharon, the Desert Rose, commemorates all of the challenges they faced along the way.Produced in Nicaragua by AJ Fernandez, the Desert Rose wears an Ecuador Claro wrapper that’s heartier and a bit more robust than the original, while retaining a silky smooth profile. The wrapper works in perfect harmony with the Nicaraguan binder and fillers from the Dominican and Honduras, and produce medium bodied notes of spice, cedar, and cream. It comes in just one 5.5” x 52 box-pressed belicoso fino size, and is limited to 75,000 sticks being produced this year. Everyone has had to overcome struggles to get where they are today, commemorate that spirit of resilience with a box of Desert Rose.

A sublime blend.Sublimes started off as small, locally produced cigar brand in 2004. Initially hand-rolled in the Little Havana section of Miami, FL, it wasn’t too long before demand outgrew supply and production had to be moved to Esteli, Nicaragua.
